Policy: Ownership of Minerals Act (R.S.N.B. 2011, c. 200).
Policy_Content: Under this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council has full powers and authority to make orders concerning the ownership of mineral resources, in particular, among others, to declare all or any minerals, whether owned by the Crown or by any other person, existing in a natural state beneath the surface of the land anywhere in the Province, or in any designated area in the Province, to be property separate from the soil; to vest in the Crown in right of the Province all or any of such minerals or any part thereof notwithstanding that all or any of such minerals or any part thereof are claimed by any person through the express words of any instrument, enactment, law or otherwise howsoever and to declare that every grant of land from the Crown made at any time heretofore shall be construed and held to have excepted and reserved to the Crown all the minerals, within the meaning of this Act, in the land, notwithstanding the provisions of any grant or instrument or of any enactment or law. The text consists of 8 sections.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy_Content: This Act amends the Radiation Safety Act in section 64 on the prosecution of offences.

Policy: Farm Improvement Assistance Loans Act (RSNB 2011, c 155).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to a farm credit programme to provide stock bonds and farm improvement loans. In particular, the Act establishes that low interest loans shall be given to farmers to improve their agricultural activities.  The text consists of 3 sections as follows: Definition of director (1); Rebate of interest to farmers (2); Regulations (3).

Policy: Emergency Measures Act (R.S.N.B. 2011, c. 147).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to emergency measures. The Act contains at the outset a definition clause relating to various terms employed therein such as, for example, “assisting force”, “disaster”, “emergency”, “emergency measure plan”, “Emergency Measure Organization”, “fire marshal”, “state of emergency”, etc. Section 7 establishes that the Emergency Measure Organization may: a) review and approve, or require modification to provincial and municipal emergency measures plans; b) make surveys and studies to identify and record actual and potential hazards which may cause an emergency or disaster, c) make surveys and studies of resources and facilities to provide information for the effective preparation of emergency measures plans; d) conduct public information programs related to the prevention and mitigation of damage by disaster. The Minister may at any time, when he is satisfied that an emergency exists or may exist, declare a state of emergency in respect to all or any area of the Province. The text consists of 25 sections.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Topsoil Preservation Act (R.S.N.B. 2011, c. 230).
Policy_Content: This Act prohibits the removal of topsoil from a site or the move of topsoil from a parcel unless with the proper permit. Under section 4, no person shall transport topsoil in, on or by a vehicle on a highway except in accordance with the regulations. The Act provides for inspections, enforcement and offences and penalties. The text consists of 23 sections.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Surveys Act (RSNB 2011, c 226).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to land survey in the province of New Brunswick. In particular, the Act sets out details of land surveying procedures. Section 2 establishes that the Service New Brunswick shall establish and maintain a system of plane rectangular coordinates for locating points on the earth’s surface. A surveyor with at least five years experience as such shall be designated as Director of Surveys by Service New Brunswick. The text – consisting of 16 sections – deals with the following matters: establishment of a coordinate survey system, director of surveys, duty of surveyor, form of report, note or plan of surveyors, power of Cabinet respecting integrated survey area, filing respecting integrated survey area plan, filing respecting amended integrated survey area plan, duty of surveyor to tie to coordinate monument, survey plan respecting integrated survey area, filing of value of coordinate monuments, lost legal monuments, power of trespass, offences and penalties and municipal agreements and advisory councils. The text consists of 15 sections and 1 Schedule.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Scalers Act (RSNB 2011, c 219).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the activities of scalers, i.e. people licensed to measure primary forest products. The Act regulates the licencing procedure, provides for the establishment of a Board of Examiners and regulates its operation. The text consists of 17 sections.

Policy: Crown Grant Restrictions Act (RSNB 2011, c 136).
Policy_Content: This Act released the restrictions made on any grant issued by the Crown prior to January 1, 1990. Restrictions may affect clear, cultivate, seat, enclose, dyke, repair or maintain dykes, improve, sow, plant, sow or plant specified crops or drain the land; dig a stone quarry or other mine or cut wood or employ labour in digging any stone quarry or other mine or in the cutting of wood; and keep or put neat cattle on the land. The text consists of 4 sections.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Executive Order No. 43, s. 2011 pursuing our Social Contract with the Filipino People through the Reorganization of the Cabinet Clusters.
Policy_Content: This Executive Order, consisting of 10 Sections establishes the Cabinet Clusters organization. The Cabinet is organized thematically into five clusters composed as follows: Good Governance and Anti-Corruption; Human Development and Poverty Reduction; Economic Development; Security, Justice and Peace; and Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation. Sections 4 deals with the respective functions of the Cabinet Clusters. Section 6 specifies the Good Governance and Anti-Corruption Cluster which shall promote transparency, accountability, participatory governance, and strengthening of public institutions. Section 7 deals with the Human Development and Poverty Reduction Cluster which shall focus on improving the overall quality of life of the Filipino and translating the gains of good governance into direct, immediate, and substantial benefits that will empower the poor and marginalized segments of society. The Section 8, on Economic Development Cluster, shall focus on the promotion of rapid, inclusive, and sustained economic growth. Section 10 establishes the Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation Cluster which shall focus on the conservation, and protection of the environment and natural resources. It specifies measures to adapt to and mitigate the effects of climate change on the Philippine archipelago and for both natural and man-made disasters. The cluster pursues the following objectives: Adopting climate change adaptation and mitigation measures by local government units and their respective communities, national government agencies, and the general public; and ensure that these are incorporated in their annual work plans and budgets, where applicable; Ensuring the utilization of natural resources for the equal benefit of the present and future generations; Formulating alternative and inclusive urban development plans, which ensure that people of varying income levels are integrated in productive, healthy and safe communities; and Undertaking all other measures necessary to prepare for and manage the risks and/or threats associated with natural and man-made phenomena such as, but not limited to, typhoons, earthquakes, tsunami, floods, landslides, civil disturbance and terrorism.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Climate change,Institution,Capacity building,Ozone layer,Emissions,Governance,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Risk assessment/management,Poverty,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia

The form and content of the state aid record book or register sheet is given in the Annex, which is part of this publication.

Policy: Loi instituant un Fonds cantonal de l’énergie.

L’article 1er de la loi susvisée établit qu’il est institué un Fonds cantonal de l’énergie. Notamment, le Fonds a pour but d’encourager l’utilisation économe et rationnelle de toute énergie ainsi que le recours aux énergies renouvelables, en application de la loi sur l’énergie. Policy: Law No. XI-1375 "On energy based on renewable sources".
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal grounds for state governance and regulation of energy based on renewable resources, supervision and control in this sector, and also establishes state rules of operation of energy distribution networks that are generating energy from renewable sources. Hydropower is the energy of the impounded water and/or flowing water used to produce electricity. Hydrothermal energy - thermal energy accumulated in surface water. The scope of this Law shall be to ensure coordinated development of utilization of renewable energy sources, stimulation of development and introduction of new technologies with the consideration of legal interests and rights of consumers related to accessibility, suitability and sufficient avaiability of renewable energy resources. Incentives for the use of renewable energy sources shall be listed as follows: (a) fixed tariff rates; (b) purchase of energy generated from renewable sources; (c) compensation of networking of renewable energy resources equipment; (d) preferential distribution of energy generated from renewable energy sources; and (e) mandatory utilization of renewable energy sources and use of biofuels.
Subject: Energy, Water
Keyword: Renewable energy,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Biofuel,Subsidy/incentive,Basic legislation,Sustainable use

Policy: Regional Law No. 121-ZO "On allotment of land parcels free of charge to some categories of citizens for individual construction and subsidiary smallholding".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes cases of allotment of public and municipal land parcels free of charge to natural persons for individual housing construction and smallholding to the following categories of citizens: (a) citizens with three or more children under 18 years of age; (b) young families, and single parents of maximum 35 years of age; (c) persons in need of improvement of housing conditions. Allotment of land parcels free of charge to the aforesaid categories shall be performed once-only.

Policy: Regulation on supervision over the development of forest economic bases.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Forest Law (Republika Srpska), prescribes rules regarding the supervision over the development of forest economic bases (a set of issues and planning document contents related to forest use and management in a sustainable and profitable manner), aimed for both state and private forests. This kind of supervision shall be conducted by the national Forest Agency. Forest-economic planning documents are projects assignment for preparation of forest-economy basis, which include classification of forests and forest land, spatial and technical rules and detailed indications on necessary forest-use economy management).

Policy: Operational Manual Guyana REDD+ Investment Fund (GRIF).
Policy_Content: This Operations Manual lays down the operating principles, guidelines and procedures for the day-to-day operations of the Guyana REDD+ Investment Fund. Moreover, GRIF will finance projects that support the implementation of Guyana’s Low Carbon Development Strategy, including investment in low carbon economic infrastructure and sectors including large-scale agriculture, aquaculture, and ecotourism; investment in development and new economic opportunities for Amerindian communities; capacity building through education and training; employment generation and providing economic opportunities to small businesses and vulnerable groups; institutional capacity building; and reforming existing forest-dependent sectors in consistency with Guyana’s low carbon vision.

Policy: Order No. 25-2-02/249 validating the Regulation on aerial surveillance for conservation and protection of forest fund.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that aerial surveillance for conservation and protection of forest fund shall be an integral part of complex arrangements for protection against forest fires, forest pests and diseases, and it shall be organized and carried out by the territorial branches of the authorized forest institution, owners of the forest fund and forest managers. Aerial surveillance for conservation and protection of forest fund shall include the following arrangements: (a) preventive arrangements for conservation and protection of forests and protected areas against forest fires, forest pests and forest offences; (b) aerial extinguishing of forest fires; (c) identification and prevention of offences related to vegetable and animal kingdom and protected areas; (d) supervision over sanitary state of forests and aerial application of chemicals for combating forest pests and diseases; (e) information and propaganda among the population.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Resolution No. 6/2011 approving the Statute of the Agency for the Development of Zambesi River Basin.

The Statute, consisting of 4 Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, created by Decree No. 22/2010, and entitled to regulate, supervise and implement development plans within the National side of the hydrographical basin of Zambesi River. This institution aims at carrying out research and proposing strategies for the socio-economic development of the National side of the Zambesi River. The Statute is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Competencies (Chap. II); Financial aspects (Chap. III); Final provisions (Chap. IV).

Policy: Disaster reduction action plan of the People's Republic of China (2006-2015).
Policy_Content: This document presents China’s disaster reduction action plan for the period 2006-2015. China has suffered some of the world’s worst natural disasters, which come in many varieties from extreme weather to geological events and cause huge losses of life and property. The purpose of this document is to improve the country’s capacity to cope with calamitous events. The main objective of the document is to formulate new disaster reduction frame work and promote and facilitate the implementation of the disaster reduction plan.

Policy: Programme d’Actions du Gouvernement pour l’Emergence et le Développement Durable (PAGEDD 2011-2015).
Policy_Content: Dans le cadre de relever les défis majeurs qui persistent en matière de développement du capital humain, de consolidation de la gouvernance, de la croissance ainsi que d’autres préoccupations transversales telles que la préservation de l’environnement et la promotion du genre, le Burkina Faso a élaboré le Programme d’Actions du Gouvernement pour l’Emergence et le Développement Durable (PAGEDD) pour la période 2011-2015. Il s’agit d’un plan sectorielle d’une portée nationale. L’objectif principal du programme est de concrétiser l’ambition du Gouvernement qui est de créer les conditions de l’émergence et du développement durable de manière à répondre efficacement aux attentes des populations. Pour atteindre ces objectifs, le programme fixe quatre orientations stratégiques à savoir: 1) la consolidation de l’investissement humain; 2) la promotion de la protection sociale; 3) le développement institutionnel et le renforcement de la gouvernance; 3) le développement des piliers de la croissance accélérée et de l’émergence; 4) les dynamiques nouvelles pour l’économie et les priorités transversales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Land & soil
Keyword: Social protection,Agro-forestry,Governance,Gender,Rural youth,Credit,Capacity building,Poverty,Food security,Fiscal and market measures,Institution,Climate change,Sustainable development,Risk assessment/management,Disasters,Cooperative/producer organization,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Pastoralism

Policy: Strategic Plan for the Development of the Agrarian Sector 2011-2020 (PEDSA).
Policy_Content: This Strategic Plan (PEDSA) presents the vision of the Mozambican agrarian sector for the from 2011 to 2020. The plan identifies strategic areas of a sector that the Constitution of the Republic of Mozambique identifies as the country's development base. The importance of the agrarian sector in the economy, society and environmental protection led the Government of Mozambique to define the Green Revolution Strategy, to sign several international commitments for the development of the sector, such as the Comprehensive Programme for the Development of Agriculture (CAADP), the Abuja Declaration and the Maputo Declaration, among others. This strategic plan for the development of the agricultural sector (PEDSA) was designed on the basis of these instruments. The pillars of CAADP (sustainable management of natural resources, markets and infrastructures, food security, and agrarian research) are clearly a PEDSA support at strategic and operational level in line with the Poverty Reduction Action Plan (PARP) 2011-2014.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Forestry, Cultivated plants, Water

Policy: Order No. 478 on model farms type 3 or similar installations.
Policy_Content: This Order lays down rules on the maximum allowable discharge of nutrients and organic material in adherence to the Environmental Protection Act, Chapter 5 of freshwater fish farms.  These rules shall apply for environmental approval of model fish farm type 3, and freshwater fish farms applying for conversion to model fish farm type 3 or similar facilities with similar cleaning efficiency, partly by already environmentally approved model fish farm type 3. A model fish farm type 3 is a fish farm that meets the requirements for cleaning measures, technical design and retention, as shown in Appendix 1. Application to convert a freshwater fish farm must be in writing and shall be submitted to the local council with evidence that the operation and design is consistent with the wording in Annex 1 or that at least the same cleaning efficiency, see Annex 2 and 3 can be obtained by another device of the cleaning measures at the farm.

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2011-504 du 9 mai 2011 portant codification de la partie législative du code de l'énergie.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance codifie les textes relatifs à l'énergie et y intègre la transposition des directives 2009/72 et 2009/73 relatives respectivement aux règles communes pour le marché intérieur de l'électricité et pour celui du gaz naturel. Le nouveau code comprend sept livres : Le livre Ier est consacré à l'organisation générale du secteur de l'énergie et forme un livre "horizontal". Le livre II comprend toutes les mesures se rapportant à une meilleure maîtrise de la demande d'énergie et au développement des énergies renouvelables. Le livre III comporte les dispositions relatives à l'électricité. Le livre IV comprend les dispositions relatives au gaz. Le livre V est consacré aux dispositions relatives à l'utilisation de l'énergie hydraulique. Le livre VI contient les dispositions relatives au pétrole. Le livre VII est relatif aux réseaux de chaleur et de froid. En conséquence de cette codification de nombreuses dispositions législatives sont abrogées dont la quasi-totalité de la loi du 16 octobre 1919 relative à l'utilisation de l'énergie hydraulique. L'abrogation de certaines dispositions est subordonnée à l'intervention de dispositions réglementaires exigées par le nouveau code.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Mediation Act, 2068 (2011).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 6 Chapters, may be called "Mediation Act, 2068. It establishes administative and legal proceedings related to any dispute that may be settled through mediation: In case, any agreement provides for the settlement of dispute through mediation, the dispute concerned with that agreement or a dispute arisen under that agreement shall be settled according to the procedure prescribed in the agreement, if any. Notwithstanding anything contained in Sub-section (1), in case, parties intend to settle a dispute through mediation which is subjudice or not filed in any adjudicating body and such dispute may be settled through compromise (Milapatra) pursuant to prevailing law, the aforesaid dispute may be settled through mediation by following the procedure pursuant to this Act.

Policy: Loi n° 2011/008 du 06 mai 2011 d’orientation pour l’aménagement et le développement durable du territoire au Cameroun.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte sur l’orientation pour l'aménagement et le développement durable du territoire au Cameroun.  Elle fixe le cadre juridique général de l'aménagement du territoire national dans une perspective de développement durable. A ce titre, elle définit: les principes directeurs de la politique d'aménagement et de développement durable du territoire; les choix stratégiques d'élaboration des schémas d’aménagement et de développement durable du territoire ainsi que des schémas sectoriels. Elle s'applique à toutes les opérations relatives à l’occupation de l'espace, à l'affectation ou à la répartition équilibrée des activités, infrastructures, équipements et services sur le territoire national. Elle affirme le caractère géostratégique des zones frontalières et du territoire maritime. Elle consacre l'Etat comme garant des choix des collectivités territoriales décentralisées. La politique nationale d'aménagement et de développement durable du territoire concourt à l'unité de la nation, aux solidarités entre citoyens et à l'intégration des populations.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Land-use planning,Sustainable development,Climate change,Coastal zone management,Ecosystem preservation

Policy: Law No. 10.175 creating the Municipal Policy for the Mitigation of the Effects of Climate Change in the Municipality of Belo Horizonte.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 45 articles divided into seven Chapters, creates the Municipal Policy for the Mitigation of the Effects of Climate Change to be carried out in the Municipality of Belo Horizonte. This Municipal Policy has the following principles: prevention, guiding public policies; do not postpone measures to combat the worsening of the greenhouse effect; accountability of the polluter, according to which the polluter must bear the burden of environmental damage resulting from pollution, avoiding the transfer of this cost to society; user responsibility who must bear the costs of natural resources use; resources are transferred or benefit people, groups or communities, whose action helps in the conservation of the environment; common but differentiated responsibility; holistic approach; internalization in the context of enterprises, their social and environmental activities; right of access to information, participation of society in the decision-making process and access to justice in matters related to climate change.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Climate change,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Emissions,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Zoning,Polluter pays principle,Pollution control,Sustainable development

Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the sphere of protection of the atmospheric air and is aimed at ensuring of the rights of citizens to favourable environment and access to reliable information related to the state thereof. Regional Government shall perform economic stimulation of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs performing the following activities: (a) application of the best available technologies with a view of reduction of emissions to the atmospheric air; (b) elaboration and manufacturing of alternative fuels and refining diesel fuel in compliance with the European standards; (c) technical servicing and maintenance of motor vehicles using alternative fuels; and (d) utilization of ecofriendly processes and methods.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1997-IV “On protection of green plantations in urban areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of conservation, protection, management and reproduction of recreational forests in urban areas with a view of creation of favourable environment for the population. It shall also regulate the issue of afforestation and reforestation in urban areas. Regional executive bodies shall be responsible for education of the population related to management, keeping and reproduction of green plantations in urban areas. Natural and legal persons shall be granted the right to use green plantations in urban areas and recreational forests for recreational and cultural purposes and shall have the duty to observe forest fire rules and regulations.

Policy: Federal Law No. 99-FZ “On licensing of some activities”.
Policy_Content: This Federal Law regulates relations originating from licensing of some activities. It shall not be applicable to the use of nuclear energy, manufacturing and trade of ethyl alcohol and liquors. . The Act consists of 3 Sections divided into 23 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) organization and realization of licensing; and (3) conclusive provisions. Licensing shall be carried out so as to prevent damages to human life and health, environment and cultural heritage by legal and natural persons engaged in some activities. Licensing of specified activities for other purposes shall be prohibited. Basic principles of licensing shall include: (a) established of licensed activities in accordance with federal legislation; (b) establishment of uniform licensing procedure; (c) establishment of numerous clauses of licensing terms and conditions; (d) transparency; and (e) compliance with law in the process of licensing. The competence of the Government shall include validation of the standard form of licences. Licences shall be issued separately for each type of activity and shall be open-ended. The following activities shall be subject to licensing: (a) manufacturing, testing and repair of firearms for civilian uses; (b) animal infection diseases and GMOs; (c) navigation; (d) waste management and waste disposal; (e) geodetic and mapping activity; (f) mining and (g) conservation of cultural heritage. Manufacturing of medicines, including veterinary drugs, shall require issuance of licence. It establishes licensing procedure and lists the documentation required for issuance of a licence. The license has no expiration date (open-ended).
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Federal Law enters into force one hundred and eighty days after the date of its official publication.

The Provisions also cover compensation for vessel-induced oil pollution damage.

Policy: Planning Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 (2011 Cap. 25).
Policy_Content: This Act provides the legislative basis for the reform of the Northern Ireland planning system. The reforms concern every aspect of planning, including how development plans are drawn up, how development proposals and applications are managed and the way in which these functions are delivered. The development plan and development management systems are modified so as to improve efficiency and effectiveness. Other significant changes are made in respect of planning appeals and enforcement. The Act transfers the majority of planning functions and decision making responsibilities for local development plans, development management plus planning enforcement to councils. Use of land for agriculture or forestry shall not be taken for the purposes of this Act to involve development of the land.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Planning and Development (Strategic Environmental Assessment) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 201 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Planning and Development (Strategic Environmental Assessment) Regulations 2004 in relation with Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA) as required by Directive 2001/42/EC on the assessment of the effects of certain plans and programmes on the environment insofar as the Directive relates to land use planning. The amendments concern principally: a reduction in the threshold in the case of the mandatory undertaking of an environmental assessment of specified local area plans; determination as to the need for an environmental assessment of a local area plan; expansion of the Minister’s role as a designated environmental authority for the purposes of SEA; and making plans, reports and decisions more accessible for public inspection.

Policy: High Hedges Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 (2011 Cap. 21).
Policy_Content: This Act introduces a system to encourage high hedge problem issues to be resolved through neighbourly discussion or mediation, and failing that, the facility for persons alleging that they are suffering a loss of the reasonable enjoyment of their property due to a neighbouring evergreen/semi-evergreen high hedge to lodge a formal complaint with their local council. The council will be acting as an independent and impartial third party. The Act also provides powers for councils to carry out work in default where appropriate, creates offences for non compliance with Remedial Notices and enables hedge owners and complainants to appeal against council decisions.

Policy: Act on agricultural use of fertilizers and plant cover (No. 388 of 2017).
Policy_Content: The Act aims to regulate the agricultural use of fertilizer and lays down provisions requiring the setting up of plant covers and other culture-related activities with the purpose of reducing nitrogen leaking. The Ministry of Environment and Food of Denmark regulates provisions of this Act and requires all activities of plant coverage (crop production, animal husbandry, forestry or their combinations) to notify and register their commercial enterprises, should these have an annual taxable turnover exceeding DKK 50 000. The Minister establishes rules regarding the trade of nitrogen fertilizers which activities must be reported with details on type, quantity and content in volume. Biogas, processing facilitiess and combustion plants must also be report data on the received fertilizers, manure and nitrogen contents thereof.

Policy: Our life insurance, our natural capital: an EU biodiversity strategy to 2020.
Policy_Content: This Biodiversity Strategy sets forth strategies by 2020. The overall objectives of this policy are to reverse biodiversity loss and boost the EU's transition towards a resource efficient and green economy, by protecting and restoring biodiversity and associated ecosystem services, enhancing the positive contribution of agriculture, forestry and fisheries and reducing key pressures on EU biodiversity, and stepping up the EU’s contribution to global biodiversity.

Policy: Poverty Reduction Action Plan (PARP) 2011-2014.
Policy_Content: This Poverty Reduction Action Plan (PARP) 2011-2014 is the medium-term strategy for putting into operation the Five-Year Government Program (2010-2014), focused on the objective of combating poverty and promoting a culture of work, to achieve inclusive economic growth and reduce poverty and vulnerability in the country. It represents the continuation of the PARPA II, which was implemented with a timeframe of 2006-2009, extended to 2010, and had as its principal goal to reduce the incidence of food poverty. In order to achieve the global objective of the PARP, three general objectives are essential (i) increase agricultural and fisheries production and productivity; (ii) promote decent employment, as a way of facilitating and developing micro, small and medium-sized enterprises; (iii) promote access to quality health and education services as well as to social security programs. Strategic interventions need to aim to (i) transforming the structure of production and economic productivity and their linkages, with a focus on economic development and the people's well-being; (ii) rural development, which embraces family farming so as to make it more productive; (iii) strengthening the domestic market and facilitating its integration into the national economy.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Water

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 162437 establishing terms, conditions, procedures, controls and supporting documents for subsiding Action 1.3 “Education for apiarists”, within the implementation framework of the three-year program for the improvement of production and marketing of apiculture products, 2011-2013.
Policy_Content: With the present Decree, the beekeeping educational programme is implemented, as described in Action 1.3 “Education for apiarists” within the implementation framework of the three-year program for the improvement of production and marketing of apiculture products, 2011-2013. The implementation of this Action shall be ensured through regular and ad-hoc controls and technical and economic audits. The duration of each educational cycle is set to three days in each eligible region for each year so as, by the completion of each three-year programme, to have covered the following thematic units: methods of intensive exploitation of bee colonies; bee breeding and queen rearing; recognition and control of bee diseases; beehive products; beehive handling – apiarian equipment; apiarian plants; legislation and programmes; standardization and marketing of apiculture products. The programme shall be held from 1 February until 15 May of each year. Exceptionally, the educational programme for the year 2011 shall be completed within the 31 st of July. The regions in which the programme shall be implemented will be chosen taking into consideration the number of beehives and interested apiarists as well as the geographic particularities of each region. The Decree establishes the sum of the subsidy, requirements for the beneficiaries, required documentation and procedures to be followed.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-1524 validating the Regulation on issuance of mining licences for the plots of subsoil containing non-metallic minerals.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes the modalities of issuance of mining licences for the plots of subsoil containing non-metallic minerals for the following purposes: (a) exploration; (b) experimental and industrial extraction; and (c) management of technogenic mineral deposits. A separate licence shall be issued for each type of activity. Licence shall not be required for experimental and industrial mining of limited amount carried out for the purpose of assessment of mineral deposits. Licences shall be issued through public tenders.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regional Law No. 2512-OZ “On allotment of land parcels free of charge”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes allotment of land parcels free of charge out of public and municipal land stock for individual residential urban or non-residential (for gardening, horticulture, smallholding) suburban construction in ownership to multi-child families, with three and more children if the third and subsequent children were born after 1 January 2011. Land parcels shall be allotted once-only within regionally established land area dimensions limits for allocation of public land parcels.

Policy: State Treaty on Northwest German Forest Research Institute.
Policy_Content: The present State Treaty establishes the Northwest German Forest Research Institute (NW-FAA) being responsible for forestry research and practical advice possession of all forest types in Lower Saxony, Hessen and Saxony-Anhalt. In particular, its focus of research is: environmental control; forest genetic resources; forest growth; forest protection. The text consists of 8 articles.

Policy: Cabinet Resolution No.165 of 2011 organizing the National Anti-Corruption Commission.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 17 articles implements the Royal Order No. A/65 that establishes the National Anti-Corruption Commission and provides at article 3 that the President of the National Anti-Corruption Commission and the Chief of the Bureau of Experts at the Council of Ministers shall draft its Statute. The Commission aims to (i) maintain integrity; (ii) promote transparency; (iii) combat financial and administrative corruption in all forms and means. The aforementioned Statute deals with (i) Commission's Legal Status and to whom It Reports (art.2); (ii) Objectives and Powers (art.3); (iii) Relations with other Entities Article 4 (arts.4 and 5); Presidency and Administrative Body (arts.6-11); (iv) Budget (art.12); (v) General Provisions (arts.13-17).

Policy: Geo-Data Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law enforces the Federal Spatial Information Act of 5 October 2010. In particular, the purpose of the present Law is to provide authorities both at national and cantonal level, economy, science and the public with spatial information. The Law lays down provisions relating to the enforcement of federal legislation in the field of geographic information and the collection, management and use of spatial data for the area of the Canton Appenzell-Innerrhoden. The text consists of 19 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Access and use (II); Services and cadastral surveying (III); Further provisions (IV); Final provisions (V).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decree No. 48.012 establishing the structure of the Secretariat for Rural Development, Fisheries and Cooperatives.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 8 articles, establishes the structure of the Secretariat for Rural Development, Fisheries and Cooperatives. This Law establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the Secretariat, under the terms of art. 47, of Law No. 13.601/2011, is entitled to act within the following areas of competence: design policies and guidelines for rural territorial development, according to socioeconomic, environmental and cultural characteristics and peculiarities of each region; coordinate and execute policies aimed family farmers, rural women workers, rural youth, quilombola communities, rural settlers, artisanal and professional fishermen, fish farmers, and indigenous peoples; coordinate policies and guidelines for the development of cooperatives; promote, formulate, coordinate and implement agroecology and sustainable rural development policies preserving biodiversity and agro-ecosystems; promote and implement agricultural and non-agricultural development policies; formulate, coordinate and implement policies for family agroindustries, associations and cooperatives; create and improve socio-economic protection and environmental risk management policies; develop policies to strengthen the productive chains of family agriculture; develop policies for agrarian development; implement discrimination and legalization of public lands within the scope of its competence; formulate, coordinate and implement marketing, food supply and food and nutritional security policies; coordinate and implement research, technical assistance and rural extension policies, training and capacity building; implement policies for irrigation, supply, storage and multiple uses of water in units and productive systems of family agriculture; promote, stimulate and coordinate fishing and aquaculture activities, etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal portant application de la directive 2008/50/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 21 mai 2008 concernant la qualité de l’air ambiant et un air pur pour l’Europe.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement grand-ducal porte application de la directive 2008/50/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 21 mai 2008 concernant la qualité de l’air ambiant et un air pur pour l’Europe. Notamment, le présent règlement établit des mesures visant: 1) à définir et à fixer des objectifs concernant la qualité de l’air ambiant, afin d’éviter, de prévenir ou de réduire les effets nocifs pour la santé humaine et pour l’environnement dans son ensemble; 2) à évaluer la qualité de l’air ambiant sur la base de méthodes et de critères arrêtés; 3) à obtenir des informations sur la qualité de l’air ambiant afin de contribuer à lutter contre la pollution de l’air et les nuisances et de surveiller les tendances à long terme et les améliorations obtenues grâce aux mesures nationales et communautaires; 4) à faire en sorte que ces informations sur la qualité de l’air ambiant soient mises à la disposition du public; 5) à préserver la qualité de l’air ambiant, lorsqu’elle est bonne, et à l’améliorer dans les autres cas; 6) à promouvoir une coopération accrue entre les Etats membres en vue de réduire la pollution atmosphérique. Le texte comprend 29 articles répartis en 6 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Evaluation de la qualité de l’air ambiant (II); Gestion de la qualité de l’air ambiant (III); Plans (IV); Information du public (V); Dispositions finales (VI). Dix-sept annexes sont jointes.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Emissions,Hazardous substances,Monitoring,Access-to-information,Data collection/reporting,Environmental standards
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Energy Efficiency Act 2011 (No. 3 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Energy Efficiency Management Office within the Ministry responsible for energy matters. The Office shall promote the efficient use of energy and  national awareness for the efficient use of energy as a means to reduce carbon emissions and protect the environment. To carry out these objectives, the Office shall, among other things: develop and implement strategies, programmes and action plans for the efficient use of energy and establish procedures to monitor energy efficiency and consumption. The Office shall be administered and managed by the Energy Efficiency Committee. The Director of the Office may direct any person responsible for an energy consumer to commission an energy audit to be conducted by an energy auditor. The Minister may, in the public interest, exempt any energy consumer from the application of this Act or any Regulations made under it and for such period as he or she deems necessary.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Ley Orgánica de la Economía Popular y Solidaria y del Sector Financiero Popular y Solidario. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica de la Economía Popular y Solidaria y del Sector Financiero Popular y Solidario, entiende por economía popular y solidaria a la forma de organización económica, donde sus integrantes, individual o colectivamente, organizan y desarrollan procesos de producción, intercambio, comercialización, financiamiento y consumo de bienes y servicios, para satisfacer necesidades y generar ingresos, basadas en relaciones de solidaridad, cooperación y reciprocidad, privilegiando al trabajo y al ser humano como sujeto y fin de su actividad, orientada al buen vivir, en armonía con la naturaleza, por sobre la apropiación, el lucro y la acumulación de capital. Las disposiciones de la presente Ley no se aplicarán a las formas asociativas gremiales, profesionales, laborales, culturales, deportivas, religiosas, entre otras, cuyo objeto social principal no sea la realización de actividades económicas de producción de bienes o prestación de servicios. Tampoco serán aplicables las disposiciones de la presente Ley, a las mutualistas y fondos de inversión, las mismas que se regirán por la Ley General de Instituciones del Sistema Financiero y Ley de Mercado de Valores, respectivamente.

Policy: Act on trading greenhouse gas emission privileges.
Policy_Content: The Act establishes principles of functioning of the trading greenhouse gas emission privileges system. The aim of the system is to limit emissions in a more profitable and economically effective way. The system applies to greenhouse gas emissions from installations included in the system and to aircrafts. This Act is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Administration of the system (Sec. 2); Allocation of emission privileges (Sec. 3); Granting emission privileges to operators of aircrafts and operators of installations (Sec. 4); Auctions of emission privileges (Sec. 5); Permissions (Sec. 6); Detailed principles of issuing permissions to entities preparing installation which will produce electrical energy (Sec. 7); Monitoring and accounting of emission accounts (Sec. 8); Group of installations included in the system (Sec. 9); Utilization of emission reduction units (Sec. 10); Penalties (Sec. 11); Changes in valid provisions (Sec. 12); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 13).
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: National Environmental (Surface and Ground Water Quality Control) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. 22 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under section 34 of the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (Establishment) Act, 2007, provide for quality control of and quality standards and requirements of surface waters and groundwater in Nigeria. They also provide with respect to enforcement, define offences and prescribe penalties for such offences. The Regulations concern the protection of water resources for purposes of various uses including clean water supply, agriculture, aquaculture and aquatic ecosystems. Discharge permits shall be applied for with the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (NESREA) in accordance with the National Environmental (Permitting and Licensing System) Regulations, 2009. The Regulations define obligations of permit holders. The Regulations also concern injection of pollutants into wells and provide for the control of the abstraction of groundwater and the construction and operation of wells.

Policy: Asbestos Safety Management Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to protect citizens from harm to their health by asbestos and enable citizens to live in a healthier and more comfortable environment by ensuring the safe management of asbestos. For the purpose of the present Act the term "asbestos" means a silicate mineral forming naturally in a fibrous form as specified by Ordinance of the Ministry of Environment; and the term "asbestos-containing product" means a product that contains asbestos, excluding products made by processing and transforming a material suspected of containing asbestos. The text consists of 49 articles divided into 8 Chapters as follows: General provisions (I); Master plans for management of asbestos (II); Management of asbestos-containing products (III); Management of naturally produced asbestos (IV); Management of asbestos in buildings (V); Management of surrounding environment of job sites for dismantlement of asbestos (VI); Supplementary provisions (VII); Penalty provisions (VIII).

Policy: National Environmental (Desertification Control and Drought Mitigation) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No. 13 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made by the Minister of Environment pursuant to the provisions of section 34 of the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (Establishment) Act, 2007. The objectives of the Regulations include, among other things: To provide an effective and pragmatic regulatory framework for the sustainable use of all areas affected by desertification and the protection of vulnerable lands; promote the use of alternative sources of energy; sensitize the public on the causes and dangers associated with the desertification and the attendant land degradation; encourage reforestation, reseeding, afforestation and conservation of areas under desertification or vulnerable to same for the rehabilitation of degraded lands, among others. The Regulations provide certain principles to be observed in activities carried out in desert prone areas including that farmers should plant trees up to a minimum of 25 trees per hectare on their farms to promote agro forestry; environmental impact assessment to be conducted regularly on lands threatened with desertification, etc. the Regulations provide responsibilities on the Agency, State and Local Governments on their roles for the sustainability of degraded lands and desert prone areas. Furthermore, it provides the objectives for the mitigation of drought in affected areas to include ensuring that appropriate measures are taken to alleviate the impacts of drought occurrence; identify activities or areas mostly at risk during drought and develop mitigating actions to reduce the impacts of drought, among others. The Regulations provide stiff penalties for contravention of provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Forestry, Water
Keyword: Desertification,Agro-forestry,Agricultural land,Water shortage/drought,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Sustainable use,Irrigation,Basin/catchment/watershed
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: National Environmental (Base Metals, Iron and Steel Manufacturing/Recycling Industries Sector) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No.14 9f 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made by the Minister of Environment pursuant to the provisions of section 34 of the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (Establishment) Act, 2007. The Regulations are to prevent and minimize pollution from all operations and ancillary activities of the base metals, iron and steel manufacturing/recycling industry sector in the Nigerian environment. It provides for facilities, corporations or organizations under this sector to carry out environmental impact assessment for projects, to submit environmental audit report for existing industries every 3 years, and to submit environmental management plan. New facilities are mandated to apply up-to-date, efficient cleaner production technologies to minimize pollution to the barest degree practicable. Furthermore, the Regulations generally provide that facilities shall set up machinery for combating pollution hazards and maintain equipment in the event of an emergency and that facilities shall imbibe the best practices for waste minimization in the course of their activities, including adopting the 5 Rs (Reduce, Repair, Reuse, Recycle and Recover) in the management of scraps generated in the course of production. The Regulations provide for the application of the Polluter-Pays Principle to every facility that pollutes the environment in the course of their operations. Every Facility, Corporation or Organisation shall have a sustainable community relations programme.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Environmental standards,Hazardous waste,Mining,Polluter pays principle,Access-to-information,Waste management,Waste prevention,Offences/penalties,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: National Environmental (Coastal and Marine Area Protection) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No. 18 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made by the Minister of Environment pursuant to the provisions of section 34 of the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (Establishment) Act, 2007. The Regulations are to apply to all users of the Coastal and Marine Areas in Nigeria. The purpose of the Regulations include to provide regulatory framework capable of preserving the natural ecological conditions of the estuarine system, the barrier islands system and the beaches so as to safeguard and perpetuate their natural productivity and their biological, economic and aesthetic values; ensure the protection of the coastal and marine environment for sustainable development, among others. The Regulations provide stiff fines for the contravention of its provisions, and prison terms not exceeding 6 months.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Ecosystem preservation,Effluent waste water/discharge,Environmental standards,Marine area,Marine pollution,Marine protected areas,Maritime zone,Protected area,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Offences/penalties,Pollution control,Wetlands
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: National Environmental (Control of Bush, Forest Fire and Open Burning) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No. 15 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made by the Minister of Environment pursuant to the provisions of section 34 of the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (Establishment) Act, 2007. They are meant to prevent and minimize the destruction of the ecosystem through fire outbreaks and burning of any material that may affect the health of the ecosystem through the emission of hazardous air pollutants. The Regulations provide that a person shall not burn, cause, or permit any combustible material in an open fire without a permit from NESREA; it provides the way and manner plant waste is to be burned. The Regulations also provide extensively for practices which may lead to forest/bush fires and advances ways to mitigate the fires, for instance it provides for safety precautions in the use of farm machinery, the installation of fire extinguishers in farms, the use of explosives, use of Bee Smoker devices, prohibition of burning forests for hunting of animals, among others. Offences are provided for the violation of the provisions of the Regulations and penalties are fines and prison terms.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental standards,Pollution control,Forest management/forest conservation,Authorization/permit,Forest fires
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: National Environmental (Soil Erosion and Flood Control) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No. 12 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made by the Minister of Environment pursuant to the provisions of section 34 of the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (Establishment) Act, 2007. The aim of these Regulations are to minimize losses due to flood and erosion in vulnerable areas; protect human life; control accelerated soil erosion, flooding and sediment deposition in water bodies in order to prevent pollution of these water resources, amongst others. The Agency adopts these Regulations to establish technically feasible and economically reasonable standards and procedures to achieve appropriate level of management and conservation practices to abate soil erosion, siltation and sedimentation of the waters of Nigeria; the purpose of the Regulations also includes the sustainable protection and enhancement of the ecological integrity of flood plains as well as vulnerable lands and waters of Nigeria from significant adverse effects of environmental degradation resulting from persistent soil erosion, flooding and deposition of sediments. The Regulations provide that the installation of erosion and sediment perimeter controls shall be the first action of construction prior to any earth disturbing activity. It is further provided that all infrastructural development shall incorporate appropriate flood control measures, including the provision of surface and subsurface drainage facilities, dams, flood walls, high flow diversions and planting of trees, shrubs and grasses. The Regulations prohibits the siting of facilities in identified high risk areas and allows the Agency to inspect any earth-disturbing activity. The Regulations provide stiff penalties for contravention.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Biosafety,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Erosion,Flood,Protection of environment,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Rainwater,Waterworks
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: National Environmental (Protection of Endangered Species in International Trade) Regulations, 2011 (S.I. No. 16 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made by the Minister of Environment pursuant to the provisions of section 34 of the National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (Establishment) Act, 2007. The Regulations provide a detailed list of wildlife species to which the provisions apply to. These regulations shall apply to specimen of wildlife species listed in Appendix I, II,, or III to the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora domesticated by the Endangered Species (Control of International Trade and Traffic) Act, CAP 19, Laws of the Federation of Nigeria, 2004, (and shall include wildlife species included by the Convention after the coming into force of these Regulations) and also those listed in the Schedules I and II to the Act. The Regulations generally prohibit the import or export of species listed therein, or the possession of said specimen. Under exceptional circumstances, a permit may be granted in the prohibited and restricted activities involving the endangered species. The Regulations provide stiff fines and heavy prison terms for the violation of its provisions. The Federal Ministry of Environment is designated as the CITES Management Authority for Nigeria.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No. 22-OZ “On agricultural development”.
Policy_Content: This Regional law regulates relations originating between producers of agricultural commodities and other natural or legal persons, state bodies and local government in the sphere of agricultural development. It establishes legal grounds for implementation of state policy in the sphere of agricultural development. Implementation of state agrarian policy shall have the following targets: (a) state provision of the population wit agricultural commodities and foodstuffs produced on the regional territory; (b) conservation, reproduction and efficient use of land resources; (c) state support of the producers of agricultural commodities; (d) regulation of agricultural market; (e) sustainable development of rural areas; and (f) extension services.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agricultural commodities,Local government,Agricultural land,Sustainable development,Extension,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 276-21-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency delimiting plenary powers in the aforesaid sphere between legislative and executive regional state bodies. The main directions of state policy in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency shall be as follows: (a) efficient use of energy resources; (b) registration of energy resources in the process of energy production, processing, transportation, distribution and consumption; (c) monitoring of consumption of energy resources and of the efficiency of use thereof; and (d) operation of state information system in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency. Regional Legislative Assembly shall carry out legislative regulation in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency. Regional Government shall validate mandatory provisions and arrangements for energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency in condominiums. Regional executive bodies shall carry out energy inspection of condominiums.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Agreement on cooperation between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring and the Russian Academy of Sciences.
Policy_Content: The subject of cooperation within the framework of the Agreement is the interaction of the Parties in organizing and carrying out fundamental and applied scientific research in the field of meteorology, active impact on meteorological and other geophysical processes, climatology, agrometeorology, hydrology, glaciology, oceanology, heliogeophysics, monitoring of environment and environmental pollution, including ionosphere and outer space. The Parties shall interact in the following areas: (a) studies of the atmosphere, ionosphere, cryosphere, ocean, land and its surface waters in order to develop methods for the analysis of hydrometeorological and geophysical areas and natural hazards, mathematical modeling of their dynamics and forecasts, as well as the creation of databases of geospatial information resources, including those based on space systems; (b) development of scientific research into hydrometeorological and climatic processes in the polar regions and the world ocean; (c) research on predictability of the climate system, including predictability of climatic anomalies and climatic extremes; (d) study of past geosphere and paleoclimate development history in order to perform assessment of modern environmental development in the context of natural and anthropogenic changes; (e) identifying and studying the links between climatic changes and risks of natural hazards and social and economic losses and risks of deterioration in the quality of life and health of the population; and (f) development of promising methods for environmental monitoring and environmental pollution, including ground-based (direct and remote), aviation and space-based observation facilities.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: Regulation on emission standards for installations.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation of the Minister of Environment establishes emission standards applicable to installations concerning the emission of gas or dust into air. The standards are defined for different types of activities, technological process, technical operation and deadlines of starting or ending of installation exploitation. The objective of this Regulation is to prevent and reduce as far as possible the direct and indirect effects of emissions. The Regulation consists of the following Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Installations of fuel burning (sect. 2); Installations of incineration of waste (sect. 3); Installations for processing asbestos or products containing asbestos (sect. 4); Installation for the production of titanium dioxide (sect. 5); Installations where organic solvents are used (sect. 6); Final provisions (sect. 7).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Hazardous substances,Environmental standards

Policy: Regulation No. 320 date 21.4.2011 approving the rules of procedure,  criteria of bidding, and the review schedules of the mineral permits applications.
Policy_Content: This Regulation approves the rules of procedure, the criteria of bidding, and the review schedules of the mineral permits applications. The regulation entitles the winner of public bidding to complete the permit documentation within a period of 60 calendar days from the notification of award date. In case of noncompliance with the schedule the right to a permit application is given to the second-ranked bidder.  The bidding procedure is open to legal entities, national and foreign ones. The contracting authority is responsible for preparing the bid criteria and evaluating the bid responsiveness. Albanian Geological Service and the National Agency of Natural Resources analyse the rentability and the financial suitability of the mineral zones that will be open for public bidding.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Persistent Organic Pollutants National Implementation Plan of Georgia
Policy_Content: The Persistent Organic Pollutants National Implementation Plan of Georgia is a strategic document set for the period of 2011-2015. It aims towards developing maximally efficient strategies of persistent organic pollutant (POP) management in Georgia, as well as ensuring protection of human health and the environment through implementing sustainable policies. The national goals with regard to POPs are as follows: (a) developing and enforcing the integrated legal framework and institutional system, reducing and avoiding the impact of POPs in human health and in the environment; (b) ensuring detailed inventory, reduction and destruction of POP pollution in accordance with the requirements of the Convention; and (c) developing and implementing national and global measures that will avoid the creation of new POPs sources.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

One of the important factors in overcoming the crisis in the economy of Ukraine is the proper provision of the needs of the economy in mineral resources and their efficient use. Mineral resource base is a set of explored and previously estimated reserves of minerals and related components that can be used in sectors of the economy provided that the economic benefits are sufficient to carry out expanded production to ensure the economic security of the state.

Policy: Regional Law No. 918-OZ “On protection of the population and the territory against inter-municipal and regional natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes regional subsystem of the unified state system of early warning and emergency intervention that shall perform the functions of protection of the population and territory against inter-municipal and regional natural and technological disasters, including protection of the population in waterbodies. Regional Government shall be responsible for: (a) creation of regional financial funds and material reserves for prevention of the outbreak and mitigation of the consequences of natural and technological disasters; (b) data collection and exchange of information; and (c) emergency intervention in case of the outbreak of disasters.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Jurisdictional competence,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Décision  n° 00354 /MINFOF/CAB du 20 avril 2011 portant suspension d'exportation et à titre conservatoire des essences Wengue et Bubinga.
Policy_Content: La présente décision suspend l’exportation des essences forestières : Wengue (Milletia laurentii) et Bubinga (Guibourtia tessmannii ou Guibourtia demeusei) à titre conservatoire. Cette suspension est valide jusqu'au 31 décembre 2011 période pendant laquelle l'ANAFOR est tenue de conduire une étude devant aboutir à la détermination des quotas d'exportation desdites essences.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Organic Act of the Agency Against Corruption, Ministry of Justice.
Policy_Content: The Act is enacted to map up anti-corruption policies, enforce anti-corruption measures, prevent corruption, and eradicate corruption.

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se dan a conocer los Lineamientos específicos de operación del proyecto estratégico de tecnificación de riego 2011.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo tiene por objeto los Lineamientos Específicos de Operación del Proyecto Estratégico de Tecnificación del Riego 2011, cuya finalidad es la de fomentar la producción de alimentos y materias primas a través del incremento de la superficie tecnificada de riego a nivel parcelario. El artículo 3º indica como beneficiarios a las personas físicas o morales legalmente constituidas que se dediquen a actividades de producción agropecuaria en el territorio nacional, que cuenten con concesión de derechos de uso de agua vigentes o en trámite, o cualquier documento emitido por la CONAGUA en donde acredite el volumen de agua a utilizar en el proyecto, y con un proyecto de tecnificación del riego a nivel parcelario, pudiendo incluir o considerar recursos propios, financiamiento o ambos esquemas.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Introductory Law implementing the federal environmental legislation.
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the Federal Environment Protection Act of 7 October 1983 and the related Ordinances. In particular, the Law deals with the division of competences between the Canton and municipalities. The text consists of 67 articles divided into 13 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Environmental impact assessment (II); Air pollution (III); Noise pollution (IV); Quakes (V); Non-ionising radiation, inclusive light (VI); Prevention of disasters and accidents (VII); Substances hazardous to the environment (VIII); Organisms hazardous to the environment (IX); Waste disposal (X); Polluted sites (XI); Soil protection (XII); Final provisions (XIII).
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Protection of environment,Basic legislation,Pollution control,EIA,Air quality/air pollution,Noise pollution,Radiation,Hazardous substances,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Waste management

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 173 validating the Regulation on disinfection.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree shall be applicable to public institutions, departments, social associations, enterprises and other economic entities irrespectively of the form of ownership thereof, officials and citizens carrying out disinfection, including disinfection, disinsection and deratization arrangements. It establishes hygienic requirements related to storage, transport and trade of disinfection means, including insecticides, repellents and rodenticides. Disinfection means shall be packaged with labels specifying the name of preparation, its purpose, concentration of active materials, date of manufacturing, certification, expiry date, safety management requirements and requisites of manufacturer and supplier.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 301 of 2011 on Environmental Pollution from Production of Asbestos and Asbestos-based Products and Management of Asbestos Waste
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the procedures for prevention and reduction of environmental pollution resulting from the production of asbestos and asbestos-based products and procedures for the management of asbestos waste. The Regulation applies to persons carrying out activities with asbestos (fibrous hydro-silicate material in pure form) or material containing asbestos fibres - crocidolite (blue asbestos), actinolite, anthophyillite, chrysotile (white asbestos), amosite (brown asbestos), tremolite, and also raw asbestos (a product resulting from the primary crushing of asbestos ore). Finally, the Regulation adopts as its annex methods of sampling and analysis of asbestos emission into water and methods of sampling and analysis of emission into the air.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Waste management,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Procedural matters,Emissions,Air quality/air pollution,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Water quality standards
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Law No. 803 establishing the Incentives Programme for the improvement of agricultural soils aiming to develop plant production, especially grains.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 13 articles, establishes the Incentives Programme for the improvement of agricultural soils aiming to develop plant production, especially grains. The Incentives Programme, aims at the development of family agriculture and commercial grain agriculture, covering crops of soybeans, corn, irrigated rice, beans, cassava, fruit growing, horticulture and pasture recovery. Rural producers will benefit from these agricultural incentives only if they meet the following conditions: 1. prove to own or lease rural property of at least 100 hectares of area suitable for the cultivation of soya, maize, rice, and beans; 2. they are duly registered as rural producers and in conditions of compliance, as well as, regularized with the state environmental agency; 3. have a plan for planting annually at least 50 hectares of one of the specified crops. The purpose of this programme is to complement resources for the acquisition by the beneficiary of agricultural limestone for soil improvement in a minimum area of 50 hectares and a maximum of 3,000 hectares.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Sustainable development,Smallholders/peasants,Subsidy/incentive,Cereals/grains/rice,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Financial agricultural measures,Fertilizers/nutrients
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation (Exemption) (Vangunu Isand) Order 2011 (L.N. No. 27 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Notice, made by the Minister under section 4 of the Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation Act, exempts land belonging to a specified tribe on Vangunu Island from the provisions of that section. Section 4 requires a licence to be obtained for commercial felling. The land shall be used for the purposes of cattle farming. All clear felling shall comply with the terms and conditions of a special permit to be issued by the Commissioner of Forest Resources.

Policy: Law No. 3955 on the Traders of Agricultural Products Common Register and other provisions.
Policy_Content: The Law establishes the common Register for traders processing agricultural products and raw materials within the national territory. All traders in the sector have the obligation of registering with the system (computerized database) which shall be open for public consultation and shall be managed by the Department of Agriculture Policy and Documentation of the Ministry of Agricultural Development and Foodstuffs. Previously established Registers referring to specific sectors (seed trade, propagation material, animal feedstuffs, etc.) shall be unified and shall constitute part of the present Register. Chapter A of the law (articles 1 to 7) sets forth the administrative procedures for registration. Chapter B (articles 8 to 14) deals with amendments to existing legislation regarding a variety of subjects. More specifically, article 9 replaces paragraph 1, article 5 of Royal Decree No. 24.9/2010.1958 as regards the lease of public pasture lands. Certain provisions of Law No. 2538/1997 regarding licensees for vending agricultural and veterinary pharmaceuticals are amended according to the provisions of article 10 to this law. Article 12 of this law provides for amending paragraph 5 of article 11 to Law No. 2520/1997.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Access-to-information,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agricultural commodities,Data collection/reporting,Internal trade,Registration
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Law shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy_Content: The Premier decrees to establish that the following arrangements shall be considered fire-extinguishing organization of forests: (a) clearing of fire-breaks; (b) operation of fire extinction basins; (c) operation of barriers restricting stay of citizens in forests with a view of ensuring fire safety in the forests; (d) creation and keeping of fire barrages; and (e) installation and keeping of stands and other indications containing information on fire safety arrangements in the forests.
