Policy: Order No. 335 on revenue for municipal supply  companies pursuing the Electricity Supply Act.
Policy_Content: This Order applies to grid connectivity companies operating under the municipal administration. The Energy Agency notifies on a yearly basis (end of December) a revenue cap for each company/supplier. Its allocation is calculated on the basis of its regulation price as of 1 January in the regulation year with its expected amount of delivered electricity (kWh). Regulating prices and disposable income is adjusted by using a weighted index of 50% of employee wage and 50% material share. ILON2 is Denmark's statistic wage index for the industry employees. Share index is Denmark's statistics price index for domestic service supply (PRIS10). The Energy Agency notifies on a quarterly basis the entire index.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 27 April 2011 with effect from 1 January 2011.

Policy: Saxony Chemicals Legislation–Competence Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements, inter alia, the Chemicals Act in its version of 2 July 2008 (BGBl. I p. 1146). Policy: Statute Law Revision Act 2011 - Repeal of Ordinance and Acts (No. 8 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act revises statute law of Nauru by: validating specified Acts; by making amendments to Acts and Ordinances; and by repealing specified Ordinances and Acts. Repealed Ordinances include: the Importation of Dogs Ordinance 1937-1967, the Native Administration Ordinance 1922-1967, the Native Co-operative Societies Ordinance 1935-1967 and the Prohibition of Sale to Chinese and Natives of Overmilled Rice Ordinance 1925-1967. Repealed Acts include the Nauru Local Government Council Act 1951-1985 and the Nauru Local Government Council Guarantee Act 1970.

Policy: Statute Law Revision Act 2011 - Part CUA of Schedule 1 – Amendment of the Custom and Adopted Laws Act 1971 (No. 8 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Part of the Statute Law Revision Act 2011 amends the Custom and Adopted Laws Act 1971 in section 6 by providing that, despite section 4, the parts of the statute law of England specified in the First Schedule and all Rules, Regulations and Orders made under that statute law and the parts of the common law relating to that statute law do not, except as specified in the First Schedule, apply or have force and effect within Nauru except in so far as all or any of them are adopted or applied from time to time by another Act.

The former landowners of that land are entitled under section 6(2) of that Act to receive annual compensation in perpetuity of the amount which would be payable under clause 4 of this Schedule if the land were leased.".

Policy: Co-operative Societies Act, 2011 (No. 2 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to establishment, registration, management, operation, reconstruction, amalgamation and dissolution of co-operative societies in Dominica. It also contains rules relative to the marketing of produce through co-operative societies and provides for settlement of disputes. For this purpose it establishes the Co-operative Societies Appeals Tribunal. Before carrying out business, co-operative societies shall be registered with the Registrar of Co-operative Societies established under this Act. Co-operative societies may establish an apex body shall coordinate, assist and promote activities for the development, growth and expansion of all co-operative societies.

Policy: Decree establishing a list of regulated products, their packaging and labeling requirements to reduce emissions of volatile organic compounds in the use of organic solvents in regulated products.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree is to limit the total content of volatile organic compounds in certain paints and varnishes and vehicle refinishing products with a view to preventing or reducing air pollution. The present Decree, which is composed of six articles and four Annexes, establishes: (a) the list of paints, varnishes and products containing organic solvents for refinishing objects (called regulated products); (b) the maximum limit values ??for volatile organic compounds, (c) the way of labeling regulated products; (d) requirements to reduce emissions of volatile organic compounds due to the use of organic solvents in regulated products.

Policy: National Environmental Health Strategy 2012-2015.
Policy_Content: The Policy provides an overview and outline of the Afghanistan Government strategies for environmental health for the period of 2012 to 2015. The National Environmental Health Strategy is drafted based on the Ministry of Health’ Strategic Plan for 2012 to 2015 in order to improve environmental health condition in the country. The Policy covers 7 main strategies: management and leadership (I); water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) (II); food safety (III); preserving environmental health (IV); occupational health (V); houses and cities’ safety (VI); radiation protection (V). The Policy sets out national priorities to tackle difficulties associate with national environmental health, including unhealthy drinking water, insufficient facilities and infrastructure, water and sewage system, hazardous waste, chemical pollution, air pollution, and improper transportation of food in different levels of production, preparation, storage, and supply. To improve the efficiency of projects in the field of environmental health, the Ministry of Public Health shall follow a number of fundamental principles in all its activities: right to health; participation and cooperation; public partnership; decision-making based on well-established facts; result-oriented approach; high quality of work; transparency; sustainable development; dignity and respect; justice and fairness; equality. The Policy provides background information on the existing situation of the country with regard to any of the above-mentioned strategies. The Policy also sets out strategic objectives for each strategy. In the field of management and leadership, main objectives include: to establish an environmental health’s evaluation system; to create a surveillance system; to draft relevant policies, legislation, regulations and guidelines; to improve public awareness on the subject; to strengthen the role of Ministry of Public Health and proper distribution of responsibilities and authorities; to harmonize the activities of various authorities in national and regional level. Regarding the second strategy, i.e. water, hygiene, and cleanness (WASH), three main objectives have been set out: to encourage use of safe drinking water to reduce difficulties associated with diseases caused by unhealthy water; to improve public health, sanitation, and hygiene; to facilitate public access to the clean drinking water. With regard to the third objective, the Policy provides detail for a safe and approved method of water purification using chlorine. There are two strategic objectives under the umbrella of the food safety strategy: to ensure the safety of the homemade food products based on international standards through an increase in public awareness and constant cooperation with food suppliers; to increase food safety methods to combat diseases caused by unhealthy food products and improvement of quality control laboratories. For radiation protection, two objectives have been set out: to create a multi-sectoral association to improve national standards on protection of people and environment against radiation; to increase the safety of radiative/ nuclear equipment. To increase the houses and cities health situation the following strategic objectives should be achieved: to control the number and health condition of stray dogs in cities; to manage solid and medical waste; to reduce air pollution through the creation of a national framework for the reduction of air pollution; to reduce noise pollution. With regards to the occupational health strategy, the Policy sets out a number of objectives: improve occupational health and job safety in all working areas through policymaking, education, and training; protect public health staff against diseases associated with their job. The Ministry of Public Health is the principal authority responsible to implement the provisions of this Policy and harmonize the activities of all engaged institutes and departments.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Act amending the Environmental Tax Act on energy-generating products (No. 1 of 2011).
Policy_Content: The Act partly amends regulations on environmental taxes to be paid for motor fuel and applies to the exemption of fuel supply for ships and aircrafts.  Tax exemption for articles used on board include ships engaged in international journesy (incl. cruise ships), oil- and gas-exploration vessels with a registered gross tonnage of 1500 or more, aircarfts operating internationally, fishing vessels not registered in Greenland and vessels of a registered gross tonnage of 200 or more registered in Greenland.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Ley Nº 29676 - Ley de promoción del desarrollo de los mercados de productores agropecuarios.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de promoción del desarrollo de los mercados de productores agropecuarios, tiene el objeto de promover la organización, funcionamiento y desarrollo de los mercados de productores agropecuarios con la finalidad de fomentar la inserción al mercado de las comunidades campesinas, lograr la comercialización directa entre los productores y consumidores finales y mejorar la economía rural. Los mercados de productores agropecuarios constituyen el conjunto de transacciones, acuerdos o intercambios de bienes y servicios que realizan los productores de comunidades campesinas, comunidades nativas y productores individuales con los consumidores finales. No están comprendidos los intermediarios o acopiadores que no son productores. Los productores deben estar empadronados por la Dirección Regional de Agricultura a través de sus agencias y sedes agrarias o por la autoridad competente que corresponda, quienes emiten la certificación de productor para participar en los mercados de productores agropecuarios. Los productos que se comercializan en estos mercados deben ser de origen agrario, pecuario, agroindustrial, avícola, apícola, acuícola o artesanal. Cuando el conjunto de transacciones se realiza en un espacio físico determinado, este debe estar autorizado por la autoridad competente. El espacio físico puede ser un bien de dominio público o un bien de dominio privado. Los mercados de productores agropecuarios tienen duración indefinida y se realizan una vez a la semana. La participación de los productores es según su nivel de asociatividad.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Agricultural commodities,Internal trade,Consumer protection,Capacity building,Smallholders/peasants,Contract farming

Policy: North Stradbroke Island Protection and Sustainability Act 2011.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 24 sections divided into three Parts, aims at substantially end mining interests over land in the North Stradbroke Island Region by the end of 2019, and end mining in the region in 2025: (a) to protect and restore environmental values of the region; and (b) to facilitate, under other Acts, the staged creation of areas to be jointly managed by the State and the traditional owners of the region. The Act is completed by three Schedules on conditions of renewal for particular mining leases (including their variation) and dictionary. Part 2 deals with mining interests in the North Stradbroke Island Region.

Policy: Regulation on support for certain forestry measures (SKSFS 2011:2).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation, issued by the Swedish Forest Agency, lays down rules and general guidelines on economic support for certain forestry measures. Support shall only be granted for active measures on forest land and brush land, including adjacent water areas. Support is conditioned on the measures being designed so as not to harm special values in the natural or cultural environment. Its rules cover specific conditions for support; procedural requirements; reporting obligations of beneficiaries; scope of the economic support; etc.

Policy: Air Quality Standards Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 180 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Directive 2008/50/EC on ambient air quality and cleaner air for Europe. They designate the Environmental Protection Agency is the competent authority responsible for assessing ambient air quality in the territory of the State. They also, among other things: (a) establish limit values and, as appropriate, alert thresholds for concentrations of certain pollutants in ambient air intended to avoid, prevent or reduce harmful effects on human health and the environment as a whole; (b) provide for the assessment of concentrations of certain pollutants in ambient air on the basis of methods and criteria common to the Member States of the European Communities; (c) provide for the obtaining of adequate information on concentrations of certain pollutants in ambient air and ensure that it is made available to the public.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Ionising Radiation Protection (Amendment) Act, 2011 (No. 19 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Ionising Radiation Protection Act, 2005 in section 2 by adding the definitions of "licence" and "licensee" and in Part IV by repeal of that Part and the substitution therefor of the Part set out in this Act. Part IV requires a person who intends to import, process, mine, export, possess, transport, use, dispose of, or undertake any other activity relating to radioactive material or any other source of harmful ionising radiation to apply to the Radiation Protection Authority Board for an ionising radiation licence. It also requires a licensee to appoint a competent person as a radiation protection officer and provides that an owner or a user of radioactive material or source of harmful ionising radiation for which the person does not hold a valid licence shall be answerable for any harmful effects arising from the possession, storage, transport, use or disposal of such radioactive material or source of harmful ionising radiation. It also concerns enforcement measures that may be take by the Board and provide for appeal against decisions of the Board with the Minister and appeal with the High Court against the decision of the Minister.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Ministry of Public Health Notice (Volume 15, A.D. 2011) Rules, Procedures, and Conditions for the Display of Words or Statements that Might Cause Misunderstanding or Encourage Consumption on the Labels of Cigarettes, Cigars, Loose Tobacco, or Flavored Loose Tobacco Governed by the Tobacco Products Control Act of 1992.
Policy_Content: This Notice, consisting of 6 articles, was formulated according to  the Tobacco Products Control Act of 1992. It  prohibits the use of words and statements on tobacco product packaging that may be misleading. Specifically, the Notice prohibits words or statements that might cause consumers to believe that certain tobacco products are less dangerous than others. In addition, words or statements that may encourage consumption are prohibited.

Policy: Décret n° 2-10-578 pris pour l'application de la loi n° 13-09 relative aux énergies renouvelables.
Policy_Content: Le nouveau cadre législatif du secteur des énergies renouvelables, fixe notamment comme objectifs: la promotion de la production d'énergie à partir de sources renouvelables, de sa commercialisation et de son exportation par des entités publiques ou privées; l'assujettissement des installations de production d'énergie à partir de sources renouvelables à un régime d'autorisation ou de déclaration; le droit, pour un exploitant, de produire de l'électricité à partir de sources d'énergies renouvelables pour le compte d'un consommateur ou un groupement de consommateurs raccordés au réseau électrique national de moyenne tension (MT), haute tension (HT) et très haute tension (THT), dans le cadre d'une convention par laquelle ceux-ci s'engagent à enlever et à consommer l'électricité ainsi produite exclusivement pour leur usage propre.

Policy: Implementing the SME Strategy - Action Plan for Developing Afghanistan’s Agri-Business Sector.
Policy_Content: Implementing the SME Strategy - Action Plan for Developing Afghanistan’s Agri-Business Sector is a sectoral national action plan of Afghanistan targeting rural areas. It covers the period of 2011-2013. Its main objective is the practical implementation of the SME Strategy which in turn aims to encourage pro-poor growth by creating jobs in rural areas which have largely missed out on the booming economy which has long characterised Afghanistan’s major cities.

Policy_Content: This Notice, made by the Minister under section 4 of the Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation Act, exempts land listed in the Ndoro Islands from the provisions of that section. Section 4 requires a licence to be obtained for commercial felling. That land shall be cleared for the purposes of agricultural development and reforestation. Clearing shall take place only on specified conditions and approval of the Commissioner.

Policy: Regional Law No. 28-Z “On allotment of land plots to multi-child families”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law sets forth the modalities of allotment in ownership free of charge of plots of land pertaining to public and municipal property to multi-child families, and also establishes minimum and maximum land areas of the aforesaid plots of land. Multi-child family shall be considered family with three or more children less than 18 years of age. The aforesaid plots of land in inhabited areas shall be allotted for housing construction and subsistence family farming. Allotment of the aforesaid plots of land shall be performed once-only. Land tenure of the aforesaid plots of land shall be performed in accordance with authorized purposeful (specific) use of land established at the moment of allotment thereof.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: National Strategy for Rural Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene 2011-2025.
Policy_Content: The National Strategy for Rural Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene is a strategy with a multi-sectoral approach. The strategy The strategy covers the national territory and applies to the period from 2011 to 2025. It defines the water supply, sanitation and hygiene services to be made available to people living in rural areas and the institutional arrangements and the financial, human and other resources needed to provide these services. Five strategic objectives are set: 1) Access to sustainable improved water supply services; 2) Access to improved sanitation; 3) Hygiene behavior change; 4) Development and operation of means to achieve sustainable services; 5) Sector financing.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy: Regulation on controlling of the quality of bathing water.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation of the Minister of Health, which is composed of 11 paragraphs and three Annexes, establishes: (1) requirements for bathing water; (2) the scope of testing water and place used for bathing water; (3) referential methods of testing water; (4) methods of sampling, storage and transport of water samples; (5) classification of bathing water; (6) the way of evaluating quality of water and place used for bathing water; (7) details on internal control of bathing water. Par. 3 specifies types of pollution which should not be contained in bathing water, as they are danger to health and life of persons using bathing water.

Policy_Content: This Act prohibits the cultivation of Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs) in agriculture throughout the territory of Friuli Venezia Giulia. Derogations to this prohibition are envisaged as regards deliberate release of GMOs for experimentation and research purposes. Article 8 concerns penalties.

Policy: Ley Nº 4.637 - Régimen para la implementación del Sistema de Locación Seca para la extracción de petróleo, gas o ambos en conjunto.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece que las empresas permisionarias de exploración y concesionarias de explotación de hidrocarburos en el territorio provincial, deben implementar el sistema de locación seca para el control de sólidos y el tratamiento de lodos y cutting, en todas las perforaciones de pozos que tengan como objeto la extracción de petróleo o gas, o ambos en conjunto. Asimismo, establece normas sobre las evaluaciones de impacto ambiental que deben ser presentadas por dichas empresas.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy_Content: La presente Ley regula el desarrollo urbano, el ordenamiento territorial y la vivienda en el Estado de Veracruz, en lo referente a: el ordenamiento de los asentamientos humanos y la planeación del desarrollo urbano, metropolitano, regional y la vivienda; la ejecución de programas de desarrollo urbano, ordenamiento territorial sustentable y vivienda; la distribución equilibrada de la población y de las actividades económicas en el territorio del Estado; la protección del medio ambiente, del patrimonio histórico, arqueológico, cultural y de la imagen urbana de los centros de población y zonas conurbadas; la fundación, conservación, mejoramiento y crecimiento de los centros de población y zonas conurbadas; la determinación de las provisiones, reservas, usos y destinos del suelo con vocación urbana, así como la regulación de la propiedad en los centros de población y zonas conurbadas; la regularización de la tenencia de la tierra urbana; la constitución de reservas territoriales para el desarrollo urbano y vivienda; la creación de fraccionamientos o cualquier forma de parcelamiento u ocupación del suelo con fines urbanos; la adopción de medidas para prevenir o atender desastres

Policy: Law of Georgia on JSC Partnership Fund (No. 4522-IS of 2011)
Policy_Content: The JSC Partnership Fund (‘the Fund’) is a joint stock company provided for by the Law of Georgia on Entrepreneurs and founded by the State. The State’s participation in the activities of the Fund is limited to the powers of the shareholders provided for by this Law, the Law of Georgia on Entrepreneurs and the Charter of the Fund. The State is not involved in the daily activities of the Fund or in developing the investment strategy of the Fund. The Fund is independent in its activities and is guided by the Law of Georgia on Entrepreneurs, the Civil Code of Georgia, this Law, the Charter of the Fund, and other legislative and subordinate normative acts of Georgia. The objectives of the Fund are to: (a) make profit and ensure an increase in the value of its financial assets; (b) attract investment; (c) create jobs; (d) support the completion of delayed projects and develop and/or finance new projects; (e) administer its shares in implemented projects; (f) conduct any other activities not prohibited by law. The guiding principles of the Fund’s activities are to: (a) determine the strategy and objectives of investment or other kinds of activities and implement them in accordance with the Charter of the Fund; and (b) implement investment or other kinds of activities through transparent and fair procedures, impartially, and taking into account best business practices.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Special fund,Institution,Business/industry/corporations,Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Public private partnership (PPP),Procedural matters,Internal trade

Policy: Wildlife and Natural Environment (Scotland) Act 2011 (2011 Chapter 6).
Policy_Content: This Act amends existing legislation in relation the protection of wildlife, biodiversity and nature conservation. The Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 is amended in relation with, among other things: protection of game species (including close seasons and “poaching” offences); abolishment of “areas of special protection” for wild birds; the use of snares to catch animals; extension of the regime for controlling non-native and invasive species; delegation of licensing functions under the Act; new wildlife offences, including for vicarious criminal liability for certain offences; and the powers of wildlife inspectors.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Environmental planning,Management/conservation,Biodiversity,Protected area,Hunting/capture,Hunting gear/hunting methods,Birds,Endangered species,Protection of habitats,Forest service/forest officers,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties,Protection of species

Policy: The Charter of Fundamental Rights and Freedoms (Constitutional Amendment) Act, 2011  (No. 12 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Constitution of Jamaica to insert the Charter of Fundamental Rights and Freedoms, which incorporate a right to enjoy the environment. Specifically, section 13(3)(l) of this Charter guarantees “the right to enjoy a healthy and productive environment free from the threat of injury or damage from environmental abuse and degradation of the ecological heritage” Section 13(2) expressly states that “Parliament shall pass no law and no organ of the State shall take any action which abrogates, abridges or infringes those rights.”
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Agreement on cooperation between the Federal Service for Supervision of Natural Resources and the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring.
Policy_Content: The Parties, in organizing interaction and coordination of activities shall be guided by the following principles: (a) observance of the human right to a favorable environment; (b) ensuring favorable conditions for human life; (c) legality; (d) strict observance by the Parties of state, official and other secrets protected by law; (e) ensuring protection of information and control over access to information; (f) obligation and impeccability of the fulfillment of the agreements reached by the Parties; and (g) responsibility for completeness, quality and timeliness of presentation of the information. The Parties and their territorial bodies and subordinate organizations shall organize interaction and coordinate their activities in the following main forms: (a) mutual information exchange of interest to both Parties and directly related to the fulfillment of the tasks and functions assigned to them by the legislative and other normative legal acts of the Russian Federation; (b) establishment of joint working groups; (c) conducting seminars on coordination of cooperation in the implementation of control and supervisory activities and environmental monitoring, as well as on topical environmental protection issues; (d) exchange of regulatory legal acts of the Russian Federation and regulatory acts on environmental protection issues; (e) mutual consultations on environmental monitoring and oversight activities, as well as on improving the efficiency of the Parties' activities at the federal, regional and local levels; (f) joint development of regulatory and methodological documents within the limits of their authority and their publication; (g) developing plans for interaction and coordination of activities in cooperation schemes for coordinating activities in environmental emergencies and implementation of development of joint special observation programs (including Earth observation space systems) and control and supervisory activities upon their occurrence, including interregional and transboundary  situations; (h) establishment and revision of the list of facilities, the owners of which must monitor atmospheric air; and (i) interaction  with legal entities on issues related to the implementation of measures to regulate emissions of harmful (polluting) substances into the atmosphere upon receiving forecasts of unfavorable weather conditions.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Contract/agreement,Institution,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Pollution control,Monitoring,Climate change,Public health,Risk assessment/management,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Agreement enters into force on the date of signature and shall be applicable on the whole territory of the Russian Federation.

Policy: Law No. 49 validating the Emergency Ordinance of Government No. 57/2007 on the regime of protected natural areas, conservation of natural habitats, wild flora and fauna.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes protection regime of protected natural areas, conservation of habitats, wild flora and fauna. In particular, it refers to endemic, plant and animal species which are found exclusively in a region or location and which require particular attention due to the characteristics of their habitat and (or) the potential negative impact thereon. Special area of conservation shall be intended site of importance designated by a statutory, administrative and (or) contractual act in which shall be applicable conservation measures required for the maintenance or restoration of a favorable conservation status of natural habitats and (or) populations of species. Internal zoning of protected natural areas shall be intended definition and delimitation of areas inside protected natural areas according to the provisions of this Emergency Ordinance and management plans, which establish special measures for management and regulates human activities in accordance with the objectives for which the protected natural area has been designated, and regulates activities that may cause significant negative impact in the vicinity of protected natural areas and (or) ecological corridors. Documentation required for the establishment of protected natural area regime must include: (a) scientific substantiation of the site of universal natural heritage, wetland of international importance, geopark or biosphere reserve; (b) document certifying acknowledgement of the area as a protected natural area of international interest by authorized international bodies; and (c) approval of the Romanian Academy of Sciences.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Wetlands,Certification,Protection of habitats,Zoning,Basic legislation,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se determina la información y documentación que debe presentarse en el caso de realizar actividades de utilización confinada y se da a conocer el formato único de avisos de utilización confinada de organismos genéticamente modificados.

El anexo contiene los formatos que deben respetarse para transmitir la mencionada información.

Policy: Regulation on classification of facilities for disposal of mining waste.
Policy_Content: The Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of ten paragraphs and one Annex, establishes detailed criteria for the classification of facilities for disposal of mining waste. The following criteria are used for the classification: (1) foreseen effects of accidents which may cause serious risk of death, serious risk to human health or serious risk to the environment; (2) hazardous waste contained in deposited waste; (3) hazardous substances or mixtures contained in deposited waste.
Subject: Mineral resources, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Loi nº 003-2011/AN portant Code forestier au Burkina Faso.
Policy_Content: Ce Code a pour objet de fixer, conformément à la politique forestière nationale fixée par l'Etat, les principes fondamentaux de gestion durable et de valorisation des ressources forestières, fauniques et halieutiques. La politique forestière nationale garantit une action concertée et complémentaire de l'ensemble des institutions et structures concernées afin de réaliser les objectifs globaux définis par le gouvernement. La gestion durable des forêts, de la faune et des ressources halieutiques est un devoir pour tous. Elle contribue à la production de biens et services environnementaux, à la préservation du milieu naturel, à la conservation de la diversité biologique, à l’adaptation aux changements climatiques, à l’atténuation des gaz à effets de serre et à la lutte contre la désertification tout en assurant la satisfaction des besoins socio-économiques et culturels des générations présentes et futures. Dans les aires de protection faunique et les forêts classées, concédées ou non, l’Etat ou les concessionnaires peuvent faire appel à des personnes physiques ou morales pour assurer des activités de surveillance des ressources forestières, fauniques et halieutiques. Il est institué un fonds forestier affecté au financement des actions d'entretien, de régénération et de conservation des ressources forestières, fauniques et halieutiques.
Subject: Fisheries, Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Inland fisheries,Aquaculture,Authorization/permit,Classification/declassification,Concession,Fishery management and conservation,Fishing authorization,Freshwater fishes,Framework law,Special fund,Public forest,Private forest,Timber extraction/logging,Basic legislation,Protected area,Management/conservation,Wildlife products,Hunting/capture,Ranching/captive breeding,Biodiversity,Community management,Protection of species

Policy: Regional Law No. 33-OZ “On conservation and reproduction of protection forest on agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for state regulation of conservation and reproduction of protection forest on agricultural land with a view of protecting agricultural land against adverse natural phenomena. Protection forest can pertain to public, municipal and private property. Protection forest shall be classified as joint management protection forest, if managed by several agricultural producers, and individual management protection forest, if managed by a single agricultural producer. Protection forest shall be subject to forest inventory. The following activities shall be prohibited in protection forests: (a) timber extraction, including felling of shrubbery, and damaging of vegetation; (b) making fires; (c) parking of motor vehicles; (d) littering up and pollution of the territory; (e) construction; and (f) grazing.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. (6) of 2011 Regulating the Participation of the Private Sector in Electricity and Water Production in the Emirate of Dubai.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 37 articles aims at regulating the private sector participation (Licensed Entities) in all Regulated Activities, meaning any activity related to generating electricity, desalinating and adding minerals to water, or a combination of generating electricity and desalinating and adding minerals to water, for the purpose of supplying the Transmission System with produced electricity and/or water. The entity is licensed by the Electricity and Water Sector Regulation and Control Office which also holds the following powers (i) establish the relevant standards and controls (including technical, health, environmental and safety) for conducting Regulated Activities; (ii) process applications for Licences and Exemptions related to conducting the Regulated Activities, and decide after obtaining the approval of the Supreme Energy Council; (iii) establish the rules and standards for operating the Transmission System and networking electricity generation and/or water desalination facilities; (iv) prepare the necessary studies and researches; and (v) maintain and organize registers that include all data and information related to the Licensed Entities.

Policy: Arrêté n° 5397 du 1er avril 2011 instituant un projet dénommé "implantation d’une station de recherche agronomique et forestière à Abala, département des Plateaux".
Policy_Content: Il est institué au sein du ministère de la recherche scientifique, dans le cadre du renforcement de la sécurité alimentaire et la réduction de la pauvreté à travers l’utilisation durable des ressources naturelles, un projet dénommé ‘’implantation d’une station de recherche agronomique et forestière dans le district d’Abala, département des Plateaux’’. Le projet est rattaché à la délégation générale à la recherche scientifique et technologique. Il a pour objet: l’installation d’une infrastructure de recherche dans les domaines de l’agriculture, l’élevage, l’aquaculture et de la foresterie; la mise en place des expérimentations des systèmes de production agricoles adaptés à toute zone agro-écologique; la diffusion des résultats de ces expériences en milieu réel.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Consumer Protection Act: Regulations (G.N. No. R. 293 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the Consumer Protection Act, 2008 in respect of a wide variety of matters including: franchise agreements; control of direct marketing; product labelling and trade descriptions of goods containing genetically modified organisms; control of intermediaries; auctions including a livestock, game and closed auction; compliants to the National Consumer Commission; and Standards, procedures and related matters for Commission to follow in assessing applicant for accreditation as consumer protection group. Goods containing genetically modified organisms to which this Act applies may not be produced, supplied, imported, or packaged unless a notice meeting the requirements of section 22 of the Act is applied to such good or marketing material.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Institution,Consumer protection,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Food quality control/food safety,GMO,Traceability/product tracing,Fraud/deceit/adulteration,Animal production,Internal trade
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Determination of Threshold in Terms of the Consumer Protection Act, 2008 (G.N. No. 294 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Government Notice, made by the Minister of the Department of Trade and Industry, establishes the monetary threshold for purposes of section 5(2)(b) of the Consumer Protection Act. Section  5(2)(b) provides that the Act does not apply to any transaction in terms of which the consumer is a juristic person whose asset value or annual turnover, at the time of the transaction, equals or exceeds the threshold value determined by the Minister.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Regional La No. 10 “On allotment of land plots to multi-child families”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of allotment of public or municipal land to multi-child families in ownership free of charge for housing construction, country housing construction and subsidiary small-holding. It shall be applicable to families with three and more dependent children. The aforesaid plots of land shall be selected out of stock of available land in accordance with land-use planning documentation. The aforesaid plots of land shall be allotted to a family as common indivisible property. The following dimensions shall be established for allotment of land: (a) for individual housing construction – minimum 0,05 ha and maximum 0,1 ha; (b) for country housing construction – minimum 0,05 ha and maximum 0,1 ha; and (c) for subsidiary small-holding – minimum 0,10 ha and maximum 0,15 ha.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Farming,Family farming,Smallholders/peasants,Public land,Ownership,Private land,Property rights,Land-use planning
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Priority Framework for Action Climate Change Adaptation and Disaster Risk Management in Agriculture.
Policy_Content: The Priority Framework for Action of Climate Change Adaptation and Disaster Risk Management in Agriculture is a national Framework with a cross-sectoral approach. The timeframe of this Strategy is 10 years between 2011 and 2020. The main goal of the Framework is to integrate the climate change adaptation and disaster preparedness to reduce the impacts of climate change and extreme climate events in agricultural and food production systems, to reduce the vulnerability and risks faced by the communities and to achieve sustainable development.

Policy: Okavango-Cubango River Basin - Botswana National Action Plan 2011-2016.
Policy_Content: This National Action Plan (NAP) consists of 9 parts divided into 45 articles: Part I-Background; Part II-Description of the Botswana part of the Okavango/Cubango river Basin; Part III-Nap principles; Part IV-Governance framework; Part V-Drivers and priority areas of concernl; Part VI-Management interventions of animals for slaughter and inspection of export slaughter houses and abattoirs; Part VII-General provisions. The aims and purposes of this Plan are to promote the sustainable management, development and use of natural resources in the Okavango Delta in order to improve livelihoods, conserve biodiversity and protect the ecosystem. One of the main objectives of the NAP is therefore to strengthen and improve the coordination of all the relevant plans and strategies in the Okavango Delta.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Biodiversity,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Sustainable development,Grazing,Slaughtering,Animal production,River basin institution,Water supply,Aquaculture

Policy: Act No. 27 on the export of horses.
Policy_Content: The present Act regulates the export of horses from Iceland. The export of horses is permitted without special permits, provided that the conditions of this Act and government directives issued in accordance with it are met. The Act specifies rules for inspection at the point of export, micro-marking, transport conditions, cases where a veterinarian is needed on board, horse passport, payment of fees, etc. A a five-member advisory committee on issues concerning the export of horses shall be appointed. It shall be a forum for consultation between the government and those who work on these issues. The Icelandic Food and Veterinary Authority shall monitor compliance with the rules on conditions and care during transport.
Subject: Livestock, General
Geographical_area: Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Marine and Coastal Area (Takutai Moana) Act 2011 (No. 3 of 2011).

Policy: European Communities Act, 1972 (Environmental Specifications for Petrol, Diesel Fuels and Gas Oils for use by non-road mobile machinery, including inland waterway vessels, agricultural and forestry tractors, and recreational craft) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 155 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations set a maximum sulphur content for gas oils marketed for use by non-road mobile machinery, inland waterway vessels when not at sea, agricultural and forestry tractors, and recreational craft when not at sea and permit the placing on the market of petrol with a specified maximum ethanol content and diesel fuels with a specified maximum fatty acid methyl ester content and require suppliers of fuels to provide appropriate information on the biofuel content and blend of such fuels. They also require that suppliers provide appropriate information to consumers concerning the biofuel content, if any, of gas oils intended for use by non-road mobile machinery, etc.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Such gas oils are now regulated under the European Communities Act, 1972 (Environmental Specifications for Petrol, Diesel Fuels and Gas Oils for use by non-road mobile machinery, including inland waterway vessels, agricultural and forestry tractors, and recreational craft) Regulations 2011.

Policy: Decree on the emission of substances into the atmosphere from small and medium combustion plants.
Policy_Content: The present Decree of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Small and medium combustion plants (sect. 2); Emission limits for small combustion plants (sect. 3); Emission limits for central heating installations (sect. 4); Evaluation of discharged emissions (sect. 5); Measures to reduce air emissions (sect. 6); Operational monitoring of emissions (sect. 7); Control (sect. 8); Penalty provisions (sect. 9); Transitional and final provisions (sect. 10). This Decree lays down requirements in relation to the emission of substances into the air for small and medium combustion plants: (1) limit of emissions from installations; (2) determination of fuel which may be burnt; (3) measures relating to reduction of emissions into the air; (4) adjustment of plants to these requirements. Ale the requirements are specified individually for small and for medium combustion plants.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree entered into force on 1 April 2011.

Policy: Loi n° 2011-07 du 30 mars 2011 portant régime de la Propriété foncière.
Policy_Content: La présente loi est composée t de 96 articles répartis en 5 titres, à savoir: l’organisation du régime de la propriété foncière (I); le fonctionnement du régime de la propriété foncière (II); les sanctions (III); les frais et émoluments (IV); et les dispositions finales (V).  Aux termes de cette loi, l’immatriculation d’un immeuble au livre foncier est précédée d’une vaste publicité et exige l’observation des formalités multiples et minutieuses destinées à sauvegarder les droits des tiers. En outre, elle consacre le principe de l’inexistence de droit réel sans inscription qui assure la conservation des avantages acquis de l’immatriculation et garantit la sécurité des transactions à venir.  Toutes les modifications qui affectent ces droits réels doivent être également publiées aux livres fonciers pour être opposables aux tiers. Le régime de l’immatriculation foncière proscrit les causes occultes d’acquisition ou d’extinction de droits réels sur les immeubles immatriculés.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Abandoned land/unoccupied land,Access right,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Agricultural land,Basic legislation,Concession,Expropriation,Farming,Land reform,Cadastre/land registration,Land tenure,Land-use planning,Lease,Property rights,Servitude,Traditional rights/customary rights

Policy: Regional Law No. 2165-OD “On environmental audit”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates legal relations in the sphere of environmental audit and is aimed at ensuring constitutional right of citizens to favourable environment and ensuring environmental security. Regional environmental audit shall be applicable to: (a) normative, technical and methodological documentation in the sphere of environmental protection validated by regional state bodies, including setting fishing and hunting quotas, acclimatization and hybridization of wild fauna species; (b) economic activities involving construction and other processing activities having environmental impact, procurement and recycling of scrap metal; (c) pharmaceutical activities, involving prohibited crops; and (d) ecological inspection of the territory with a view of attributed protected area status thereto.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree-Law No. 13/2011 establishing the structure of the Ministry of Tourism, Trade and Industry (MTCI).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 3 Chapters, establishes the structure of the Ministry of Tourism, Trade and Industry (MTCI). It specifies composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, entitled to design, conceive, regulate, implement, coordinate and assess the policies defined and approved by the Council of Ministers in areas related to tourism, trade and industry. This institution also aims at contributing for the promotion of touristic, commercial and industrial activities; at analyzing commercial activity and proposing measures and public policies related to the development of local entrepreneurship; supporting and regulating the activities of economic agents; giving advice on environmental impact assessment; assessing and licensing projects of touristic, commercial and industrial infrastructures, etc.

Policy: Gujarat Green Cess Act, 2011 (Gujarat Act No. 3 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 21 sections divided into ten Chapters, provides for levy of cess on generation of electricity other than renewable energy for creation of a fund for protecting environment and promoting the generation of electricity through renewable sources in the State of Gujarat. It establishes that there shall be levied and collected a cess on generation of electricity except on generation of renewable energy by the generating company at the generating station or at the captive generating plant or the stand by generating plant. Such cess under sub-section (1) shall be levied and payable on the electricity generated in the State of Gujarat irrespective of the fact whether such electricity is consumed within the State or not. The State Government may by notification in the Official Gazette, exempt from payment of the cess, the generating company having aggregate installed capacity of not more than one thousand kilowatts. There shall be established a fund called "Green Energy Fund" which shall be under the control of the State Government. The State Government shall also have the power to allocate and disburse such sums from the Fund as it considers necessary to the concerned Departments responsible for achieving the objects of this Act.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Renewable energy,Protection of environment,Financing,Subsidy/incentive,Energy conservation/energy production,Tax/levy,Special fund
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia

Policy: Regulation on criteria for determining rural areas and categories of rural communities.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, as in accordance with the Law on agriculture and rural development, prescribes the criteria for determining the rural areas, including criteria for determining categories of such rural communities. Rural areas are all settlements within a municipality that have less than 30,000 inhabitants registered with the national census of households of Republic of Macedonia or with a population density less than or equal to 150 inhabitants per square kilometer. Other specific rules as regards the categorization of rural communities, are listed in article 3.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Southern Europe

Policy: Renewables Obligation (Amendment) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 984 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Renewables Obligation Order 2009 by, among other things: implementing in respect of England and Wales Articles 17 to 19 of Directive 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources; widening the exceptions to the circumstances in which no renewables obligation certificates are to be issued; inserting new articles 17AA, 17AB and 58A relating to certificates for offshore wind generating stations; making provision with respect to information to be provided to the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority where electricity is generated from biomass. The Directive is implemented with respect to fossil-derived bioliquid and determination of fossil fuel proportion of waste and of biomass which is composed of fossil fuel. No certificates shall be issued in respect of any electricity generated using bioliquid that does not meet the greenhouse gas emission criteria (which are set out in the new Schedule A1) and the land criteria (which are set out in the new Schedule A2).

Policy: Offshore Petroleum Activities (Oil Pollution Prevention and Control) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 983 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend Offshore Petroleum Activities (Oil Pollution Prevention and Control) Regulations 2005 principally by adding provisions which distinguish unlawful releases of oil from discharges, which may be lawful if made in accordance with the terms and conditions of a permit. They also, among other things: exclude the application of the principal Regulations in relation to offshore petroleum activities to Welsh controlled waters from the low water mark out to three nautical miles from the baseline of the territorial sea; amend provisions relating to procedural requirements for the granting of permits so as to provide for measures to limit damages to the environment. They require, among other things, that an application for a permit to discharge oil must include an assessment of the risk of harm to the environment from the proposed discharge.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Offshore Chemicals (Amendment) Regulations 2011  (S.I. No. 982 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Offshore Chemicals Regulations 2002 principally by: adding a new regulation (3A), which prohibits any person from releasing an offshore chemical or allowing such a release to continue; widening circumstances in which a person can be prosecuted for emitting an offshore chemical, so that an intentional emission (i.e. a discharge as newly defined) will only be lawful if made within the terms and conditions attached to a permit. They also, among other things: exclude the application of the Regulations in relation to offshore petroleum activities in Welsh controlled waters from the low water mark out to three nautical miles from the baseline of the territorial sea; and amend provisions relating to conditions of permits so as to provide for measures to limit damages to the environment.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Wildlife and Natural Environment Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 (2011 Chapter 15).
Policy_Content: This Act requires every public body to promote the conservation of biodiversity and defines functions of public bodies in Northern Ireland with respect to the conservation of biodiversity. It also contains provisions for the conservation of wild fauna and flora and habitats. The Act amends the Wildlife (Northern Ireland) Order 1985 and the Environment (Northern Ireland) Order 2002.

Policy: Basic Act No. 3937 on the Conservation of Biodiversity.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of six Chapters divided into 36 articles, aims at the sustainable management and effective conservation of biodiversity as a valuable, irreplaceable national asset of the diversity of living organisms of all origins, including: terrestrial, marine and other aquatic ecosystems and ecological complexes to which they belong. The maintenance of biodiversity requires planning and management processes, which ensure a broad consultation phase in order to exploit the best scientific knowledge and the available know-how. The specific objectives are as follows: a) Effective implementation of European Union legislation and international law on the conservation of biodiversity; b) Inclusion of biodiversity conservation objectives at all planning levels and in the sectoral and development policies of the country; c) Acquiring knowledge of the status of species and ecosystems as a key tool for effectively preserving and managing biodiversity; d) Effective conservation and management of important areas for biodiversity through the optimal organization and operation of the national system of protected areas; e) Achieve a satisfactory conservation status of biodiversity, including habitats and species of flora and fauna and other groups of organisms, especially those identified as important, rare or threatened; f) Effective surveillance mechanisms to ensure the implementation of the institutional framework for the conservation of biodiversity; g) Promoting the importance of preserving biodiversity and protected areas in general in society

Policy: Arrêté du 28 mars 2011 fixant les conditions de participation des chambres d'agriculture à la politique d'installation en agriculture.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les conditions de participation des chambres départementales d'agriculture à la politique d'installation en agriculture. La mission d'information sur les questions d'installation en agriculture assurée par les chambres départementales d'agriculture comprend: dans le cadre de l'information collective, la participation à la politique de communication sur l'ensemble des dispositifs d'aides publiques à l'installation; dans le cadre de l'information individuelle, la participation à l'accueil et à l'orientation des candidats à l'installation. A cet effet, les chambres participent au montage collectif des opérations de communication, organisent des réunions d'information, contribuent aux comités de pilotage, commissions et réunions nécessaires à la mise en œuvre des programmes d'installation, informent les bénéficiaires potentiels et les acteurs par tous moyens appropriés. En outre, les chambres conçoivent et diffusent des brochures informatives, suivent les actions et élaborent, annuellement, outre un bilan qualitatif, un bilan quantitatif à partir des outils d'exploitation statistique des données qui leur sont fournis par le ministère chargé de l'agriculture.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Policy: Albania National Plan for Environmental Noise Management.
Policy_Content: Albania National Plan for Environmental Noise Management is a cross-sectoral plan that establishes the framework to analyze, plan, and implement necessary measures required for the sustainable management of environmental noise aiming to prevent the negative effects of noise pollution on environment and human health. Although noise sources can be diverse, the action plan focuses on the noise caused by transport (road, railway, air), hospitality sector (resulting from music at bars, restaurants, pubs, and discos), and machinery and equipment located in public spaces. The main objective of the action plan is the sustainable management of the environmental noise in compliance with the permitted noise pollution levels establish by relevant EU directives and protection of human health.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring (ROSHYDROMET) and the Government of Kostroma region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Kostroma region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Kostroma region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Kostroma region.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Contract/agreement,Pollution control,Monitoring,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Public health,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information

Policy: Law No. 707 “On ecological monitoring”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines organizational, legal, economic and social and social frameworks for environmental monitoring in the Republic of Tajikistan and regulates relations among public authorities, local government bodies of settlements and villages, public associations and citizens in the aforesaid field. The subjects of environmental monitoring are: (a) state authorized body to organize and conduct environmental monitoring; (b) local public authorities; (c) self-governing bodies of settlements and villages; and (d) natural resource users. Environmental monitoring data related to environmental information shall not be not subject to classification. Restrictions on access to data related to the need to ensure State secret shall be established by the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan. Public associations and citizens have the right to apply to the state authorized have the right to apply to the state authorized body on organization and implementation of environmental monitoring to receive reliable and complete information on the state of the environment. On territories with a special ecological status (a zone of ecological emergency, ecological disaster) environmental monitoring is an integral part of programs aimed at rehabilitation of the territories. The Act consists of 5 Sections divided into 22 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) organization of state system of ecological monitoring; (3) competence of the state executive bodies in the sphere of ecological monitoring; (4) regulation of activity in the sphere of ecological monitoring; and (5) conclusive provisions. Ecological monitoring shall be carried out for the following purposes: (a) observation of the state of environment; (b) environmental impact assessment (EIA); (c) access to reliable environmental information. Ecological monitoring shall carry out the following tasks: (a) regular observations of environment; (b) creation of environmental database;(c) forecast of environmental changes; (d) elaboration of programmes, proposals and arrangements for the liquidation of the consequences of negative environmental impact; and (e) informing state bodies, natural and legal persons on the state of environment (Art. 3).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 705 “On ecological information”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, organizational, economic and social grounds for the provision of ecological information, granting access to reliable, complete and timely ecological information to natural and legal persons. Ecological information shall include: (a) state of environment, including atmospheric air, surface and groundwater, flora and fauna, landscapes and GMO; (b) energetic pollution, noise pollution, electromagnetic pollution and radioactive pollution; (c) decisions of governmental bodies related to negative environmental impact and environmental pollution; (d) public health and safety of citizens; and (e) living conditions and environmental impact (Art. 3). Natural and legal persons shall be granted free access to ecological information (Art. 4).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolution No. 144 of 2011 of Georgian Government on Attribution of Plot of Land as Part of Essential Part of Another Plot of Land
Policy_Content: The Regulution determines terms for calculating a surface area of plot of land attributed as part of essential part of another plot of land. It consists of seven articles: Purpose and scope of application of the Regulation (1); Definition of terms (2); Rules for calculating surface area of plot of land attributed to a building/structure (3); Composition of boundaries of a plot of land (4); Amount of price for attribution of plot of land to a building/structure (4-1); Rules for developing the project of boundaries and defining the boundaries of land attributed to a building/structure (5); and Publicity of information (6). The Regulation is used when the state cannot recognize ownership rights of a person or an entity because only essential part of a plot of land could be sold by the state under the Law of Georgia on Recognition of Property Rights of the Parcels of Land Possessed (Used) by Natural Persons and Legal Entities under Private Law.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. H.P. 14122/549/Ε.103 establishing measures for a better ambient air quality and cleaner air for Europe, in compliance with the provisions of Directive 2008/50/EC.
Policy_Content: The Decree aims at implementing the provisions of article 7 of Law No. 1650/86 “on the protection for the environment”. It also aims at harmonizing the Greek legislative frame with the provisions of Directive 2008/50/EC so as ensure that all appropriate measures are taken in order to: define objectives for ambient air quality designed to avoid, prevent or reduce harmful effects on human health and the environment as a whole; assess the ambient air quality on the basis of common methods and criteria; obtain information on ambient air quality in order to help combat air pollution and nuisance and to monitor long-term trends and improvements resulting from national measures; ensure that such information on ambient air quality is made available to the public; maintain air quality where it is good and improving it in other cases; promote increased cooperation between the Member States of the European Community in reducing air pollution. The Decree is composed as follows: objective (art. 1); definitions (ambient air, critical level, margin of tolerance, etc.) (art. 2);  competent authorities (art. 3); determination of areas and agglomerations (art. 4); assessment of ambient air quality (arts. 5-11); assessment regime (art. 5); assessment criteria (arts. 6, 9); sampling points (art. 7,10); reference measurement methods (arts. 8, 11); requirements where levels are lower than the limit values (art. 12); limit values and alert thresholds for the protection of human health (art. 13); critical levels (art. 14); national PM2,5 exposure reduction target for the protection of human health (art. 15); PM2,5 limit values and alert thresholds for the protection of human health (art. 16); requirements in zones and agglomerations where ozone concentrations exceed the target values and long-term objectives (art. 17); requirements in zones and agglomerations where ozone concentrations meet the long-term objectives (art. 18); measures required in the event of information or alert thresholds being exceeded (art. 19); pollutant contributions from natural sources (art. 20); exceedances attributable to winter sanding or salting of roads (art. 21); postponement of attainment deadlines and exemption from the obligation to apply certain limit values (art. 22); air quality plans (art. 23); short-term action plans (art. 24); transboundary air pollution (art. 25); public information (art. 26); transmission of information and reporting (art. 27); sanctions (art. 28); transitional and final provisions (art. 29). Also, the sixteen Annexes included in the text constitute integral part of this Decree.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Emissions,Hazardous substances,Monitoring,Access-to-information,Data collection/reporting,Environmental standards
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette unless otherwise provided for by the individual sections of this Decree.

Policy_Content: The Act aims to prevent fuels (petrol, diesel, ethanol) used in motor engines to affect the environment. Policy: Mines and Quarries Regulation (Amendment) Law of 2011 (N. 35(I)/2011).
Policy_Content: This Law makes minor amendments to the administrative and legal proceedings related to the operation of mining and quarries. Article 2 of the basic Law is amended by adding the appropriate alphabetical order and the new terms and definitions: such as: "Exclusive economic zone", "Continental shelf", "Regulations", "Convention", etc. Article 4 is amended as follows: (a) by adding immediately the following provisions: "provide that the minerals and quarry, referred to in this paragraph include minerals and quarry materials found in the subsoil of the territorial waters of the Republic, on the continental shelf and the exclusive economic zone» and b) adding the following new subsections 3), 4), 5) and 6): "(3) the rights of control of mining and quarry materials, located in the exclusive economic zone, will be exercised by the Republic in connection with the rights of ownership and control of mining and quarry materials located on the continental shelf. (4) No application for reviewing the authorization, mining lease or quarry privilege in the territorial waters, continental shelf or the exclusive economic zone of the Republic shall be accepted, unless the application is submitted after notification published in the Gazette by the Cabinet. (5) The notice referred determines the following: (6) any permission for quarry survey, mining lease or exploitation may be granted only when the applicant has obtained in advance a positive opinion by the environmental authority, in accordance with Article 11 of the Environmental Impact Assessment Projects Act. Article 11 is amended by making minor changes. Article 14 is amended as follows: (a) the substitution of subsection (1) thereof the following new subsection (1): "(1) The holder overview license has the right to enter and conduct investigations in any land of the Republic and subject to subsection (2), any private land included in the license.» (b) deleting from subsection (2) that the words" and, if not granted such consent without reasonable cause or it is impossible or impractical to obtain, unless they receive special permission of the Cabinet "(third to fifth line). c) by replacing subsection (3) thereof the following new subsection (3), etc.

Policy: Wildlife Conservation (Dangerous Animals Damage Consolation) Regulations, 2011 (G.N No. 146 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide with respect to compensation of damage caused by dangerous animals, i.e. animals specified in the Third Schedule to these Regulations. Any person who has suffered damage or destruction of his crops or livestock caused by a dangerous animal as prescribed under these Regulations shall, upon application and determination be eligible for consolation. All applications for consolation under these Regulations shall be made to the Director of Wildlife in the form set out in First and Second Schedules to these Regulations within seven days and be verified by a Wildlife Officer, Agricultural or livestock Officer, Village Executive Officer or Ward Executive Officer, two independent witnesses within the area and the case of human injury or death, a medical practitioner of a rank of clinical officer and above. No payment shall be made if certain circumstances occur or certain conditions exist or are not fulfilled. Appeal against decisions of the Director may be had with the Minister responsible for Wildlife

The evacuation plan is prepared as a separate document and it is part of the National strategy for protection and rescue in emergency situations.

Policy: Agricultural and food products promotion Act.
Policy_Content: This Act determines the public interest of the Republic of Slovenia in the field of promotion of agricultural and food products, types and forms of promotion, promotion planning, promotion financing, promotion contribution, collection, management and collection of personal and other data on taxpayers, bodies and advisory bodies for the promotion, implementation of professional tasks and supervision over the implementation of rules here stipulated. The public interest in the field of promotion is mainly realized by: systemic financing, planning and implementation of promotion; improving consumer information on production and processing and on the quality, safety, specific characteristics and nutritional benefits of agricultural and food products; consolidating consumer competences when deciding to purchase agricultural and food products with independent, credible information; encouraging the participation of agricultural producers, food processing companies, their representative organizations and the state in the planning, financing and implementation of promotion; strengthening the competitiveness of agri-food in the Republic of Slovenia; increasing the sale of Slovenian agricultural and food products to consumers; promoting local production and consumption.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Policy/planning,Fiscal and market measures,Consumer protection,Financing,Food quality control/food safety
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force on 23 April 2011.

Policy: Marine Licensing (Notices Appeals) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 936 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for appeals to be made to the First-tier Tribunal against certain notices issued under Part 4 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009. The notices are: (a) a notice varying, suspending or revoking a marine licence, or extending a period of suspension, issued under section 72 of the Act in relation to which the Secretary of State is the appropriate licensing authority; (b) a compliance notice, a remediation notice, a stop notice, or an emergency safety notice, in relation to which the Secretary of State is an enforcement authority. Policy: Renewables Obligation (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.R. No. 169 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Renewables Obligation Order (Northern Ireland) 2009  by, among other things: implementing in respect of Northern Ireland Articles 17 to 19 of Directive 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources; widening the exceptions to the circumstances in which no renewables obligation certificates are to be issued; inserting new articles 17AA, 17AB and 58A relating to certificates for offshore wind generating stations; making provision with respect to information to be provided to the Northern Ireland Authority for Utility Regulation where electricity is generated from biomass; requiring operators of generating stations claiming certificates  for the generation of electricity from bioliquid to provide a bioliquid sustainability audit report. The Directive is implemented with respect to fossil-derived bioliquid and determination of fossil fuel proportion of waste and of biomass which is composed of fossil fuel. No certificates shall be issued in respect of any electricity generated using bioliquid that does not meet the greenhouse gas emission criteria (which are set out in the new Schedule A1) and the land criteria (which are set out in the new Schedule A2).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Decree-Law No. 11/2011 creating the National Development Agency.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 17 articles divided into three Chapters, creates the National Development Agency (ADN), as a service that integrates the direct administration of the State, depending on the Prime Minister. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of ADN, whose mission is to design, coordinate, execute and evaluate the policy defined and approved by the Council of Ministers with regard to the evaluation, management, monitoring and inspection of development capital projects. ADN is guided, inter alia, by the following objectives: a) Promote national and community development and economic activity, particularly in districts, sub-districts and rural "Sucos"; b) Rationalize the available financial resources, through a careful evaluation of the projects based on the analysis of their cost-benefit; c) Control the costs and quality of development capital projects.
