Policy: Ley Nº 98 - Declara de prioridad nacional la producción, industrialización y comercialización de la quinua en las regiones productoras del país.
Policy_Content: El objetivo de esta Ley es contribuir a la producción, industrialización y comercialización comunitaria de la quinua mediante la tecnificación de la producción primaria con la protección respectiva de áreas de cultivo, mejoramiento y conservación de la calidad de rendimiento en el sitio, sistemas de riego, mejoras post cosecha, transformación, industrialización y comercialización del producto y subproductos de manera prioritaria en el mercado local y nacional, y en el mercado externo. A tal efecto la Ley prevé la distribución de recursos financieros, como así también la inscripción de la quinua en un sistema de registro que salvaguarde su existencia, la de sus variedades y la propiedad intelectual.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Creation and Management of Javakheti Protected Areas (No. 4459-IS of 2011)
Policy_Content: This Law regulates legal relations in creation, management, management and use of Javakheti protected areas. It consists of 15 articles: Scope of application of the Law (1); Main purpose and objectives of the Law (2); Categories of Javakheti protected areas (3); Location, surface area and boundaries of Javakheti National Park (4); Location, surface area and boundaries of Kartsakhi Managed Reserve (5); Location, surface area and boundaries of Sulda Managed Reserve (6); Location, surface area and boundaries of Khanchali Managed Reserve (7); Location, surface area and boundaries of Bugdasheni Managed Reserve (8); Location, surface area and boundaries of Madatapa Managed Reserve (9); Multi-purpose area (supporting zone) of Javakheti (9(1)); Protection and use regime of Javakheti protected areas (10); Management of Javakheti protected areas (11); Property rights, and activities involving use of minerals and other natural resources on Javakheti protected areas (12); Transitional provisions (13); and Final provisions (14). The objectives of the Law include protection, restoration and maintenance of biodiversity, natural ecosystems, landscapes, biotypes and its specific components, and wild fauna and flora; protection and restoration of wetlands and habitats especially ones that are useful for waterfowl; protection, restoration and rational use of water, soil and other natural resources, creating favorable conditions for ecological education and scientific research, protection and maintenance of historical and cultural heritage, protection and monitoring of natural biological regimes of water objects (lakes) of volcanic origin; and supporting sustainable growth of recreation, tourism and agriculture.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Biosphere reserves,Cultural heritage,Education,Wetlands,Protection of habitats,Monitoring,National parks,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil rehabilitation,Zoning,Property rights,Survey/mapping,Minerals,Sustainable development,Inland waters,Ecosystem preservation,Sustainable use,Freshwater resources management,Surface water,Coastal zone management,Water abstraction,Water conservation zone,Water rights,Recreational water use,Management/conservation,Biodiversity,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Birds,Migratory species,Research,Tourism

Policy: Decree on the prevention and reduction of emissions from construction sites.
Policy_Content: The present Decree of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia, which is composed of 17 articles, lays down the rules of carrying out construction work, requirements for constructions and organizational measures with the aim of preventing and reducing emissions which are generated as the result of these activities. In particular, this Decree regulates: requirements for engines installed in construction machinery or other devices (art. 4), requirements for compression-ignition engines (art. 5), requirements for the mechanical processing (art. 6). These provisions do not apply to the construction of facilities that are required to fight against the natural and human caused disasters, or in order to prevent or minimize their consequences for the protection, rescue and relief in natural and other disasters, and to build military engineering facilities, shelters and other facilities during emergency or the state of war.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree entered into force on 5 April 2011.

Policy: Ozone Layer Protection (Fees and Penalty Notices) Regulation Order 2011 (No. 100 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order prescribes in the Schedule fees for purposes of the Ozone Layer Protection Act 2010. These fees are to be paid at the Ministry of Finance and Economic Management and are to be transferred into the Environmental Trust Fund established under the Environmental Protection and Conservation Act. Any fee, costs or expenses payable under this Regulation are recoverable as a civil debt owing to the Government, if the service to which they relate has been provided. For the purposes of section 27 of the Act, the prescribed amount in respect of an offence committed under a provision of the Act is specified in the attached Penalty Notice Table.

Policy: Social Security Fund (Management and Operation) Rules, 2067 (2011).
Policy_Content: These Rules, consisting of 25 sections, establish the Social Security Fund (Management and Operation). Pursuant to Sub-rule (1), the fund shall have the following amounts: a) amount received in the fund in accordance with the prevailing laws; b) amount received from the contributors for voluntary participation in the social security programme; c) amount received from Government of Nepal; d) amount received from international organizations, institutions, and foreign governments; e) amount received from native organization, institutions or persons; f) amounts received from any other sources. The amounts to be deposited in fund pursuant to Sub-rule (2) through a separate account in Nepal Rastra Bank. The account of the Fund shall be operated through the joint signature of the Executive Director and the Chief Accountant. There shall be a Board of Trustees, constituted for the management and operation of the fund.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: These Rules enter into force immediately.

Policy: Order No. 242 on pesticides.
Policy_Content: This Order aims to prevent health hazards from pesticides by authorizing their use. These regulations include transport of pesticides, internal trade and export of pesticides. The Order aims to prevent health hazards, unnecessary environmental impact and environmental damage during production, storage, use and disposal of chemical substances and products in order to reduce problems associated with waste disposal and applies to pesticides used for protection of plants or plant products against harmful organisms, influence of life processes of plants, preservation of products derived from plants that are unprocessed or having undergone simple preparation such as milling, drying or pressing, and for which there are no specific EU rules on preservatives, and to prevent undesired growth of weeds.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on 31 March 2011.

On modifie la section 2b sur la réduction des émissions de CO2 des voitures de tourisme. Policy: Royal Order No.A/65 of 2011 establishing the National Anti-Corruption Commission.
Policy_Content: This Order consisting of 7 articles is emanated after reviewing of the Integrity and Anti-Corruption National Strategy and aims at establishing the National Anti-Corruption Commission reporting directly to the King. The Commission shall have the following main powers (i) audit all government agencies, without exception; (ii) pursue the implementation of orders and directives pertaining to public matters; (iii) pursue the administrative and financial corruption; and (iv) coordinate with ministries, government authorities, and agencies on public affairs and interests of citizens.

Policy: Energy Act 2008 (Storage of Carbon Dioxide) (Scotland) Regulations 2011 (S.S.I. No. 224 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend Chapter 3 of Part 1 of the Energy Act 2008 so as to further provide in Scotland for the environmentally safe storage of carbon dioxide in marine areas. They implement in part Directive 2009/31/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the geological storage of carbon dioxide and extend the prohibition on the storage of carbon dioxide, and related activities, without a licence to  all parts of Scotland landward of the Scottish territorial sea. It also makes consequential amendments to the Act.

Policy: Renewables Obligation (Scotland) Amendment Order 2011 (S.S.I. No. 225 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Renewables Obligation (Scotland) Order 2009 by, among other things: implementing Articles 17 to 19 of Directive 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources; inserting new articles 17AA, 17AB and 58A relating to certificates for offshore wind generating stations; making provision with respect to information to be provided to the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority where electricity is generated from biomass; modifying definitions that preclude from eligibility for renewables obligation certificates any generating station which has already receive capital or revenue funding under a statutory grant programme operated by either the Scottish Ministers or the Secretary of State. The Directive is implemented with respect to fossil-derived bioliquid and determination of fossil fuel proportion of waste and of biomass which is composed of fossil fuel.

Policy: Arrêté du 17 mars 2011 relatif à la lutte contre le Plum Pox Virus, agent causal de la maladie de la Sharka, sur les végétaux sensibles du genre Prunus.
Policy_Content: La lutte contre le Plum Pox Virus, agent causal de la maladie de la Sharka des végétaux du genre Prunus, est obligatoire en tous lieux et de façon permanente sur tout le territoire national. Le présent arrêté fixe les mesures de surveillance et de lutte contre la maladie. Toute personne est tenue d'assurer une surveillance générale du fonds lui appartenant ou cultivé par elle, et de déclarer immédiatement la présence de symptômes du Plum Pox Virus soit directement au service régional chargé de la protection des végétaux dont elle dépend, soit au maire de la commune de sa résidence qui en avise alors ce service.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 645 - Ley de igualdad, equidad y erradicación de la discriminación contra las mujeres.
Policy_Content: La presente Decreto expide la Ley de igualdad, equidad y erradicación de la discriminación contra las mujeres, mediante la cual el Estado ratifica su compromiso con la plena aplicación del Principio Constitucional de Igualdad de las personas y el cumplimiento de las obligaciones derivadas en este principio aplicables a la legislación nacional y a la acción efectiva de las Instituciones del Estado. De conformidad con la Convención sobre la Eliminación de Todas las Formas de Discriminación contra la Mujer (CEDAW), esta ley prohíbe la discriminación, de derecho o de hecho, directa o indirecta, contra las mujeres. La presente Ley se fundamenta en los principios de Igualdad, Equidad, No discriminación, Respeto a las diferencias entre hombres y mujeres, y Transversalidad.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Law on foreign investments (2011).
Policy_Content: This Law shall regulate the modes of foreign investments, the rights of foreign investors, protection on foreign investors, promotion and other issues of importance for foreign investments in Montenegro. The text is divided into eight thematic Chapters: General provisions (I); Modes of foreign investments (II); Foreign investment principles (III); Protection of foreign investors (IV); Incitement and promotion of foreign investments (V); Recording of foreign investments (VI); Settlement of disputes (VII); Transitional and final provisions (VIII). For the purpose of this Law, a foreign investor shall be: Foreign legal entity or individual; Legal entity having at least 10% share of foreign capital into the total entity’s capital; Legal entity established in Montenegro by a foreign individual; Citizen of Montenegro having place of residence abroad. Foreign investment may be executed through the concession agreement, franchising agreement, agreement on financial leasing, agreement on sale and purchase of real estates and other agreement, as provided by the law. For the purpose of this Law, a foreign investment shall be a pecuniary investment, investment in goods, services, proprietary rights and securities, in accordance with the law. Foreign investment made in goods and proprietary rights shall be understood to mean an investment in fixed assets, in accordance with accounting regulations.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law shall come into force on the eighth day as of the day of its publication in the Official Gazette of Montenegro

Policy: Marine Licensing (Exempted Activities) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.R. No. 78 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order, issued under Part 4 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009, specifies activities which do not require a marine licence, or can be carried out without a licence if conditions specified in the Order are satisfied. It applies in relation to any area, and any licensable marine activity taking place in that area, in relation to which the Department of the Environment is the appropriate licensing authority under section 113 of the Act. Activities include: deposit of equipment to control, contain or recover oil, use of vehicles to remove litter or seaweed from beaches and carrying out of scientific experiments (activities that may have effect on a RAMSAR site as defined by section 37A of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981); fishing operations; and shellfish propagation and cultivation. The Regulations also contain provisions relating to waste, which implement in part Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on waste.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 204 of 2011 on Procedures for the Determination of Equitable Compensation for Immovable Property to be Alienated for Public Needs
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the procedures by which equitable compensation shall be determined for immovable property to be alienated for public needs. The State administration institution or local government the competence of which includes ensuring of the relevant public needs shall reimburse the losses which have been incurred by the former owner of the alienated immovable property in the process of alienation of the immovable property and which have not been included in the compensation or have occurred after alienation of the immovable property, without applying the procedures provided for in this Regulation. The abovementioned losses shall be reimbursed on the basis of a submission by the former owner of the alienated immovable property, to which documents certifying the amount of the losses have been appended. If the institution does not reimburse the losses referred to in this Paragraph or reimburses them partly, the former owner of the alienated immovable property has the right to apply to the court in accordance with the procedures laid down in the Civil Procedure Law.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se dan a conocer las medidas de simplificación administrativa en las materias que se indican y se expiden los formatos que se señalan.
Policy_Content: Diario Oficial de la Federación, 15 de abril de 2011.   Mediante el presente Acuerdo se simplifican los procedimientos para la realización de determinados trámites ante la Secretaría de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales, en lo que respecta a los sectores forestal, de manejo de residuos y de vida silvestre. Entre los trámites contemplados cabe destacar los siguientes:  autorización de aprovechamiento de recursos forestales maderables en terrenos forestales o preferentemente forestales; aprovechamientos forestales en selvas tropicales; autorización para realizar plantaciones forestales comerciales; autorización para adelantar el plan de corta; aviso de plantación forestal comercial; autorización, permiso o certificado de importación, exportación o reexportación de ejemplares, partes y derivados de la vida silvestre; autorización para la importación de plaguicidas, nutrientes vegetales y sustancias y materiales tóxicos o peligrosos.

Policy: National Policy for Gender Equality.
Policy_Content: The National Policy for Gender Equality is a national multi-sectoral policy developed through a consultative process led by the Bureau of Women’s Affairs of Jamaica. It was adopted in 2011 and will be implemented up to 2030 in line with the National Development Plan. The Policy outlines Jamaica’s commitment towards gender equality and encapsulates the different outcomes expected in order to achieve gender equality. Its purpose is to mainstream gender, within a human rights based framework, in all State institutions, in partnership with private sector, non-governmental and civil society organizations, in order to ensure that females and males have equal access to opportunities, resources, and rewards in order to eliminate discrimination based on gender and to promote sustainable human development. The Policy establishes the following goals: 1) to use the policy document as a strategic tool to guide a multi-faceted and multi-sectoral approach to gender equality; 2) to transform prevailing gender ideologies, inequitable gender relations and gendered governance practices at all levels of public sector organizations; and 3) to create a socio-economic, political and legal environment free of discrimination on the basis of sex, where females and males, at all stages of the life-cycle, can enjoy their full human rights and develop their full potential as citizens.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Afghanistan Strategic National Action Plan (SNAP) for Disaster Risk Reduction: Towards Peace and Stable Development.
Policy_Content: The Afghanistan Strategic National Action Plan (SNAP) for Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR): Towards Peace and Stable Development is a sectoral national strategy applicable for the period 2011-2015. It envisages achieving two goals: (1) to develop the linkages between disaster risk reduction strategies, climate change adaptation processes and invulnerable development paradigms with focus on social protection measures and inclusiveness in order to support various other initiatives to promote the ‘community at peace’ principle in Afghanistan, and (2) to minimize losses caused by disasters and climate change impacts through strategies guided by Hyogo Framework for Action, with the backdrop of peace and development.

Policy: National Health Strategic Plan 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: This document lays down the National Health Strategic Plan, an instrument with a sectoral approach applicable at the national level and covering the period from 2011 to 2015. The overall goal is to ensure that the people of the Solomon Islands will be healthy, happy, and productive. In particular, the objective is that the Solomon Islands’ population’s overall health status will improve between one to two percent by 2015. The following policies are set out, along with their respective strategies, objectives and actions to be implemented: (i) reduce the most important individual and family behavior-related risk factors through health promotion and some prevention services; (ii) the health sector and health-related sectors will reduce the most important causes of the disease burden which are feasible to reduce with cost-effective interventions and services; (iii) the health sector and health-related sectors will reduce the most important environmental risk factors (special attention is given to rural water and sanitation systems); (iv) the health sector will reduce the most important service delivery conditions risk factors; (v) the health sector and health-related sectors will improve the health status of the age and gender population groups, especially women and children, considered to be the highest priorities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Water

Policy: National Action Plan on the Sustainable Use of Plant Protection Products 2011.
Policy_Content: This National Action Plan (NAP) on the Sustainable Use of Plant Protection Products is a national cross-sectoral policy document. As the first National Action Plan on the Sustainable Use of Plant Protection Products, the NAP was published as a working group memorandum of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry in March 2011, which was intended to remain in force until 2021. The core objective of the National Action Plan is to reduce the risks to human health and to the environment arising from the use of plant protection products. Further objectives are to promote the development and implementation of integrated pest management, alternative cultivation techniques and practices, and indicators. The goal is to reduce the dependence on the use of chemical plant protection products while maintaining a high level of plant health.

Policy: Law on cooperatives.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the basic principles and rules as regard the concept of cooperatives and cooperation, that is here defined as a voluntary, open and independent society run by its members, through their work and other activities or the use of its services, on the basis of commonality and mutual assistance, aimed at realize, promote and protect their individual and common economic, financial, social, educational, cultural and other needs and interests, in order to achieve the goals for which the cooperative was founded. The cooperative is based on the cooperative values: self-help, responsibility, democracy, equality, fairness and solidarity and the moral values of honesty, openness, social responsibility and care for others.

Policy: Ministry of Food Production, Land and Marine Affairs (MFPLMA)  Strategic Plan 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: This Strategic Plan serves as the framework for the Ministry of Food Production, Land and Marine Affairs (MFPLMA) to think and work strategically in order to fulfill its mandate, according to which the institution will foster the sustainable use and conservation of agriculture and fisheries resources through appropriate science and technologies, knowledge management and economic integration that enables producers to realize profits and consumers to secure food and nutrition requirements. In implementing its mandate, the MFPLMA will focus on the six development pillars for agriculture in Trinidad and Tobago, specifically: respect for agriculture, the farmers and the land; affordable food on a sustained basis; sustainable livelihood for farmers; a mixture of traditional and technology-driven platforms; regional and extra-regional joint ventures to achieve economies of scale and export competitiveness; functional linkages between research and development and the sector to strengthen knowledge applications.

Policy: Marine Biodiversity Conservation Strategy
Policy_Content: Marine Biodiversity Conservation Strategy in Japan is a national cross-sectoral policy formulated by the Ministry of the Environment in Japan on the basis of the “National Biodiversity Strategy (2010)” under the “Basic Act on Biodiversity”, in line with the “Basic Act on Ocean Policy” and “Basic Plan on Ocean Policy”, in response to increasing public awareness on marine biodiversity.  The Strategy aims to protect the biodiversity to support the sound structure and function of marine ecosystems, and to use ecological services of the ocean, or its blessings, in a sustainable manner. The Strategy provides a basic view and direction of measures for conservation and sustainable use of the marine biodiversity.

Policy: Marine Licensing (Exempted Activities) (Scottish Inshore Region) Order 2011 (S.S.I. No. 204 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order, issued under Part 4 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009, specifies activities which do not require a marine licence, or can be carried out without a licence if conditions specified in the Order are satisfied. It applies basically to the UK territorial sea adjacent to Scotland and in relation to activities for which the Scottish Ministers are the licensing authority under section 113 of the Act. Activities include: deposit of equipment to control, contain or recover oil, use of vehicles to remove litter or seaweed from beaches and carrying out of scientific experiments (activities that may have effect on a RAMSAR site as defined by section 37A of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981); fishing operations; and shellfish propagation and cultivation. The Regulations also contain provisions relating to waste, which implement in part Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on waste.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 33 - Plan Estratégico del Ministerio del Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El Plan Estratégico del Ministerio del Ambiente es un instrumento de dirección política y técnica de todas las instancias y dependencias del Ministerio del Ambiente, el cual está alineado con los fines y objetivos establecidos en el Plan nacional para el Buen Vivir 2009-2013. Los objetivos del Plan son los siguientes: 1) incorporar los costos y beneficios ambientales y sociales en los indicadores  económicos, para así priorizar actividades productivas de menor impacto y establecer mecanismos de incentivo adecuados; 2) generar información sobre la oferta de recursos naturales estratégicos no renovables por ecosistema  para su manejo integral; 3) reducir  la vulnerabilidad ambiental, social y económica frente al cambio climático; 4) reducir  el consumo de recursos (electricidad, agua y papel) y de producción de  desechos; 5)  brindar apoyo a gobiernos locales para establecer sistemas eficientes de recolección y disposición de desechos, programas de minimización y valoración de residuos y sistemas de tratamiento de aguas servidas. El Plan establece para cada objetivo estratégico las correspondientes Metas e Indicadores.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Institution,Environmental planning,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Disasters,Sustainable development,Ozone layer,Waste prevention,Climate change,Education
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Regional Decree No. 60-pp validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Primorsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve “Primorsky” shall be classified as landscape protected area. The scope of constituting the aforesaid state nature reserve of regional significance shall be conservation of precious natural complexes of coastal area of the White Sea, biological diversity and ensuring the right of indigenous peoples to favorable environment and traditional nature management. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural ecosystems and landscapes; (b) conservation of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; and (c) ensuring the right of indigenous peoples to community nature management. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) timber extraction except for sanitary felling; (b) passage and movement of motor vehicles outside roads of general use; (c) drainage and land reclamation; (d) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and pesticides; (e) burning of vegetation; and (f) littering.

Policy: Earthquake Reconstruction and Rehabilitation Authority Act, 2011 (Act No. V of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 32 sections creates the Earthquake Reconstruction and Rehabilitation Authority. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned authority, entitled to perform all reconstruction, rehabilitation and early, recovery programmes and projects in the affected areas and in particular the following activities: conduct surveys to assess damage and carry out future planning in the affected areas; formulate a comprehensive development programme to provide for reconstruction of buildings, services, and infrastructures, drainage system, irrigation and agriculture facilities, etc.; restoration of economic activities and livelihoods; prepare resettlement and rehabilitation, plan for the affected population; approve projects, programmes and schemes identified; take steps for monitoring and evaluation of the approved projects, programmes and schemes; prescribe cost-effective technology, building codes or construction guidelines; etc.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation (EU) No. 305/2011 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products and repealing Council Directive 89/106/EEC.
Policy_Content: The rules of Member States require that construction works be designed and executed so as not to endanger the safety of persons, domestic animals or property nor damage the environment. This Regulation establishes harmonized conditions for the marketing of construction products. The basic requirements for construction works set out in Annex I shall constitute the basis for the preparation of standardisation mandates and harmonized technical specifications. Obligations of economic operators (manufacturers, their representatives, importers and distributors) are laid down. Among other essential requirements, it is stipulated that the construction works must be designed and built in such a way that they will not have an exceedingly high impact, over their entire life cycle, on the environmental quality or on the climate during their construction, use and demolition. In particulat, they shall not result in the giving-off of toxic gas; the emissions of dangerous substances, volatile organic compounds (VOC), greenhouse gases or dangerous particles into indoor or outdoor air; the emission of dangerous radiation; the release of dangerous substances into ground water, marine waters, surface waters or soil; the release of dangerous substances into drinking water or substances which have an otherwise negative impact on drinking water; faulty discharge of waste water, emission of flue gases or faulty disposal of solid or liquid waste; dampness in parts of the construction works or on surfaces within the construction works. Further, the construction works must be designed, built and demolished in such a way that the use of natural resources is sustainable and in particular ensure the following: (a) reuse or recyclability of the construction works, their materials and parts after demolition; (b) durability of the construction works; (c) use of environmentally compatible raw and secondary materials in the construction works.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Climate change,Ozone layer,Emissions,Sustainable development,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Environmental standards,Soil pollution/quality,Sustainable use,Waste management,Waste prevention,Recycling/reuse,Effluent waste water/discharge,Hazardous substances,Solid waste,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Potable water,Groundwater,Surface water

Policy: Décret n° 2011-309 du 7 mars 2011 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement de l’Observatoire National de la Parité.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Observatoire National de la Parité dont la mission est de suivre, d’évaluer et de formuler des propositions tendant à promouvoir la parité entre les hommes et les femmes dans les politiques publiques. A ce titre, il est notamment chargé de : jouer un rôle de veille, d’alerte et d’anticipation ; rassembler, en collaboration avec les ministères compétents, les institutions et les organisations de la société civile, toutes les données, recherches et analyses sur la situation des femmes à tous les niveaux de la vie économique, sociale et politique, au plan national et international ; identifier les obstacles à la mise en œuvre de la parité dans tous les domaines politique, social, culturel et économique et de relever toutes les inégalités ainsi que les anomalies notées contre les droits des femmes et l’égalité de genre ; veiller à la mise en œuvre, au suivi, au contrôle et à l’évaluation des dispositifs de protection et de sécurité propres à prévenir et à lutter contre les inégalités entre les hommes et les femmes à tous les niveaux de la vie en société ; formuler des propositions et recommandations de réformes législatives, réglementaires et de programmes favorables à l’épanouissement et à la promotion des droits économiques, sociaux et politiques pour garantir l’équité de genre et résorber les inégalités entre les sexes ; mener des recherches et des études sur l’application de la loi sur la parité ; informer et de diffuser, à chaque fois que de besoin, les données indispensables au respect des dispositions de la loi sur la parité et de toutes celles relatives à la promotion économique et sociale des femmes. Les organes de l’Observatoire sont : le Conseil d’Orientation et la Présidente.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Act on the promotion of harmonious regional development.
Policy_Content: This Act, in order to promote harmonious regional development, determines the manner of mutual coordination of the state and municipalities in regional policy planning and implementation of regional development tasks, activities and performance of development tasks in regional development matters and regional policy measures. Municipalities, associations of economic activities, self-governing national communities and non-governmental organizations shall unite in the realization of their development interests and jointly take decisions in accordance with the principle of sustainable, sustainable regional development. The programming period for the implementation of regional policy is the same as the period of each financial perspective of the European Union, as determined by the development strategy of Slovenia and EU legislation.

Policy: Emergency and Disaster Finance Regulation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth principles and procedures of procurement methods, as well as accounting and audit of disaster and emergency purchases. Furthermore this Regulation sets forth provisions on duties and authorities of the Disaster and Emergency Management Commissions and the tender committee, accounting, types of purchases, illegal practices, purchase agreement, auditing, responsibilities of the contractor and supplier, and tools and equipment provided by natural and legal persons.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on the day it is published in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Order No. 104 of the Federal Ecological, Technological and Nuclear Supervision Service validating Federal Regulation on safety of radiation sources.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes targets, basic principles, criteria and general requirements for ensuring safety of radiation sources in the process of nuclear energy management and use of radiation sources. It shall be applicable to nuclear plants, nuclear research institutions and storage facilities of radiation sources. It shall not be applicable to nuclear weapons. The purpose of safety shall be to prevent radiation impact on staff, population and environment. The basic principles of ensuring radiation safety shall be: (a) non-exceedance of individual radiation dose of staff and population (radiation rate-setting); (b) prohibition of operation of radiation sources when the advantage of the use of nuclear energy does not exceed radiation risks; and (c) keeping low radiation dose (optimization principle).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation on Land Reclamation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation regulates the activities of land reclamation, strengthens the administration of land reclamation and improves the social, economic and ecological benefits of land utilization.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Act to amend the Forest Insect and Fungi Damage Prevention Act (No. 201 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Forest Insect and Fungi Damage Prevention Act by adding section 7a on the release of biological pesticides from the air. "Biological pesticides” are preparations made from naturally occurring organisms used for the treatment of plants or plant populations for the control of plant diseases, pests or weeds or growth regulation. The section sets out prerequisites for a decision by the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry to grant to landowners the faculty to combat diseases affecting plants by spraying biological agents from the air in such manners as approved by the Ministry and at own expense. The Ministry shall take its decision on recommendation of a Forestry Centre based on an application of a landowner.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Ley Nº 2/2011 - Ley de Economía Sostenible.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto introducir en el ordenamiento jurídico las reformas estructurales necesarias para crear condiciones que favorezcan un desarrollo económico sostenible. Entendiéndose por economía sostenible un patrón de crecimiento que concilie el desarrollo económico, social y ambiental en una economía productiva y competitiva, que favorezca el empleo de calidad, la igualdad de oportunidades y la cohesión social, y que garantice el respeto ambiental y el uso racional de los recursos naturales, de forma que permita satisfacer las necesidades de las generaciones presentes sin comprometer las posibilidades de las generaciones futuras para atender sus propias necesidades.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 28 implementing Directive 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree sets out a regulatory framework for the promotion of energy from renewable sources, which include wind, solar, aerothermal, geothermal, hydrothermal and ocean energy, hydropower, biomass, landfill gas, sewage treatment plant gas and biogases. The national target for the overall share of energy from renewable sources to be attained by 2020 is 17 percent. Title II regulates the procedures to be followed for authorizing the establishment and functioning of installations producing energy from renewable sources.

Policy: Temotu Province Agriculture Ordinance 2010 (L.N. No. 24 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Ordinance of the Temotu Province concerns the administration of agriculture and the control on agricultural activities in the province. The Provincial Executive may establish a Provincial Agriculture Advisory Committee, the functions of which are defined by this Ordinance. The Ordinance lays down rules with respect to disposal of agricultural waste and the sale of agricultural produce, and requires livestock to be managed in accordance with the Temotu Province Livestock Ordinance 2008, trees to be felled in accordance with the Temotu Town and Country Planning (tree Preservation) Regulations 1993 and Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation Act, and Customary Rights to be recorded in accordance with the Temotu Province Customary Land Registration Ordinance 1992. The Ordinance also concerns: regulation-making powers of the Provincial Executive for purposes of quality control; restrictions on agriculture in protected places; and financial support for agriculture.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Order No. 145 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve “Utrish”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that state nature reserve “Utrish” shall be considered protected area of federal significance. It shall be located in Anapa and Novorossiysk municipal units (Krasnodar region). State nature reserve “Utrish” shall perform the following tasks: (a) protection of natural ecosystems with a view of conservation of biological diversity and keeping protected areas in their natural state; (b) ecological monitoring; (c) scientific research; (d) training of scientific staff; and (e) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve “Utrish”: (a) exploration, mining and extraction of minerals; (b) soil disturbance; (c)any activity causing modification of hydrogeological regime; (d) felling and collection of soft resin and non-timber forest products; and (e) ploughing up, haymaking and placing of apiaries.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Law No. 1/2011 approving the Basic Legislation on Environment.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 7 Chapters, approves the Basic Legislation on Environment. It defines the basic concepts and specifies the norms, and the basic principles related to policies and activities of protection, preservation and conservation of the environment of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. It also promote the improvement of the quality of life through a correct management of the National environment and a rational use of natural resources, in order to optimize and to guarantee the sustainability and continuity of the use of such resources. In addition, it creates the Environmental Fund. The Law is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Definition of natural components of environment (Chap. II); Instruments of Policy and Environmental management (Chap. III); Organs of environmental management (Chap. IV); Rights and duties of people (Chap. V); Sanctions (Chap. VI); Final provisions (Chap. VII).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 17 amending Presidential Decree No. 49 “implementing Directive 2002/59/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a Community vessel traffic monitoring and information system”, in accordance with Commission Directive 2009/17/EU.
Policy_Content: The Decree amends the provisions contained in Presidential Decree No. 49/2005 as regards the use of automatic identification systems by fishing vessels and the use of systems for the long-range identification and tracking of ships, in accordance with EU Directive 2009/17/EC establishing a Community vessel traffic monitoring and information system. In particular, the new article 6a establishes the use of automatic identification systems (AIS) on fishing vessels.
Subject: Fisheries, Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force as from 30 November 2010 with the exception of the provisions of paragraph 15, article 2, which will be in effect as from the date of publication in the Official Gazette. Furthermore, as from 30 November 2010 fishing vessels with total length beyond 15 metres falling under the obligation of using the equipment foreseen in article 6a, shall be liable for sanctions prescribed under paragraph 15, article 2 after three (03) months from the publication of the present Decree.

Policy: Decreto Nº 159 - Ley para la protección de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas en el Estado d Guanajuato.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley del Estado del Guanajuato establece el marco jurídico y los lineamientos de las políticas públicas para garantizar el ejercicio de los derechos colectivos e individuales de los pueblos y las comunidades indígenas, teniendo en cuenta la perspectiva de género, con especial atención a la integridad de sus tierras y a la propiedad colectiva indígena (definida en el artículo 6º). Los artículos 17 a 20 están dedicados al derecho de los indígenas a su territorio, quedando prohibidos los desplazamientos o reacomodos de los habitantes de los pueblos y las comunidades indígenas, salvo aquellos casos que provengan de las propias necesidades de dichos pueblos y comunidades o se motiven por causas del orden público. Se reconoce asimismo la importancia de proteger y preservar el medio ambiente en los territorios que habitan, ponderando el derecho que éstos tienen de participar en la utilización, aprovechamiento, administración y conservación de los recursos naturales (art. 36).
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Indigenous peoples,Institution,Common property,Gender,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Community management
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la que aprueba el formulario de encuestas estadísticas de producción minero metálica, minero no-metálica y de producción metalúrgica, así como los indicadores de desempeño, añadiendo un anexo sobre la salud ocupacional.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución dicta  normas complementarias sobre la licitación de la reserva fría de potencia.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Hydropower generation,Transport/storage,Internal trade,Contract/agreement

Policy: Coexistence Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Act of 25 November 2010 on handling of genetically modified, pathogenic or alien organisms (Organisms Act). In particular, the Ordinance regulates the : 1) cultivation of seeds of genetically modified plants and the handling of crops harvested thereof in agriculture, forestry and gardening; 2) ensures the coexistence of conventional and organic crop production with the cultivation of genetically modified plants. The text consists of 15 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Cultivation requirements (II); Separation of planting material (III); Final provisions (IV). One Annex is enclosed.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy: Release Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Ordinance is to protect human beings, animals and the environment, as well as biological diversity and their sustainable use against threat and interference through handling of pathogenic or alien organisms. The text consists of 35 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Requirements for the handling of pathogenic or alien organisms in the environment (II); Conduct of experimental releases (III); Enforcement (IV); Final provisions (V).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy: Genetically Modified Organisms Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Act of 25 November 2010 on the handling of genetically modified, pathogene or alien organisms (Organisms Act). The purpose of the Ordinance is to protect human beings and the environment, in particular animals and plants and their symbiosis against harmful or annoying effects through the handling of genetically modified organisms. The text consists of 49 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Handling of genetically modified organisms in closed systems (II); Handling of genetically modified organisms in the environment (III); Introduction of release experiments (IV); Implementation (V); Final provisions (VI). Four Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy: Closed System Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Act on the handling of genetically modified, pathogenic or alien organisms (Organisms Act) of 25 November 2010. The purpose of the present Ordinance is to protect human beings and the environment, in particular animals and plants and their organized communities and their living space against harmful or annoying effects through the handling of pathogenic organisms in closed systems. The text consists of 24 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Requirements of handling with pathogenic organisms in closed systems (II); Implementation (III); Final provisions (IV). Four Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy: Decree establishing notification requirements for measurement, calibration, testing and inspection of compliance under the Act on the air.
Policy_Content: The present Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture, Environment and Regional Development, which is composed of 16 articles and two Annexes, implements par. 33 point k) of the Act on the air and lays down notification requirements for measurement, calibration, testing and inspection of compliance under the Act.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 15 March 2011.

Policy: Environmental Management (Prohibition and Control of Ozone Depleting Substances & Ozone Depleting Substances Dependent Equipment) Regulations, 2011
Policy_Content: These Regulations prohibit the importation of ozone depleting substance (ODS) in the Second Schedule and ozone depleting substance dependent equipment (equipment or appliance which uses or whose function relies on the substances listed in the Second Schedule). Any person who wishes to import or export ozone depleting substance or ozone depleting substance dependent equipment or any chemical listed in the Third, Fourth and Fifth Schedules shall apply to the Ozone Office. The Ozone Office shall establish a register for the purpose of registering all licensed importers, exporters or consumers of ozone depleting substances and ozone depleting substance dependent equipment. Imported substances shall be clearly labelled, and every licensed importer or exporter of ozone depleting substance or equipment shall furnish the Ozone Office with annual reports or other information on import or export activities as specified. Destroying of ODS requires permission of the Ozone Office.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Ozone layer,Air quality/air pollution,International agreement-implementation,Pollution control,Waste management,Hazardous substances,International trade,Authorization/permit,Offences/penalties
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Regional Law No. 910-Z N 713-IV “On protected areas.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the field of organization, protection and use of protected areas, taking into account natural climatic features of northern nature in order to preserve the typical and unique natural complexes and objects of natural formations, biological resources, their diversity, study of natural processes in the biosphere and control over changes in its state. Protected areas on the regional territory shall be classified as federal, regional and local. Protected areas of local significance shall be administered by local government. Protected area, in accordance with their purpose, shall be classified as follows: (a) natural parks; (b) state natural reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; (e) resource reserves; (f) protected landscapes; (g) unique lakes); and (h) rest zones. When making decisions on the creation of protected areas the following criteria shall be taken into account: (a) the importance of the relevant territory for the conservation of biological diversity, including rare, endangered and economically and scientifically valuable wild fauna and wild flora species, and their habitats; (b) the presence of natural sites and landscapes, within the boundaries of the respective territory, that represent a special aesthetic, scientific and cultural value; (c) the presence of geological, mineralogical and paleontological objects, which are of special scientific, cultural and aesthetic value; and (d) the presence within the boundaries of the corresponding territory of unique natural complexes and objects, including separate natural objects, representing a special scientific, cultural and aesthetic value. Creation of protected areas shall be performed with or without expropriation of land plots from owners.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Biosphere reserves,Local government,Expropriation,Surface water,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Endangered species,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Reglamento de la inspección estatal de precios, que establece las normas para realizar, en materia de precios, inspecciones estatales, controles e inspecciones gubernamentales por parte de los inspectores estatales profesionales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Consumer protection,Agricultural commodities,Internal trade,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Inspection,Dispute settlement

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 18/2011 (II.28.) on aviation greenhouse gas emissions trading.
Policy_Content: According to EU norms, the owners of aircrafts must fill in a model form regarding their monitoring plan of emissions and send it to the competent national Authority which is the National Environmental and Nature Protection and Water Management Inspectorate. The plan must be approved by the Inspectorate. Aircraft owners must also report annually to the Inspectorate on their emissions. This Decree sets out the rules of distribution of emission units. Offences and sanctions are contained in articles 11-12. A fee must be paid for accounting and management of emission units from aviation. Fees are listed in Annex 1.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Authorization/permit,Emissions,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Monitoring,Offences/penalties,Pollution control,Data collection/reporting,Environmental audit,Environmental fees/charges,Environmental planning,Polluter pays principle

Policy: Decreto Nº 207/2011 - Apruébase la Reglamentación del Régimen de Presupuestos Mínimos para la Preservación de los Glaciares y del Ambiente Periglacial.
Policy_Content: En virtud del presente Decreto se aprueba la Reglamentación del Régimen de Presupuestos Mínimos para la Preservación de los Glaciares y del Ambiente Periglacial, establecido por la Ley Nº 26.639. Las disposiciones especifican las finalidades perseguidas por el Inventario Nacional de Glaciares y disponen que el mismo se organice geográficamente pro grandes regiones (Andes Desérticos, Andes Centrales, Andes del Norte de la Patagonia, Andes del Sur de la Patagonia y Andes de Tierra del Fuego e Islas del Atlántico Sur).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

In particular it organizes the functioning of state unitary enterprises, federal state bodies that carry out functions in the sphere of state registration of rights to immovable property, transactions thereof and state cadastre registration.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reforma el Decreto Legislativo Nº 263 de 1998 en el sentido de facilitar los procedimientos para viabilizar y materializar el financiamiento para proyectos de recuperación y conservación del medio ambiente, así como para la siembra de cultivos forestales.

Policy: Regional Law No. 12-ZKO “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of forest relations. Authorized regional state institution in the sphere of forest management shall have the following plenary powers: (a) organization of forest fire safety and extinguishment of forest fires; (b) elaboration of forest management plans; (c) validation of forestry regulations for forest districts; (d) state audit of forest management projects; (e) forest inventory; and (f) allotment of public forest plots for open-ended and limited management free of charge, lease and conclusion of purchase and sale contracts for forest species.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree-Law No. 18/2011 approving the legal regime for the construction of new buildings.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 9 Chapters, approves the legal regime for the construction of new buildings. It establishes legal norms, requirements and environmental standards to be satisfied in order to realize new buildings, or any other civil works, including for rehabilitation, extension or conservation of existing buildings, destined to being used by human beings.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Land-use planning,Urban land,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Environmental planning,Environmental standards
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: Regional Law No. 121-OZ “On regulation of some legal relations dealing with environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: The main fields of regional environmental protection shall be: (a) regional environmental lawmaking; (b) reduction of environmental risks and negative environmental impact; (c) conservation of all forms of biological diversity; (d) introduction of ecofriendly processes and technologies; (e) reduction of waste formation and promotion of waste recycling; (f) setting up protected areas; and (g) formation of ecological culture and education (art. 7). Economic stimulation of environmental protection activities shall be carried out through: (a) tax reduction, preferential taxation and credits to economic entities; (b) public subsidies; and (c) support of environmental research (art. 9). State environmental audit shall be carried out by the regional executive body competent in the sphere of environmental protection (art. 14).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret N° 2011-113 du 28 février 2011modifiant et complétant les dispositions du décret n° 2011-084 du 11 février 2011, portant application de la transparence dans la distribution de certains produits et des différentiels au niveau de leurs coûts.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret modifie les dispositions des articles 1er, 2 et 3 du décret n° 2011-084 du 11 février 2011 portant application de la transparence dans la distribution de certains produits de première nécessité (riz; sucre; farine; huile alimentaire) et stratégiques (essences; gasoil; pétrole lampant; fuel-oil; jet fuel; gaz butane; essence aviation) et des différentiels au niveau de leurs coûts.
Subject: Energy, Food & nutrition, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Resolution CONAMA No. 429 providing for the methodology used for the recovery of Permanent Preservation Areas (APPs).
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 9 articles divided into four Chapters, provides for the methodology used for the recuperation of Permanent Preservation Areas (APPs). The recuperation of Permanent Preservation Areas, considered to be in the social interest, according to the Forestry Code, must follow the methodology provisioned by this Resolution. The voluntary recuperation of a Permanent Preservation Area containing native species of the ecosystem where it is located, follows the specific recuperation methodology, other applicable standards and does not require the approval of an environmental authority. The recovery of Permanent Preservation Areas can be achieved through the following methods: I – induction of the natural regeneration of native species; II –planting of native species; and III – joint planting of native species and induction of the natural regeneration of native species. The Resolution is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Definition (Chap. II); Methodologies for the recuperation of Permanent Preservation Areas (Chap. III); Final Provisions (Chap. IV).
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Forestry protection measures,Afforestation/reforestation,Agro-forestry,Forest management/forest conservation,Plant protection,Protected area,Protection forest,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ordonnance 11-014 2011 du 28 février 2011 portant code d'hygiène.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance qui porte hygiène au Tchad, comprend 260 articles repartis en 5 titres. Le Titre I prévoit les dispositions générales. L’ordonnance régit l'hygiène et l'assainissement au Tchad. Il s'agit notamment de l'hygiène: des voies et places publiques; des établissements à caractère d'hébergement, d'alimentation et assimilés; des denrées alimentaires; de l’eau; des installations industrielles et commerciales; des habitats; des piscines et des baignades; des établissements préscolaires, scolaires et universitaires; des établissements sanitaires, vétérinaires et de recherche; des bâtiments publics et privés; du milieu naturel. Les dispositions de la présente ordonnance s'appliquent également à la lutte contre les vecteurs, la radioactivité, les épidémies, les catastrophes naturelles et les nuisances sonores.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Food quality control/food safety,Waste management,Environmental planning,Radiation,Pollution control,Basic legislation,Offences/penalties,Disasters,Risk assessment/management,Public health,Equipment,Potable water,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Vending,Packaging/labelling,Animal health,Waste disposal,Solid waste,Effluent waste water/discharge,Oil pollution,Sewerage,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Freshwater resources management

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal relatif à la mise en place d’un système communautaire de suivi du trafic des navires et d’information.
Policy_Content: Le present règlement met en enxécution le directive 2002/59/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 27 juin 2002 relative à la mise en place d’un système communautaire de suivi du trafic des navires et d’information. Notamment, l’article 5 établit que tout navire de pêche dont la longueur hors tout est supérieure à 15 mètres, en exploitation dans les eaux intérieures ou territoriales d’un Etat membre de l’Union européenne, ou débarquant ses captures dans le port d’un Etat membre de l’Union européenne est équipé, conformément au calendrier figurant à l’annexe II, point I, deuxième paragraphe, d’un système d’identification automatique (AIS) (de classe A) répondant aux normes de performance établies par l’OMI. Le texte - comprenant 18 articles – traite, entre autres, les aspects suivants: utilisation de systèmes d’identification automatique, systèmes d’enregistreurs des données du voyage, notification des marchandises dangereuses ou polluantes transportées à bord, mesures relatives aux incidents ou accidents en mer.
Subject: Fisheries, Sea, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Marine fisheries,Fishing vessel,Equipment,Pollution control,Disasters,Hazardous substances,Access-to-information,Data collection/reporting
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal fixant les critères de durabilité pour les biocarburants et bioliquides.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement grand-ducal fixe les critères de durabilité pour les biocarburants et bioliquides. L’article 2 établit qu’indépendamment du fait que les matières premières ont été cultivées sur le territoire de l’Union européenne ou en dehors de celle-ci, les biocarburants et bioliquides mis à la consommation sur le territoire national doivent respecter les critères de durabilité prévus aux articles 3 à 6 du règlement susvisé. Le texte comprend 11 articles répartis en 5 chapitres comme suit: Définitions et objet (Ier); Critères de durabilité (II); Vérification et contrôle (III);  Calcul de l’impact des biocarburants et des bioliquides sur les gaz à effet de serre  (IV); Dispositions finales (V).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Institution of Traditional or Cultural Leaders Act, 2011.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the institution of traditional and cultural leaders in Uganda and provides that, subject to the Constitution, the institution of traditional or cultural leader may exist in any area of Uganda in accordance with the culture, customs and traditions or wishes and aspirations of the people to whom it applies. A person may be installed as a traditional or cultural leader in any area of Uganda if that person derives allegiance from- (a) birth ; or (b) descent, in accordance with the customs, traditions, usage or consent of the people led by that traditional or cultural leader. A traditional or cultural leader shall not have or exercise any administrative, legislative or executive powers of Government or a local government. Any conflict or dispute within the traditional or cultural institution or within the community shall be handled by a council of elders or clan leaders or a representative body chosen and approved by the community, in accordance with the traditions, customs and norms of dispute or conflict resolution pertaining to that community.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Marine Licensing (Exempted Activities) (Wales) Order 2011 (W.S.I. No. 559 (W.81) of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order, issued under Part 4 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009, specifies activities which do not require a marine licence, or can be carried out without a licence if conditions specified in the Order are satisfied. It applies to marine activities carried on in Wales and the Welsh inshore region, in relation to which the Welsh Ministers are the licensing authority under section 113 of the Act. Activities include: deposit of equipment to control, contain or recover oil, use of vehicles to remove litter or seaweed from beaches and carrying out of scientific experiments (activities that may have effect on a RAMSAR site as defined by section 37A of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981); fishing operations; and shellfish propagation and cultivation.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Marine pollution,Fishery management and conservation,Mariculture,Crustaceans,Stock enhancement/repopulation,Authorization/permit,Ecosystem preservation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Protected area,Marine protected areas,Wetlands
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe the particulars of the matters required by section 101(1) of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009 to be contained in the register of information that shall be maintained by the Welsh Ministers as a licensing authority. The particulars concern applications and licences for licensable marine activities as identified by section 66 of the Act.

Policy: Native Land Trust (Amendment) Decree 2011 (No. 8 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Decree amends the Native Land Trust Act by establishing in that Act and all subsidiary laws made under that Act the word "native" shall be deleted wherever it appears and be replaced by the word "i Taukei". A new section is inserted in the principal Act. That section establishes that all written laws are amended by deleting all references to the word "native" wherever it appears and by inserting "i Taukei".
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Loi n° 5 - 2011 du 25 février 2011 portant promotion et protection des droits des populations autochtones.
Policy_Content: Au sens de la présente loi, sans préjudice d’une quelconque antériorité d’occupation du territoire national, on entend par populations autochtones, les populations qui se distinguent des autres groupes de la population nationale par leur identité culturelle, leur mode de vie et leur extrême vulnérabilité. L’utilisation du terme pygmée est interdite. Elle est assimilée à l’infraction d’injure telle que prévue et sanctionnée par le Code pénal.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Cultural heritage,Land tenure,Right of use,Traditional rights/customary rights,Indigenous peoples

Policy: Establishment of Ecodesign Requirements for Energy-related Products Law, 2011 (Law No. 17(Ι)/2011).
Policy_Content: This Law is issued with the aim of implementing the provisions of EU Directive 2009/125/EC, therefore aims at establishing a framework for the setting of ecodesign requirements for energy-related products. The law provides for the setting of requirements which the energy-related products covered by implementing measures must fulfill in order to be placed on the market and/or put into service. It contributes to sustainable development by increasing energy efficiency and the level of protection of the environment, while at the same time increasing the security of the energy supply (article 4). Products covered by implementing measures may be placed on the market and/or put into service only if they comply with those measures and fulfill the labeling and CE marking requirements as those are set forth in article 7 to this law. Responsibilities of the importers are established under article 8. The law contains four Annexes.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Energy conservation/energy production,Internal trade
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The law shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation Act - Declaration of Exemption 2011 (L.N. No. 13 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Notice, made by the Minister under section 4 of the Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation Act, exempts land listed in the Schedule from the provisions of that section. Section 4 requires a licence to be obtained for commercial felling. That land shall be used for the cultivation of cocoa and felling shall be permitted for purposes of land clearing. All felling of logs shall comply with the terms and conditions of a special permit to be issued by the Commissioner of Forest Resources. Non- compliance with this Notice shall be aground for its revocation.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Marine Strategy Law, 2011 (Law No. 18(Ι)/2011).
Policy_Content: The Law aims at harmonizing the Cypriot legislative framework with Directive 2008/56/EC, therefore is issued with the intention of establishing the necessary measures to achieve or maintain good environmental status in the marine environment of the Republic by the year 2020 at the latest. The provisions of the law shall apply to all marine waters of the Cypriot Republic and shall take account of the transboundary effects on the quality of the marine environment of third States in the same marine region or subregion. The Cypriot Republic shall develop a marine strategy for its marine waters in accordance with the plan of action set out in points (a) and (b) of paragraph 2 to article 7 to this law. The law consists of 20 articles as follows: Short title (art. 1); Definitions (art. 2); Scope (art. 3); Filed of application (art. 4); Duties of competent authority (art. 5); Marine regions or subregions (art. 6); Marine strategy (art. 7); Regional cooperation (art. 8); Assessment (art. 9); Determination of good environmental status (art. 10); Establishment of environmental targets (art. 11); Monitoring programme (art. 12); Programmes of measures (art. 13); Exceptions (art. 14); Recommendations for Community action (art. 15); Technical adaptations and updates (art. 16); Public consultation and information (art. 17); Issuance of Regulations (art. 18); Issuance of Orders (art. 19); Delegation of powers (art. 20). Six Annexes are attached to the text of the present Law.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Keyword: Pollution control,Marine pollution,Marine area,Transboundary effects,Monitoring,Environmental planning,Management/conservation
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 233 “On some issues of the organization of the activities of the Presidium of the Council subordinated to the President of the Russian Federation to counteract corruption.”
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes the procedure for examination by the Presidium of the Council subordinated to the President of the Russian Federation to counteract corruption of the following issues: (a) issues related to the compliance with the requirements related to official conduct of persons occupying state positions in public offices of the Russian Federation; and (b) application of a citizen who held a public office of the Russian Federation or a federal civil service position giving consent to hold a position in a commercial or non-profit organization and (or) to perform in such an organization work (provision of services to such organization) on the terms of a civil law contract in cases stipulated by federal laws, if certain functions of the state management functions of such organization were part of his official (service) duties, until the expiration of two years from the date of dismissal from public office or dismissal from public service. Presidium can make one of the following decisions: (a) to establish that the case in question shows no evidence of a violation by a person holding a public office of the Russian Federation or a federal civil service position of the requirements of official (service) conduct; and (b) to establish that in the case under review there are indications of a violation by a person holding a public office of the Russian Federation or a federal civil service position has violated the requirements of official (service) conduct. In this case the Presidium shall prepare a report to the President of the Russian Federation or the Chairman of the Government of the Russian Federation and, if necessary, notifies the head of the federal government agency in which the person is serving.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Institution,Transport/storage,Oil pollution,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Subsidy/incentive,Pollution control,Waste management,Waste non-domestic sources,Solid waste
