Policy: National Strategy for Biodiversity of the State of Kuwait 2011-2020.
Policy_Content: This National Strategy for Biodiversity is a sectoral document, prepared under the Aichi Biodiversity Targets adopted by the parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity, aiming at (i) protecting the biological diversity in the resources of natural, modified and agricultural systems; (ii) encouraging the sustainable use of these resources for the benefit of present and future generations; (iii) integrating biodiversity considerations into the national planning and development process by educating all relevant national sectors and motivating them to implement the Strategy's provisions in their respective fields; and (iv) creating a framework for a coherent and integrated policy that supports the conservation of biological diversity and the optimum and sustainable use of the national biological resources. The scope of the document is expanding, including protection, reconstruction, rehabilitation, optimal and fair use, and periodic research, as well as monitoring of biodiversity in the country. The Strategy includes a National Action Plan to achieve the goals, indicating activities, means of implementation, and bodies responsible for implementation, and that envisages three different steps of implementation (1) a short-term plan (1-3 years); (2) a medium-term plan (3-5 years); and a aong-term plan (5-10 years).

Policy: Federal Emergency Response Plan.
Policy_Content: The Federal Emergency Response Plan is a sectoral instrument designed to harmonize federal emergency response efforts with those of the provinces/territorial governments, non-governmental organizations, and the private sector. The FERP applies to domestic emergencies and to international emergencies with a domestic impact. This plan has both national and regional level components, which provide a framework for effective integration of effort both horizontally and vertically throughout the Federal Government. In that sense, the document defines as strategic objectives the following: to save lives, reduce personal injuries, and protect and maintain public health; to protect property and the environment; to maintain law, order and national security; to maintain public confidence; and to reduce economic and social losses.

Policy: Programme national pour l'alimentation (PNA) 2011
Policy_Content: Le présent Programme national pour l'alimentation (PNA) est un document sectoriel de la France à portée nationale qui a pour objectif principal d’une action publique intégrant toutes les problématiques de l'alimentation et du modèle alimentaire français et regroupant les initiatives sectorielles existantes (agriculture, pêche, santé, consommation, environnement, tourisme, éducation, culture, aménagement du territoire...). Le Programme national pour l’alimentation comporte quatre axes qui abordent les quatre cibles concernées : l'aliment (origine, composition, salubrité, accessibilité), le consommateur (éducation, information, facteurs favorisant les comportements alimentaires positifs), les opérateurs du secteur alimentaire (offre alimentaire, conditions de production, recherche, compétitivité), et enfin les aspects relatifs à la culture et au patrimoine alimentaires.

Policy: New Well Royalty Regulation (Alta Reg 32/2011).
Policy_Content: This Regulation applies to royalty on eligible production recovered or obtained from a new well. Eligible production are crude oil or gas recovered or obtained from a well event is they are not excluded production, if they are recovered or obtained from a well event in a new well, including a well event specified in a schedule to this Regulation, if the Crown interest in it is greater than 0%, and if they are subject to the payment of royalty under the Petroleum Royalty Regulation, 2009 (AR 222/2008), the Natural Gas Royalty Regulation, 2009 (AR 221/2008) or section 27 of the Oil Sands Royalty Regulation, 2009 (AR 223/2008).

Policy: Forest Research Strategy for Namibia (2011 - 2015)
Policy_Content: The Policy is prepared on the premise that forests hold enormous economic value and their provision of environmental goods and services often require political intervention in both exploitation and protection, and that it is of general interest for policy and financial support for forest research to improve management for production and to maintain or enhance the ecological or environmental functions of forests. The Policy acknowledges the need to manage Namibia’s dry forests through engaging in more research on the subject, and identifies the challenges which impinge upon management efforts, including: dry conditions limit growth and yield of forest products leading to increasing demands for forest products by rural populations; the difficulty in balancing between protection of forests for ecological functions and the need for direct economic uses of forest resources; the heavy reliance on few species for commercial exploitation; dry conditions of the woodlands are associated with slow growth rates and poor regeneration; the use of fire as a land preparation tool. The Strategy proposes that the research should directly aim to address the key issues and challenges to managing forests and woodland resources, including: understanding the direct and underlying drivers of deforestation and degradation; poor levels of natural regeneration in commercially exploited species; limited success in tree growing under artificial regeneration systems; inadequate data on growth and yield on species of interest; inadequate efforts and products from value-added processing of wood and non-wood products; inadequate numbers of skilled researchers in the forest sector; problems associated with governance systems and structures in key programmes such as the community forest management programme. The strategic research areas, which are collected based on the views of Namibian stakeholders include, vegetation (forest and rangeland) monitoring programme, forest products (value-added) research, ecological studies, growth and yield studies, silvicultural research, economic, policy and sociological research, and management of information. The Strategy proposes objectives, guidelines to key actions and expected results for each of these strategic areas.

Policy: Integrated National Land Use Guidelines.
Policy_Content: These guidelines identify the main challenges and threats relating to land use in Kenya, including globalization, land use conflict, urbanization, population pressure, poor land use planning, climate change, water pollution, among others. It sets its goals and principles on the basis of tackling these challenges; specifically its principles are anchored on the efficient use of land, a socially oriented use of land to enable equality and public participation, the sustainable use of land, the harmonization of resource use-conservation and utilization and promotion of compatibility, planning for the unexpected events, and the precautionary principle. The guidelines aims to resolve land-use conflicts, prevent and mitigate land degradation, promote sustainable land management and manage natural and anthropogenic disasters. The guidelines takes a detailed approach on several ways in which land is used and provides specific guides for them, it provides guidelines for the use of agricultural land, the management of invasive species, guides on wetlands, rivers, lakes and other water bodies, guides on air strips, etc.

Policy: Plan Nacional para la Prevención y Erradicación del Trabajo Infantil y de la Protección del Trabajo Adolescente para el período 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: El presente Plan Nacional para la Prevención y Erradicación del Trabajo Infantil y de la Protección del Trabajo Adolescente para el período 2011-2015, elaborado por la Comisión Nacional para la Erradicación del Trabajo Infantil (CONAETI), tiene por Objetivo general prevenir y erradicar el trabajo infantil en todas sus formas y proteger el trabajo adolescente, a través del desarrollo de acciones que favorezcan la participación de los distintos actores sociales en todo el país. Constituyen sus Objetivos específicos: 1) Garantizar la permanente difusión, sensibilización, información y formación en materia de prevención y erradicación del trabajo infantil y protección del trabajo adolescente; 2) Promover, sostener y afianzar un sistema integral de información permanente sobre trabajo infantil y adolescente; 3) Fortalecer el rol institucional y el funcionamiento continuo de las Comisiones Provinciales para la Prevención y Erradicación del Trabajo Infantil (COPRETI); 4) Fortalecer integralmente al grupo familiar de las niñas y los niños que trabajan y de los que están en situación y/o en riesgo de trabajo; 5) Fortalecer los sistemas de inspección del trabajo en materia de prevención y erradicación del trabajo infantil y protección del trabajo adolescente y promover la figura del inspector de trabajo como actor clave para la protección de la infancia y la adolescencia; 6) Implementar, además de la inspección de trabajo, otros mecanismos de prevención y detección del trabajo infantil y protección del trabajo adolescente a partir de actores sociales involucrados en la problemática; 7) Impulsar en el marco de la prevención y erradicación del trabajo infantil, una educación que garantice la inclusión y/o permanencia de todos los niños, niñas y adolescentes en el sistema educativo formal, en el período que por ley se considera obligatorio; 8) Promover en el marco de la prevención y erradicación del trabajo infantil la atención de la salud integral (física-psíquica-social) y de las consecuencias del trabajo en el crecimiento y desarrollo de niños y niñas que trabajan, en riesgo y en situación de trabajo y de los adolescentes que se encuentren trabajando; 9) Propiciar y participar en la elaboración y adecuación de normas para la prevención y erradicación del trabajo infantil y la protección del trabajo adolescente; 10) Promover la participación de los distintos actores sociales en la prevención y erradicación de las denominadas peores formas de trabajo infantil y adolescente. La CONAETI será la Unidad Ejecutora del Plan Nacional, para coordinar, evaluar y dar seguimiento a las acciones de prevención y erradicación del trabajo infantil en el marco del Plan Nacional.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring and the Government of Yaroslavl region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Yaroslavl region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Yaroslavl region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Yaroslavl region.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring and the Government of Voronezh region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Voronezh region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Voronezh region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Voronezh region.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Contract/agreement,Pollution control,Monitoring,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Public health,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Agreement enters into force from the date of signature.

Policy: National Policy for Women and Gender Equality 2011 – 2015.
Policy_Content: The National Policy for Women and Gender Equality lays down strategies on (I) the development of legal, policy and institutional frameworks with a gender inclusive and sensitive approach to ensure equal rights and opportunities for women and men in all spheres and structures of government as well as in the workplace, the community and the family; and (II) gender mainstreaming in national strategies and programmes for women's empowerment and equal participation. Priority action areas are set out as gender-based violence; women's nutrition, health and hygiene; disease prevention; education and training; cultural norms and traditions; women's economic empowerment through improved access to productive resources, marketing skills and extension services, especially for women in agriculture and fisheries; employment opportunities; women’s participation in decision-making processes; increased agricultural production to protect food security; and protection of environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural development,Gender,Education,Extension,Equity,Public participation,Protection of environment,Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Food security,Nutrition
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Cross-Sectoral National Gender Strategy: Promoting Gender Equality and Equity 2011-2013.
Policy_Content: This Strategy is a sectoral document aiming at providing guiding principles on how to consider gender issues in the development work of the different ministries to allow the adoption of an effective institutional approach. The Vision at the basis is as follows "A democratic society living in a climate of social justice, where men and women, girls and boys, enjoy equal citizenship rights and equal opportunities in the public and private spheres seeking to build an independent state that effectively and efficiently invests in the abilities and potentials of its male and female citizens for achieving just and sustainable development that broadens the choices of people, with all members of society taking part in it and enjoying its fruits".
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Sanitation and Hygiene Master Plan.
Policy_Content: This Sanitation and Hygiene Master Plan is a sectoral policy document at the national level, covering the period of 2011-2017. The goal of the Master Plan is to attain universal access to improved sanitation by 2017 for better hygiene, health and environment.

Policy: National Policy on Biosafety.
Policy_Content: This National Policy on Biosafety is a cross-sectoral policy document, covering the period of 2011-2017. The Biosafety Policy renews the commitment of the government, in ensuring adequate levels of protection in the safe use of modern biotechnology based on the precautionary principle, within the framework of sustainable development for the benefit of present and future generations.

Policy: Strategic Plan for New and Renewable Energy Sector for the period (2011 - 2017).
Policy_Content: This Strategic Plan for New and Renewable Energy Sector for the period (2011 - 2017) is a sectoral  policy document at the national level. The document outlines the mission, objectives, goals, implementation, and evaluation plan for India's renewable energy sector. The strategy includes on-grid and off-grid solutions, and focuses on financial incentives for implementing a policy emphasizing off-grid biomass and solar technology in rural settings. It sets up the Vision of the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE):  to upscale and mainstream the use of new and renewable energy sources in furtherance of the national aim of energy security and energy independence, with attendant positive impact on local, national and global environment. The key objectives of the Ministry are: 1 To promote deployment of grid-interactive renewable power generation projects 2 To promote renewable energy initiatives for: 1) meeting energy/ lighting needs in rural areas 2) supplementing energy needs in urban areas 3) supplementing energy needs in industry and commercial establishments, and 3 To promote research, design and development activities at premier national institutions and industries on different aspects of new and renewable energy technologies and help development of new products 4 To encourage development of a Robust Manufacturing Industry in Renewable Energy Sector.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia

Policy: Getting the best from our land: A land use strategy for Scotland.
Policy_Content: The Getting the best from our land: A land use strategy for Scotland Strategy (2011) sets out a long term Vision towards 2050 on land uses. The Strategy's vision  is "A Scotland where we fully recognise, understand and value the importance of our land resources, and where our plans and decisions about land use deliver  improved and enduring benefits, enhancing the wellbeing of our nation".

Policy: Ethiopian Standards Agency Establishment Council of Ministers Regulation (No. 193/2010).
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the Ethiopian Standards Agency as an autonomous federal government office and defines its functions and powers. The Agency shall, among other things, develop Ethiopian standards and establish a system that enables checking whether goods and services are in compliance with the required standards. The Regulation also concerns use of the national standard mark. The use of the national standard mark with respect to any product shall require the holding of a permit issued by the Agency upon ascertaining the conformity of the product to the relevant Ethiopian standard by an authorized conformity assessment body.

Policy: Marine Strategy Regulations 2011.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, also for the purpose of transposing into the law of Gibraltar of Directive 2008/56/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 June 2008 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of marine environmental policy, are establishing the complete set of provisions necessary for the elaboration and implementation of national marine strategies. The competent authority shall exercise its functions under these Regulations so as to secure compliance with the requirements of the Directive, including the requirement to take necessary measures to achieve or maintain good environmental status of marine waters within the marine strategy area by 31 December 2020. The competent authority must integrate the measures devised under this regulation into the programme of measures, taking into account relevant measures required under any applicable EU provision, any other applicable international obligation and domestic legislation.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea

Policy: Marine Licensing (Exempted Activities) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 409 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Order, issued under Part 4 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009, specifies activities which do not require a marine licence, or can be carried out without a licence if conditions specified in the Order are satisfied. It applies to marine activities carried on any area, in relation to which the Secretary of State is the licensing authority under section 113 of the Act. Activities include: deposit of equipment to control, contain or recover oil, use of vehicles to remove litter or seaweed from beaches and carrying out of scientific experiments (activities that may have effect on a RAMSAR site as defined by section 37A of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981); fishing operations; and shellfish propagation and cultivation.

Policy: Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009 (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 405 of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend section 75 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009 by adding further conditions to the exemption from marine licensing for dredging and waste deposit activities carried out by, or on behalf of, harbour authorities. The conditions apply to activities involving the relocation of sediments inside surface waters, where this is done for specified purposes and where it can be proved to the appropriate licensing authority that the sediments are not hazardous waste. They are consistent with the limits of the exclusion from Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on waste.

Policy: Ordonnance sur l’utilisation rationnelle de l'énergie dans les constructions et les installations (OURE).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution la loi sur l’énérgie du 15 janvier 2004. L’ordonnance fixe les exigences relatives à l’utilisation économe et rationnelle de l’énergie ainsi qu’au recours aux énergies renouvelables, applicables à la conception, à la réalisation et à l’exploitation des bâtiments, des installations ainsi que de leurs équipements. Le texte comprend 50 articles répartis en 9 chapitres comme suit: Généralités (1er); Enveloppe des bâtiments (2); Part maximale d’énergies non renouvelables pour les nouveaux bâtiments (3); Installations techniques (4); Décompte individuel des frais de chauffage et d’eau chaude sanitaire (6); Exemplarité des bâtiments publics (7); Standards de qualité dans le domaine du bâtiment (8); Exécution (9). Quattre annexes sont jointes.
Subject: Energy, Water
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties,Hydropower generation,Water rights,Pollution control,Concession,Inspection,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance, à l’exception des articles 14, 15, 16, 19, 28 et 31, entre en vigueur le 1er mars 2011.

Policy: Decreto por el que se reforman y adicionan diversas disposiciones del Reglamento de la Ley General del Equilibrio Ecológico y la Protección al Ambiente en Materia de Ordenamiento Ecológico.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica algunas disposiciones del Reglamento la Ley General del Equilibrio Ecológico y la Protección al Ambiente en Materia de Ordenamiento Ecológico, en el sentido de actualizarlas al régimen de actividades hidrocarburíferas y a la distribución de las relativas competencias entre Gobierno federal y Estados. Se establece que los programas de ordenamiento ecológico regional no podrán considerar o regular las actividades que permiten el desarrollo de la industria de hidrocarburos, ni las actividades a que se refiere el artículo 3º fracción XI de la Ley de la Agencia Nacional de Seguridad Industrial y de Protección al Medio Ambiente del Sector Hidrocarburos, en acatamiento en la Ley de Hidrocarburos (siendo la industria de hidrocarburos de exclusiva jurisdicción federal).

Policy: Act amending the Act on forest reproductive material.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down some amendments and addenda to the Act on forest reproductive material. In particular, the present Act amends provisions concerning recognitions of sources of forest reproductive material (par. 8 of the amended Act), sampling, collection and list the origin of forest reproductive material (par. 10), and packaging and labeling of forest reproductive material and the accompanying letter of forest reproductive material (par. 11).

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 31/11 regulating the public coastal zone management in the Province of Luanda.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree, consisting of 2 Chapters, regulates spatial planning for public lands within the coastal area of the Province of Luanda transferring them to the private sector, according to Law No. 9/98. In particular, it regulates the public coastal lands and public territories within the maritime areas destined to the settlement of infrastructures and support equipments, not only limited for beach facilities, but also for the entire marine coastal zones within the Province of Luanda. This Law applies to the maritime areas as well as to the protection territorial strips with a maximum extension of 500 metres from Province of Luanda.

Policy: Decision No. 0538/MAF of the Minister on Good Agriculture Practices for Environmental Management Standard.
Policy_Content: This Decision, consisting of six Parts, establishes Good Agriculture Practices for Environmental Management Standard. It aims at conserving and protecting the environment in the area and surrounding farm area. Good Agriculture Practices for Environmental Management has adopted the Asean GAP. This Module includes the requirements that producers and operators shall apply in production system in order to preserve and protect the environment inside and surrounding areas of farm. These Standards apply to individual, entity, family and organizations within country and outside the country that wants to produce Good Agriculture Practices for Environmental Management standard in Lao PDR.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Agreement No. 0539/MAF of the Minister on Good Agriculture Practices for Produce Quality Management Standard.
Policy_Content: This Agreement, consisting of six Parts, establishes Good Agriculture Practices for Food Safety Standard. This Agreement is provisioned to supervise as a tool for practicing Good Agriculture Practice of Quality Management Standard for fruit and vegetable production; as to create added value for fruit and vegetable; as well as to improve the quality of supply chain in fruit and vegetables production to meet the requirements of domestic and international markets. Good Agriculture Practice on Quality Management Standard has adapted from ASEAN GAP. This Agreement includes general requirements that producers and operators have to apply in their production system in order to improve quality of produces and meet market requirements. This Agreement applies to all persons, families and organizations that apply Good Agriculture Practices standards for producing fresh fruit and vegetables in Lao PDR.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Act amending the Act on trading of emission quotas.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down some amendments and addenda to the Act on trading of emission quotas. In particular, the present Act amends provisions concerning allocation of greenhouse gases, obligations of operators and aircraft operators and validity of allowances.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Climate change,Emissions,Environmental standards

Policy: Green Fund (Amendments) Regulations, 2011 (Chapter 77:01).
Policy_Content: The Regulations add the definition of non-governmental organization as "a non-profit incorporated body which is engaged in activities related to the remediation, reforestation and conservation of the environment" and add Article 2A regarding the registration of any community group or non-governmental organisation that wishes to access the Green Fund. Furthermore, the definition of community group in the Regulations is amended as "a group of individuals from a particular locality within Trinidad and Tobago which is engaged in activities relating to the remediation, reforestation and conservation of the environment in that locality", and the definition of organization is amended as "a body incorporated by statute other than the Companies Act but including such non-profit company under section 308(2) of the Companies Act, which is engaged in activities related to the remediation reforestation and conservation of the environment".
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Special fund,Non-governmental entity,Community management,Afforestation/reforestation,Protection of environment,Registration,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Décret n° 2011-189 du 8 février 2011 portant création et fixant les règles d’organisation et de fonctionnement du Fonds national de Promotion de la Jeunesse (FNPJ).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée, dans les conditions prévues par la loi d’orientation n° 2009-20 du 4 mai 2009 sur les agences d’exécution, notamment en son article 16, un Fonds dénommé: Fonds national de Promotion de la Jeunesse (FNPJ). Le Fonds national de Promotion de la Jeunesse a pour missions notamment de financer des: projets de création d’entreprises ou d’activités génératrices de revenus initiés par les jeunes ou leurs groupements; actions de formation, d’information et de communication des jeunes qui concourent à l’insertion des jeunes; projets d’études, de suivi, de supervision et d’évaluation des programmes d’insertion des jeunes. Les organes du Fonds national de Promotion de la Jeunesse sont le Conseil de Surveillance ; et la Direction générale.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Promotion of the Use of Energy from Renewable Sources Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 243  of 2011).
Policy_Content: These Regulations transpose in the United Kingdom specified articles of Directive 2009/28/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources. They, among other things: designate the competent authority for purposes of the Directive and these Regulations; require the Secretary of State to ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the United Kingdom as calculated in accordance with article 5 of the Directive is increased as specified and require the Secretary of State to introduce measures for this purpose; provide for information of the public and certification schemes for installers of renewable energy systems.
Subject: Energy

Policy_Content: Item 5 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The following documents shall be requested for the issuance of licence: (a) application; (b) copies of Statute and state registration certificate - for legal persons; (c) copy of personal identification document – for natural persons; (d) copy of state registration certificate – for individual entrepreneurs; (e) tax inspection registration certificate; (f) copy of diploma; (g) copy of recipe of payment of licensing fees; (h) copy of employment history; (i) documents attesting availability of facilities, premises and equipment; and (j) copy of qualification certificate of environmental auditor.”

Policy_Content: Item 3 of the Article 1 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Agrochemicals – fertilizers of chemical or biological origin, chemical ameliorator, fodder additive destined for plant feeding, regulation of soil fertility and feeding of animals. This concept shall not be applicable to peat”.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 165-r validating the Strategy of social and economic development of the Volga Federal District.
Policy_Content: Strategy of social and economic development of the Volga Federal District is a regional cross-sectoral policy document, which determines main directions, mechanisms and tools to achieve the strategic development goals of the Volga Federal District for the period until 2020. It envisages the solution of social and institutional problems, the most important of which are: a significant level of social inequality, a sufficiently large proportion of the population in poverty and high risks of doing business. The results of the formation of zones of advanced development will be significant improvement in the welfare and quality of life of the District population as a result of the most efficient and integrated use of resources and potential of all regions. The purpose of the development of the agro-industrial complex in the Volga Federal District is to meet the needs of the District population in affordable and high quality foodstuffs based on the growth of the efficiency of agro-industrial production and increasing its competitiveness. Promising areas for the development of food and processing industries shall be: (a) increasing food production through the introduction of modern resource-saving wasteless production and storage technologies; (b) increase in consumer indicators of food products, replacement of low-quality foodstuffs on the regional market with high quality foodstuffs; (c) expanding the range of locally produced foodstuffs, including new generation products; and (d) development of integration and cooperation of agricultural producers and organizations of the processing industry.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 36 of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources validating the assessment criteria for potential environmental impact of genetically modified organisms.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the criteria for the environmental impact assessment of genetically modified organisms (GMOs) and their metabolites, taking into account the impact of methods and agents throughout their production cycle, the probability of occurrence and probable magnitude of the negative environmental impact when handling the GMO in an open system, based on independent experimental studies and reliable data on the research of such impacts for each specific GMO, its intended use and the likely potential receiving environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ordinance on the use of fuels containing sulphur in marine harbours.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance enforces the Council Directive 1999/32/EC relating to a reduction in the sulphur content of certain liquid fuels. The purpose of the Ordinance is to reduce air pollution caused by use of marine fuels containing sulphur. The text consists of 6 articles as follows: Purpose (1); Sphere of application (2); Maximum sulphur content of marine fuels (3); Monitoring, competence (4); Penalties (5); Entry into force (6).

Policy_Content: La part de l'Etat, constituée notamment de la Royalty, de la Marge distribuable, de la part de Profit oil et de la Participation, est perçue conformément aux conventions pétrolières en vigueur et fait l'objet d'une prise en charge comptable et fiscale suivant les dispositions du présent Décret.

Policy: Order No. 96 on voluntary participation in the  eco-management and audit scheme "EMAS".
Policy_Content: The Order specifically aims to preventing and controlling pollution of air, water, soil and subsoil, and noise; it provides hygienic rules concerning environment and people; limits the use and waste of raw materials and other resources; promotes the use of cleaner technology and promotes recycling procedures reducing issues related with waste management. In order to fulfill these goals, organizations may voluntarily register with the Eco-management and Audit Scheme (EMAS) through the national Environmental Protection Agency.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 13 Chapters, establishes the requirements to be satisfied in order to request the environmental licence. It creates the environmental licensing system to perform any public or private project which may affect negatively the environment. The Environmental Licensing System is based on the potential environmental impact assessment of any project taking into consideration its dimension, technical characteristics and location.

Policy: Ordinance on erosion-prone agricultural land.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to agricultural land being prone to erosion. In particular, the Ordinance establishes with a view to direct payments and other fundings, the classification of agricultural land according to their degree of erosion risks by water and wind. The text consists of 4 articles as follows: Subject matter (1); Classification of agricultural land (2); Non-standard requirements (3); Entry into force (4). One Annex is enclosed.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Subsidy/incentive,Financial agricultural measures,Classification/declassification,Erosion,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality

Policy: Order No. 10 of the Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food validating the Regulation on the technology of grain storage in grain storage facilities using polymeric flexible pipes.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure and conditions for the placement and storage of grain, except for grain used for sowing, in grain storage facilities using polymeric flexible pipes. In the process of placing and storing grain in grain storage facilities using polymeric flexible pipes, grain storage agents must ensure compliance with safe working conditions, fire safety rules, industrial sanitation, environmental protection, requirements for industrial buildings and structures, engineering structures and networks, production facilities purpose, territory, equipment, facilities for production purpose and technological laboratory of grain storage in accordance facility with the requirements of the Technical Regulation, this Instruction and other normative legal acts. Plan for placement of lots of grain in grain storage facilities shall be drafted and lots of grain shall be stored in accordance with the aforesaid plan.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Order enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Marine Spark-Ignition Engine, Vessel and Off-Road Recreational Vehicle Emission Regulations(SOR/2011-10).
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to: a) reduce emissions of hydrocarbons, oxides of nitrogen and carbon monoxide from engines, vessels and vehicles by establishing emission limits for those substances or combinations of those substances; b) reduce emissions of certain toxic substances by establishing emission limits for hydrocarbons from engines, vessels and vehicles; and c) establish emission standards and test procedures for engines, vessels and vehicles that are aligned with those of the EPA. The text consisting of 44 sections deals, inter alia, with the following aspects: national emission marks and labels, standards, reports, importation requirements and documents, direct information, exemption, entry into force. One Schedule is enclosed.

Policy: Order No. 23 of the Ministry of Administration and Interior validating the Regulation on the organization, functioning and tasks of the Strategic Committee for the support and evaluation of the activity of the Anti-Corruption Division.
Policy_Content: Strategic Committee for the support and evaluation of the activity of National Anti-Corruption Division is an office without legal personality, which is organized and operating within the Ministry of Administration and Interior. The scope of Strategic Committee is to support the activity of National Anti - Corruption Division, as well as to make recommendations on the directions of actions for combating corruption. Strategic Committee shall perform the following functions: (a) supports the prevention activity and combats corruption among the Ministry of Administration and Interior staff by identifying the required measures, using the experience of its staff in this field, without bringing prejudice to the attributions of the judicial bodies; (b) supports the National Anti-Corruption Division in identifying the risk factors in the field of preventing and combating corruption within the Ministry of Administration and Interior; (c) analyzes and evaluates the objective and subjective situations of corruption nature to improve the activities of National Anti-Corruption Division and formulate proposals and recommendations; (d) evaluates the implementation of the actions of prevention of corruption; (e) formulates recommendations on the elaboration of sectoral plans in the field of prevention of corruption by the Ministry of Administration and Interior; (f) supports the institutional development and functioning of National Anti-Corruption Division by providing its members with data and information required for countering corruption activity; (g) makes proposals for the draft normative acts; (h) makes proposals regarding harmonization of internal normative framework with newly adopted international legal instruments on preventing and combating corruption; and (i) analyzes the results of studies and research on the causes and state of corruption.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Regulation on water profile in bathing water.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of five paragraphs and one Annex, establishes: (1) the way of preparing water profile in bathing water; (2) detailed scope of information included in water profile and the way of their presenting; (3) the procedure of water profile update. Organizer of bathing water is obliged to prepare water profile using information received from: Inspection of Environmental Protection, State Sanitary Inspection, regional directors of water management and directors of maritime authorities.
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.
Keyword: Marine pollution,Pollution control,Monitoring,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Recreational water use
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Décret n°0273/PR/MEF du 2 février 2011 fixant le statut des bois abandonnés.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret, pris en application des 134 et 296 de la loi n° 16/01 du 31 décembre 2001 portant Code Forestier en République Gabonaise, fixe le statut des bois abandonnés. Au sens du présent décret, les bois abandonnés désignent un tronc d'arbre abattu, ébranché, étêté, tronçonné ou scié, issu d'une exploitation forestière et utilisable comme matériau bois. Peuvent également être considérés comme bois abandonnés, les bois délaissés dans les parcs à bois et les chantiers fonctionnels. A l'issue du délai de six mois prévu à l'article 134 du Code Forestier, le bois abandonné devient la propriété de l'Etat.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Policy: Protected Areas Order, 2011 (Cap. 204).
Policy_Content: This Order declares the areas, places or premises described in the Schedule to be protected areas for purposes of the Protected Areas Act and stipulates that no person shall be in those areas without permission of the prescribed authority or the Minister of State for Provincial Administration and Internal Security.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Resolución Nº 353 - Modifica el Reglamento para el aseguramiento y entrega de prestaciones del Seguro Social Campesino.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la reglamentación de la Ley de Ordenamiento Territorial de los Bosques Nativos de la Provincia de Córdoba. Entre las disposiciones reglamentarias cabe destacar la definición de aprovechamiento sustentable de los bosques y las normas relativas a los Planes de Conservación con Aprovechamiento Sustentable, de Manejo Sostenible, y de Aprovechamiento con Cambio de Uso del Suelo, en superficies menores a 10 hectáreas que sean propiedad de comunidades indígenas, campesinos o de pequeños productores. Asimismo el Decreto reglamenta las prácticas de manejo de las categorías de conservación de los bosques nativos.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Decree on river basin management plans and plans for flood risk management.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Environment and the Ministry of Agriculture sets out measures to reduce the risk of adverse effects associated with floods and regulates: (1) the content of river basin management plans and plans for flood risk management; (2) the content of basic and supplementary measures for water protection; (3) the manner and form of presentation of the preliminary flood risk; (4) the method of determining areas with significant flood risk; (5) the content of flood hazard maps, flood risk maps and forms of their publication; (5) method of making the preparatory work, draft river basin management plans and draft plans for flood risk management. The Annexes specify: the basic content of the national river basin management plan (Annex 1), list of maps in the river basin management plans (Annex 2), the basic contents of the plan of sub-basin (Annex 3), the content of the flood risk management plan (Annex 4).
Subject: Land & soil, Water, Sea
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 17 February 2011.

Policy: Regulation of Ministry of Forestry of R.I. No. P.7/Menhut-II/2011 on the Public Information Service within the Ministry of Forestry.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 19 articles divided into eight Chapters, establishes the principles of public information services in the Ministry of Forestry as follows: 1. Each public information is open and accessible to every user of public information, unless the information is exempt; 2. Public information is strictly rigid, restricted and confidential in accordance with the Law, proper, and common interests based on examinations of the consequences. The purposes of public information services in the Ministry of Forestry are: 1. To create a harmonious two-way communication between providers and the applicants as well as users of forestry information; 2. To ensure the integration between forestry information providers with PPID of the Ministry of Forestry scope in the service of forestry information to the public. The principles of public information services in the Ministry of Forestry are: 1. Public information is provided by promoting the principles of easy, fast, timely and simple; 2. The public information services are implemented through one stop service; 3. Presentation of public information provided to the applicant, is in accordance to the available type and format.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 4 February 2011.

Policy: Cabinet Decision No.15 of 2011, as amended by Resolution No.37 of 2014, to establish the Committee on Climate Change and Clean Development and determine its terms of reference.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 10 articles aims at establishing the Committee on Climate Change and Clean Development at the Ministry of Environment. Main tasks of the Committee are (i) follow-up to the meetings of the States Parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and its Kyoto Protocol; (ii) propose national policies and action plans for reducing greenhouse gas emissions; (iii) ensure that governmental and non-governmental entities implement the commitments of the Framework Convention on Climate Change and its Kyoto Protocol; (iv) prepare databases in accordance with the requirements of the Convention and the Protocol referred to; (iv) prepare periodic national reports; (v) propose strategies for Clean Development Mechanism and improve the related capacity-building; and (vi) ensure that the proposed clean development projects have been reviewed and evaluated to achieve technology transfer and contribute to sustainable development. The Committee shall report to the Council of Ministers every six months on the results of its work.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Executive Order No. 23 Declaring a Moratorium on the Cutting and Harvesting of Timber in the Natural and Residual Forests and Creating the Anti-Illegal Logging Task Force.
Policy_Content: This Executive Order establishes a Moratorium on the Cutting and Harvesting of Timber in the Natural and Residual Forests and creates the Anti-Illegal Logging Task Force. This moratorium aims to implement this policy, the following are hereby instituted: The DENR is prohibited from issuing logging contracts/agreements in all natural and residual forests, such as Integrated Forest Management Agreements (IFMA), Socialized Integrated Forest Management Agreements (SIFMA), Community-Based Forest Management Agreement (CBFMA) and other agreements/contracts with logging components in natural and residual forests; The DENR is likewise prohibited from issuing/renewing tree cutting permits in all forests nationwide, except for preparation for tree plantations; silvicultural treatment and similar activities. Tree cutting associated with cultural practices pursuant to the indigenous Peoples Rights Act (IPRA Law) may be allowed only complying with existing guidelines of the DENR; The DENR shall strictly implement a forest certification system in accordance with the United Nations standard/guidelines to ascertain the sustainability of legal sources and chain of custody of timber and wood products, nationwide; etc.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Public forest,Timber extraction/logging,Afforestation/reforestation,Timber,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Indigenous peoples
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Executive Order enters into force immediately.

Policy: Forestry Management Act 2011.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 89 sections, divided into 13 Parts, provides for the effective and sustainable management of Samoa’s forestry resources, and for related purposes. The Forestry Management Act 2011 is administered by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment. This Act establishes that the Ministry shall have the principal responsibility for the management of the forestry resources in Samoa, and shall have the sole power to issue rights to exploit the forestry resources and shall formulate policies and implement programs and activities to support the development of forest plantations and farm agro-forestry in Samoa.

Policy: Décret exécutif nº 11-33 du 22 Safar 1432 correspondant au 27 janvier 2011 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement de l’institut algérien des énergies renouvelables.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte création, organisation et fonctionnement de l’institut algérien des énergies renouvelables. L’institut a pour missions: la prise en charge des besoins des institutions, entreprises et organismes publics et privés en matière de formation, de spécialisation, de perfectionnement et de recyclage dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique; la promotion de la recherche appliquée et la valorisation des résultats de la recherche dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique; la réalisation d’installations pilotes de démonstration dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique; l’accompagnement et l’encadrement de ses clients en matière d’assistance, de conseil et de développement de projets dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique; la conclusion d’accords et/ou conventions de coopération à l’échelle nationale et internationale dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Decreto Nº 279/10 - Ley especial reguladora de proyectos públicos de energía renovable.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley especial reguladora de proyectos públicos de energía renovable, declara de apremiante urgencia de interés público y necesidad nacional de la más alta prioridad, la construcción y puesta en funcionamiento de los proyectos de generación de energía con recursos renovables nacionales.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 36 validating the Regulation on calculation of minimum national share in commodities, works and services related to subsoil management to be included in terms and conditions of tender for concession of the right of subsoil management.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of calculation of minimum national share in commodities, works and services related to subsoil management to be included in terms and conditions of tender for concession of the right of subsoil management. The aforesaid tender shall be applicable to mining of solid minerals and hydrocarbons. This Ministerial Decree contains calculation formula.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Commission Regulation (EU) No. 65/2011 laying down detailed rules for the implementation of Council Regulation (EC) No. 1698/2005, as regards the implementation of control procedures as well as cross-compliance in respect of rural  development support measures.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets out detailed rules for the implementation of control procedures as well as cross-compliance in respect of the cofinanced rural development support measures established pursuant to Regulation (EC) No. 1698/2005, concerning European Union support for rural development, which is financed by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD). The Regulation lays down specific provisions on applications for support, payment claims and other related declarations. Further it regulates controls on compliance with the eligibility criteria, commitments and linked obligations.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Special fund,Rural youth

Policy: Provisions of the People's Republic of China on the Administration of Emergency Preparedness for and Emergency Response to Vessel-Induced Pollution to the Marine Environment.
Policy_Content: These Provisions are developed in order to enhance the capability of emergency response to vessel-induced pollution accidents, and control, alleviate and eliminate the damage of pollution to the marine environment caused by vessel-induced pollution accidents. The Provisions consist of 44 articles divided into 7 Chapters: General provisions (I); Building of emergency response capability and emergency response plans (II); Vessel-Induced Pollution Clean-Up Entities (III); Signing of the agreement on the removal of the vessel-induced pollution (IV); Emergency handling (V); Legal responsibilities (VI); Supplementary provisions (VII).
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Keyword: Pollution control,Marine pollution,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Policy/planning,Capacity building,Offences/penalties
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Provisions entered into force on 1 June 2011.

Policy: Regulation on the organization and functioning of public administration.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines and regulates the work, duties and responsibilities of all Ministries and other administrative bodies, determines the organization and operation of state administration and regulates the issues necessary for the execution of decisions of the Constitutional Court of Montenegro, as well as other issues of importance for the organization and operation of state administration.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on the day of its publication in the "Official Gazette".

Policy: Law No. 5.248 creating the Municipal Policy for the Climate Change and Sustainable Development in the Municipality of Rio de Janeiro.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 27 articles divided into seven Chapters, creates the Municipal Policy on Climate Change and Sustainable Development, provides for the establishment of targets for the reduction of anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions to the Municipality of Rio de Janeiro. The Municipal Policy aims to: establish a strategy for reducing anthropic greenhouse gas emissions in the Municipality and a policy of adaptation to the effects of climate change; promote effective actions for the necessary protection of the climate system; ensure the compatibility of economic and social development with the protection of the environment and the climate system, with a view to sustainable development; promote Clean Development Mechanism projects and other instruments and mechanisms to reduce emissions or sinks of greenhouse gases; make the population aware of changes in the climate and of the sense of urgency needed to prevent and cope with its consequences; establish mechanisms to stimulate changes in production and consumption patterns, economic activities, transport and urban and rural land use, with a focus on environmental sustainability of processes and mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions and absorption of gases by sinks; carry out actions to increase the share of renewable sources in the energy matrix of the Municipality; identify vulnerabilities and promote effective actions to adapt to the negative impacts of climate change, protecting mainly the most vulnerable populations and ecosystems; ensure the participation of civil society in consultative and deliberative processes related to climate change; promote wide dissemination on aspects related to climate change; stimulate research, development and scientific innovation related to the climate system; encourage the use and exchange of technologies and practices environmentally responsible for mitigation and adaptation to climate change; stimulate cooperation with other levels of government, with non-governmental organizations, the private sector, academia and multilateral organizations for the implementation of climate change policy and to encourage sustainable development strategies.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Climate change,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Emissions,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Zoning,Polluter pays principle,Pollution control,Sustainable development,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 779 – Modifica Decreto Supremo Nº 29.354 de 2007, que establece la existencia de la causal de expropiación por utilidad pública de reagrupamiento y redistribución de la tierra, con fines de dotación a favor del Pueblo Indígena Guaraní del Departamento de Chuquisaca.
Policy_Content: En virtud del presente Decreto se modifican los Parágrafos I y II del Artículo 3 del Decreto Supremo N° 29.354, de 28 de noviembre de 2007, por el cual se estableció la existencia de la causal de expropiación por utilidad pública de reagrupamiento y redistribución de la tierra, con fines de dotación a favor del Pueblo Indígena Guaraní del Departamento de Chuquisaca. En particular se dispone que el Ministerio de Economía y Finanzas Públicas, a requerimiento del Ministerio de Desarrollo Rural y Tierras, previa evaluación y de acuerdo a su disponibilidad financiera, asignará recursos a favor de Instituto Nacional de Reforma Agraria, para realizar la cancelación de los montos indemnizatorios emergentes de expropiación de predios. Asimismo se autoriza al Instituto Nacional de Reforma Agraria a efectuar transferencias público-privadas al Pueblo Indígena Guaraní de los predios emergentes de la expropiación.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Regulation No. 111 date 26.11.2011 amending Regulation No. 486 date 25.7.2007 suspending the processing operations of the ships that transport oil, gas, and their by-products at the ports of Durres and Shengjini.
Policy_Content: This Regulation amends Regulation 486 of 2007 by repealing the suspension of processing operations carried out by ships at the Shengjini port.  The processing operations of fuel and its by-products will restart at the Shengjini port according to the legislative framework into force and the Albanian engineering standards. The products should be deposited into a modern terminal located at appropriate distances from private or public objects. For safety reasons the minimum distance of the terminal from the discharge point should not be less than 2500 linear meters. The depositing terminal should respect the external and internal safety requirements, the parameters of environmental protection, and the technical requirements into force.
Subject: Energy, Sea
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force at once.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 19 validating the Regulation on energy saving certificate.

The aforesaid energetic inspection shall be applicable to enterprises and individual entrepreneurs.

Regulation 7 provides the circumstances in which the Secretary of State may rely on verification reports.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 19 validating the Regulation on data collection, processing and reporting on energy efficiency.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of collection and processing of data contained in energy performance certificates and reporting on energy efficiency. The Ministry of Energy shall carry out: (a) registration of energy performance certificates compiled by results of compulsory and voluntary energy inspections; (b) analyze obtained data for compliance with energy saving and energy efficiency criteria; and (c) for electronic database of energy performance certificates. Energy performance certificate data shall be analyzed according to the following criteria: (a) availability of energy expenditure calculators; (b) amount of utilized energy resource and its variation; (c) amount of losses of transferred energy; (d) energy saving potential; (e) energy saving arrangements; and (f) use of secondary energy resources and renewable energy.
Subject: Energy

Policy_Content: La présente loi porte  mission, organisation, fonctionnement et attributions de l’office rwandais des ressources naturelles (RNRA). RNRA est l’organe responsable de la gestion du développement des ressources naturelles, comprenant la terre, l’eau, les forêts, les mines et la géologie. Il est chargé de la supervision, du suivi et de s’assurer de la promotion et de la protection des ressources naturelles dans les programmes et activités de tous les organes nationaux.

Policy: Directives sous-régionales sur la participation des populations locales et autochtones et des ONG à la gestion durable des forêts d’Afrique Centrale du 25 janvier 2011.
Policy_Content: Les présentes directives, adoptées par Décision n° 001/COMIFAC/PR/CM/CO.ORD/VI/11 du 25 janvier 2011 portant adoption des Directives sous-régionales sur l’implication des populations locales autochtones et ONG dans la gestion forestière en Afrique Centrale, ont pour but de déterminer les bases communes de l'intégration de la participation des populations et des ONG dans la gestion durable des forêts en Afrique centrale. Elles définissent le les éléments nécessaires pour la formulation et la mise en œuvre des cadres politiques, stratégiques, législatifs, réglementaires et institutionnels de gestion participative des forêts d'Afrique centrale.

Policy: Order No. 7 of the Federal Forest Agency validating Regional Forest plan.
Policy_Content: Federal Forest Agency of the Russian Federation, validating Regional Forest plan decrees that it shall be mandatory guiding document for state forest management bodies at all levels. Forest plan contains characteristics of the state of forests, classification of forests by categories and forest species. It also contains information on the amount of timber extraction, forest fire protection arrangements and pest control measures. Decree sets forth the main directions of forest management, forest protection, and afforestation and reforestation arrangements. Forest plan also contains assessment and evaluation of economic efficiency of forest management.

Policy: Decree No. 8/2011 promulgating the Oil and Gas Law.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 72 articles aims at providing for all petroleum substances (crude oil and natural gas), which are located on the territory of the Sultanate of Oman, or in the internal waters or territorial sea or exclusive economic zone or continental shelf. It establishes that (i) all minerals in situ are owned by the state; (ii) the rights to explore, prospect for, appraise, develop and exploit oil and gas are granted on the basis of a concession agreement, executed in the form of an exploration and production sharing agreement (EPSA); (iii) the Ministry of Oil and Gas (MOG) is the authorized authority, acting on behalf of the Government of the Sultanate of Oman, to negotiate and execute EPSAs with selected oil and gas exploration and production companies; and (iv) an EPSA can only take effect after a Sultani Decree approving it has been promulgated. The Law also (i) prohibits to import, export or transport of petroleum substances, store, distribute, manufacture, market or carry any other operations without a license from the Ministry of Oil and Gas; (ii) permits to universities, institutes and national research centers, after obtaining a Ministry permit, to conduct scientific research related to the petroleum activities, provided that they are obliged to submit the results and findings of their researches to the Ministry; (iii) prohibits to carryout any survey or exploration, discovery, development or exploitation of petroleum substances without the Concession Agreement whose details are indicated in arts.13-25; and (iv) prohibits to carry out operations covered by the Concession Agreement at a distance of less than 200 meters from the cities, villages and roads, archaeological sites, nature reserves and sites of natural protected areas, dams, springs, wells, restricted areas and any other facilities.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen., Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Oil,Natural gas,Protection of environment,Concession,International trade,Authorization/permit,Transport/storage,Research,Waste disposal,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste management,Groundwater,Potable water,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control

Policy: Biomass Processing Challenge Fund (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011 (S.R. No. 9 of 2011).

Policy: Decree relative to environmental control (SFS 2011:13).
Policy_Content: This Decree, based principally on Chapter 26 of the Environmental Code, provides for the development and functioning of public control mechanisms for purposes of environment protection. Operative control authorities shall plan their objectives and develop their capacities as for control and supervision. The Decree also defines the application sphere of control objectives for municipal and district authorities and other public bodies. This includes, among other things, wildlife protection and national parks, animal protection, water resources protection, biotechnology, fish culture and use of genetically modified organisms, biotopic, and marine research.

Policy: Order No. 144 on classification and implementation of goals for international environment conservation areas.
Policy_Content: This Order sets out regulations on the classification of internationally protected natural areas as part of the Natura-2000 planning and Natura-2000 forest planning. The designated conservation areas are divided by habitat types: terrestrial habitat (Appendix I), forest habitat (Appendix II), and lake/pond habitat (Appendix III). Each designated international conservation area includes a target for its status, although there may be different targets for areas within the designated area. Target setting is made on the basis of analysis in adherence with the Environmental Act No. 335 of 26 March 2007 (in particular article 41). Objectives of each conservation area can be adjusted in the revision of the Natura-2000 plan.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Decree No. 750 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve  “The lake Shuchie”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve of regional significance “The lake Shuchie” shall be classified as complex (landscape) protected area. The scope of constituting state nature reserve of regional significance “The lake Shuchie” shall be conservation and reproduction of precious natural complexes, urban forests and maintaining ecological balance. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural ecosystem (taiga forest of the Karelian Isthmus); (b) conservation of glaciofluvial relief; (c) conservation and reproduction of biological and landscape biodiversity; and (c) ecological education and educational tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) residential housing construction; (b) gardening, horticulture and smallholding; (c) environmental and soil pollution; (d) exploration of subsoil and mining, including soil disturbance; (e) burning of bonfires; (f) felling of forest species and timber extraction; (g) burning of vegetation; (h) waste disposal; and (i) passage and grazing of livestock.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

The text consists of 83articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); The parcel of land and its development (2); Building structures (3); Parties involved in construction (4); Control Boards, administrative proceedings (5); Transitional and final provisions (6). Two Annexes are enclosed.

It is an instrument of regulation and promotion of national development, translated into objectives, strategies, plans, programmes and actions (projects and activities) of the Executive, and related results and impacts. The National Planning System aims to promote the sustainable, harmonious, balanced, sectoral and territorial development of the country, ensuring the fair distribution of national income, the preservation of the environment and the quality of life of citizens.

Policy: Ministerial Joint Decree No. 312751 establishing the three-year apiculture Programme (years 2011, 2012 and 2013), in compliance with Council Regulation (EC) No 1234/2007.
Policy_Content: This Decree, by the Ministers of Rural Development and Food, Economics, Internal affairs and Decentralisation and the Minister of Electronic Governance, establishes the three-year national apiculture Program and provides for the clearance of  funds connected thereto. With the Decree, credit for the implementation of the individual Actions of the Programme for the year 2011 is also approved. The 2011-2013 Programme is established with a view to improving the general conditions for honey production and marketing of apiculture products in Greece and is the follow up of the existing 2008-2010 beekeeping Program which has expired on 31 August 2010 and included similar structure and actions. The Community shall provide part-financing for the apiculture programme equivalent to fifty percent of the total expenditures. For this Programme, the sum of 16,6 millions of Euro is allocated for the three-year period while the sum of 5,4 millions of Euro has been approved for the year 2011 for the following actions: technical assistance (Action 1); rationalisation of transhumance (movable beehives) (Action 3); support measures for laboratory analysis of the chemical and natural characteristics of honey (Action 4); applied research (Action 6). Decrees issued by the Minister of Rural Development and Food shall determine the details of implementation, the beneficiaries, the sums of subsidy per Action, the transfer of funds, the terms and conditions on the provision of financial support, the required documentation and in general any measure deemed necessary for the implementation of the present Programme.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on 1 September 2010 and shall remain into force until 31 August 2013.

Policy: Law No. 2939-VI “On access to public information”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the modalities of access and ensuring everyone’s right of access to information in possession of public authority and other distributors of information of public interest. Public information shall be open to public access except for cases envisaged by acting legislation. The scope of this Law is to ensure transparency and openness of public authority and implementation of the mechanism of access to public information. Restriction on access to information can be imposed, inter alia, for the protection of public health.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition

A new comma (2) is added, which requires the Ministry to control and monitor the Regional State Administrative Agencies and Economic Development, Transport and the Environment on matters for which it is competent. Policy: Decree on mandatory funds and equipment for personal, mutual and collective protection against natural and other disasters.

These provisions are meant for all participants in actions and procedures for protection against natural and other disasters. This text indicates detailed issues ad regards the necessary resources and related equipment held and used for aims of protection and rescue of life and health of people, material goods and environment, or to mitigate the effects of certain phenomena or dangers which pose certain threat to human life and health in general.

Policy_Content: The purpose of this Order is to identify and map areas where preparation of noise action plans are needed for certain infrastructures. It applies to external noise, such as roads, airports, train rails, city areas, etc.
