Policy: Décret n° 2011 - 12 du 12 janvier 2011 portant création, attributions et organisation du Point Focal du Programme Détaillé pour le Développement de l’Agriculture Africaine du Nouveau Partenariat pour le Développement de l’Afrique.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret  porte création, attributions et organisation du Point Focal du Programme Détaillé pour le Développement de l’Agriculture Africaine du Nouveau Partenariat pour le Développement de l’Afrique. Le point focal national du programme détaillé pour le développement de l’agriculture africaine est l’organe technique qui assiste le ministre de l’agriculture et de l’élevage dans la mise en oeuvre du programme détaillé pour le développement de l’agriculture africaine du nouveau partenariat pour le développement de l’Afrique. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment, de: - vulgariser le programme détaillé pour le développement de l’agriculture africaine auprès des institutions nationales et de la société civile en vue de son appropriation ; - identifier et mobiliser toutes les sources de financement des projets retenus dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté et la faim; - analyser et actualiser les stratégies nationales de sécurité alimentaire et de développement agricole à long terme; - participer à l’élaboration des programmes nationaux d’investissement à moyen terme; - aider à la formulation des profils de projets d’investissement bancables; - promouvoir et développer des partenariats pour le financement des programmes et projets retenus dans le cadre du Programme Détaillé pour le développement de l’agriculture africaine ; - veiller à l’intégration des projets dans les plans nationaux de développement; - suivre et veiller à la participation du Congo à toutes les rencontres liées à la mise en oeuvre du programme détaillé pour le développement de l’agriculture africaine du NEPAD.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Décret n°2011-016/PR du 12 janvier 2011 portant organisation et fonctionnement de la commission nationale du développement durable.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’organisation et le fonctionnement de la commission nationale du développement durable (CNDD) conformément à la loi n°2008-005 du 30 mai 2008 portant loi-cadre sur l’environnement au Togo. La commission nationale du développement durable (CNDD) est un organe de concertation chargée de: suivre l’intégration de la dimension environnementale dans les politiques et stratégies de développement ; veiller au respect, à la synergie et à la mise en œuvre des conventions internationales relatives à l’environnement ratifiées par le Togo et produire tous les ans un rapport; proposer des orientations politiques en faveur du développement durable; suivre la mise en œuvre de la politique nationale de développement durable et produire tous les deux (02) ans un rapport sur le développement durable ; émettre des avis sur toute politique, toute stratégie de développement susceptible d’affecter l’environnement, les ressources naturelles, l’équité sociale et l’efficacité économique ; veiller à la promotion des modes de consommation et de production durable et à la prise de mesures de lutte contre toute forme de gaspillage, à la maîtrise des technologies propres dans l’industrie et des stratégies de lutte contre la pollution de l’air, de l’eau et des sols; veiller à l’implication de tous les acteurs concernés dans les processus de développement durable. Les organes de la commission nationale de développement durable sont: l’assemblée générale des membres de la commission nationale du développement durable; le secrétariat permanent de la commission nationale du développement durable; le comité technique; les organes thématiques.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Plan de Igualdad, No Discriminación y Buen Vivir para las Mujeres Ecuatorianas. Marco conceptual, Ruta metodológica y Estrategia de Transversalización 2010-2014.
Policy_Content: El presente documento contiene el Plan de Igualdad, No Discriminación y Buen Vivir para las Mujeres Ecuatorianas. El Plan, que tiene alcance nacional y se refiere al período 2010-2014, expresa una visión de desarrollo que privilegia la consecución del buen vivir, presupone la ampliación de las libertades, oportunidades y potencialidades de los seres humanos, e implica recuperar las capacidades de gestión, planificación, regulación y redistribución del Estado, profundizando los procesos de desconcentración, descentralización y participación ciudadana. Las políticas delineadas por el plan descansan sobre los siguientes tres pilares: a) redistribución; b) reconocimiento; c) representación.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Land & soil

Policy: Agriculture and Livestock Five-Year Research Strategy, 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: This Agriculture and Livestock Five-Year Research Strategy, 2011-2015 is a key document of the Directorate General of Agricultural and Livestock Research, which shows vision, mission and goals to improve the quality of research in the relevant priority areas in consonance with country’s vision 2020. Agriculture resources (indigenous plant genetic resources for food and agriculture) also contribute to food security The indigenous crops of Oman (wheat, barley, chickpea, dates, and lime) with traditional food value are cultivated in almost all regions are a strategic crops for food security as they form the base of Omani diet (5). Extensive greenhouse technology to grow vegetables crops ensures quality produce, enhances their availability in the market in off-times and rewards the income of farmers to contribute to food security in the country. Expected Outcomes of are: Enrichment of the date palm trees for their commercial use and maintain biodiversity of fruit tree crops for food security. In line with its objectives, the Directorate General of Agriculture & Livestock Research (DGALR) has formulated a Strategy with the following objectives: enhancement of agricultural and livestock sectors to support food security along with plant and animal genetic resources management, continued rehabilitation and construction of research infrastructures and capacity building in collaboration with national stakeholders and international organizations.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Policy/planning,Agricultural development,Research,Irrigation,Institution,Biotechnology,Food security,Pests/diseases,Animal feed/feedstuffs,Animal health,Animal production,Genetic resources,Biodiversity
Geographical_area: Indian Ocean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Strategic Programme for Climate Resilience.
Policy_Content: In 2010, the Government of Tajikistan launched the Pilot Programme (PPCR) for Climate Resilience to shift from a business as usual to a climate  resilience  development  path  by  piloting  approaches  to integrate  climate  risks  in  development  planning.  The  Strategic Programme  for  Climate  Resilience  (SPCR)  summarizes the  country driven  strategic  approach  to  climate  resilience,  and  defines  the underlying  investment  programme  for  PPCR  support.  The  SPCR outlines six investment and capacity building activities under PPCR in Tajikistan.  The  six  components  are:  building  capacity  for  climate resilience; improvement of weather, climate and hydrological service delivery; climate science  and modelling programme; enhancing the climate resilience of the energy sector;  agriculture  and sustainable land management; and building climate resilience in the Pyanj river basin
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Irrigation,Smallholders/peasants,Climate change,Disasters,Governance,Public participation,Risk assessment/management,Food security,Poverty,Capacity building,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Ecosystem preservation

Policy: Sixth National Development Plan 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: The Sixth National Development Plan (SNDP) s a multi-sectoral planning instrument applicable at the national level and covering the period from 2011 to 2015. It is the successor to the Fifth  National Development Plan (FNDP), aimed at  actualizing the aspirations of the Vision  2030  of becoming a prosperous middle-income nation by 2030. The objectives of the SNDP are to: accelerate infrastructure development; economic growth and diversification; promote rural  investment and accelerate poverty reduction,  and enhance human development. While recognizing the importance of balanced growth in all sectors of the economy, the SNDP priority growth  sectors are agriculture, livestock and fisheries, mining,tourism, manufacturing and commerce and trade.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries

Policy: Política Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional (PNASAN) 2011-2015.
Policy_Content: El presente documento establece la Política Nacional de Seguridad Alimentaria y Nutricional (PNASAN), la cual tiene cobertura nacional y se aplica durante el período 2011-2015. La Política presenta un enfoque intersectorial. Su objetivo consiste en volver una realidad el derecho a la alimentación, eliminando la pobreza y las desigualdades sociales que existan en el país. Al fin de enfrentar la problemática relacionada con la seguridad alimentaria y nutricional, el documento establece ocho líneas estratégicas que están orientadas a la intervención tanto en aspectos de la producción como en aspectos del saneamiento y la inocuidad de los alimentos.  Se definen las siguientes ocho líneas estratégicas: 1) promover y mejorar la producción nacional de alimentos inocuos y saludables, de manera económica, social y ambientalmente sostenible, contribuyendo a mejorar su disponibilidad y diversificación; 2) garantizar el acceso físico, económico y cultural a una alimentación inocua y saludable; 3) promover prácticas de alimentación saludable; 4) asegurar el acceso y la calidad de los servicios de salud y agua segura, así como promover prácticas adecuadas de higiene y saneamiento básico; 5) garantizar la calidad e inocuidad de los alimentos; 6) implementar un sistema de información, vigilancia, monitoreo y evaluación de la seguridad alimentaria y nutricional a nivel nacional, departamental y municipal; 7) fomentar la investigación e innovación tecnológica; 8) desarrollar y fortalecer la institucionalidad que garantice la adopción de una visión  integral y multisectorial de la seguridad alimentaria y nutricional. En el marco de estas líneas estrégicas, el Capítulo VII identifica los objetivos específicos. El Capítulo VIII establece Acciones prioritarias para Garantizar el acceso físico, económico y cultural a una alimentación inocua y saludable, y en lo específico para garantizar la calidad nutricional y la sostenibilidad de los programas de salud y alimentación de la población escolar, así como de otras poblaciones en situación de vulnerabilidad.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural development,Right to water,Social protection,Sustainable development,Poverty,Financial agricultural measures,Rural employment,Family farming,Climate change,Disasters,Risk assessment/management,Food security,Right to food,Nutrition,Food sovereignty,Gender,School feeding,Human rights,Land tenure,Smallholders/peasants

Policy: Law No. 16.790 providing for the recovering and management of the Legal Reserve Areas and creating the Sustainable Legal Reserve (RLS) within the State of Paraná.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 10 articles, provides for the recovering and management of the Legal Reserve Areas and creating the Sustainable Legal Reserve (RLS) within the State of Paraná. The State may establish policies for the compensation and creation of legal reserves, taking into account the following criteria: establish the technical criteria for compensation in areas outside the same hydrographic basin, as provided in article 44 of the Forest Code; create and restore biodiversity corridors; establish that areas to be compensated and the legal reserves are contiguous to other APP areas, ecological parks or forest reserves; allow the compensation of the legal reserve by small landowners, according to National Institute of Colonization and Agrarian Reform (INCRA) in areas in the same river basin; compensation of the legal reserve may be made in degraded areas, to be recovered, through a technical project approved by the IAP. IAP regulation should cover the use of native and exotic species, provided they are non-invasive and complying with specific sustainable management activities.

Policy: Regulation concerning Procedures to Access and Manage Funds on Behalf of Affected Communities by Community Forestry Development Committees (No. 111-10).
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Forestry Development Authority (FDA) implements provisions of the National Forestry Reform Law of 2006, which allocates to counties and local communities a percentage of land rental fees collected from commercial forestry operations contributes to the sustainable management of the Republic’s forest estate and helps to ensure that the people most affected by timber extraction also share in its benefits. This Regulation provides for procedures for allocating and distributing in a transparent and accountable manner such financial benefits to counties and local communities entitled to benefit sharing under Forest Resources Licenses. There shall be a Trust, which shall be governed by a Trust Board. The Holder of a Forestry Licence shall pay its land rental fee to the Ministry of Finance annually.  In conformity with Section 32 of Authority Regulation 106-07, the Authority shall transfer thirty percent (30%) of the money within the land rental fee account on a quarterly basis into the Trust account. A Community Forestry Development Committee may request disbursement of funds only if the Committee satisfies the requirements of Section 62 of Authority Regulation 105-07. Community Forestry Development Committees shall submit written project proposals to the Trust Board requesting funds for a specified project. These project proposals shall include the information specified.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Seed Law (The State Peace and Development Council Law No. 1 / 2011)
Policy_Content: The objectives of this Law aim to develop commercial flower/fruit and propagable and cultivable plant seed by cultivating and producing crops using pure seed for the development of the agricultural sector in Myanmar. The Law is regulated by the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation which will appoint the formation of the National Seed Committee, responsible for the implementation of seed policy – including research, seed quality inspection bodies, packaging and issuance of a “recognition certification” (certificate recognizing the production or introduction of new plant varieties based on seed samples and quality). Certification shall follow after approval and lab testing at seed test laboratories. The Technical Seed Committee shall inspect and authorize whether production is appropriately cultivable in Myanmar, if better than existing varieties, and whether its production affects environmental biodiversity. The provisions contained in this Law shall not apply to the distribution and sale of seed produced by any farmer to another farmer (art. 31); however, farmers and seed researchers who produce seed in co-operation with departments and services under the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation shall be exempted from obtaining a licence under this Law. Distribution and sale of fruit, flower, plant and parts of plant are not permitted for multiplication. Administration and legal provisions are detailed in Chapter VIII, X and XI.

Policy: Coastal Regulation Zone Notification S.O.19(E).
Policy_Content: In adherence to the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 (29 of 1986), the Central Government shall ensure security to fishery communities and others living in the coastal areas, by setting rules aiming to conserve and protect coastal stretches and their marine area through sustainable measure development. Regulation Zone (hereinafter referred to as the CRZ) shall be classified as areas of these stretches (islands of Andaman and Nicobar, Lakshadweep and the marine areas surrounding them are excluded) where activities causing environmental risk may occur (pollution, sea level rise due to global warming, waste, flood etc.) and – as a consequence - shall be restricted as and controlled by the Central Government. The CRZ classified areas shall be controlled from the establishing of any operations or processes related to hazardous substances as specified in the Hazardous Substances (Handling, Management and Transboundary Movement) Rules, 2009. It is prohibited to setting up and expanding new industries, manufacture or handling oil storage or disposal of hazardous substance, setting up and expanding fish processing units including warehousing (except hatchery), land reclamation or disturbing the natural course of seawater, setting up and expanding units of waste or/and discharge of untreated waste and effluents from industries, construction debris, industrial solid wastes, port and harbour projects in highly eroding stretches of the coast (except projects classified as strategic and defence-related in accordance to EIA notification, 2006), mining of sand, rocks and other sub-strata materials. Classification of the CRZ area: CRZ-I (art. 7) – for the purpose of conserving and protecting the coastal ecologically sensitive area (national parks, sea biodiversity, marine flora and fauna, etc.). CRZ-II (developing area which already provides water supply and sewage). CRZ-III (included in the first two CRZ areas) including coastal zone rural areas. CRZ-IV including sea water area influenced by tides. The coastal States and Union Territory will prepare within a period of twenty four months from the date of issue of this Notification a 1:25 000 scale map identifying and classifying the CRZ areas within the respective territories in accordance with the guidelines given in Annex I. This will be submitted to the State Government for appraisal, compliance and eventual implementation and enforcement.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Fifth Social, Economic and Cultural Development Plan 2011-2015
Policy_Content: This Plan consists of nine Chapters divided into 235 Articles: Iranian-Islamic Culture (I); Science and Technology (II); Social Affairs (III); Administrative and Management System (IV); Economic Affairs (V); Regional Development (VI); Defense, Political and Security Affairs (VII); Legal Affairs (VIII); Budget and Monitoring (IX). In order to improve food security, the government plans to; provide adequate financial support to increase the number of industrial slaughterhouses and develop the semi-industrial and traditional slaughterhouses; increase the support of the agriculture sector to a minimum of 35% of agricultural product’s values; support increases in the production of animal protein derived from a variety of livestock, poultry and aquaculture; control animal diseases; guarantee investment in agricultural and food security; and implement the plan to ensure food security from farm to person’s plate. The Government should actively support the activities and decision of the High Council for Health and Food Security, which was established by the Fourth Social, Economic and Cultural Development Plan. The Ministry of Health and Medical Education shall announce a list of healthy and safe food and the desirable food diet for different age groups. In order to support the agricultural and industrial sectors, the Government plans to support knowledge-based companies and facilitate the use of new technologies. The Government plans to modify the utilization of forests, rangelands, water and soil through: replacement of fossil fuel by renewable resources of energy; development of wood farming and fighting with wood smuggling; forest management; encouragement of the industrial reproduction of livestock; and desertification. The Government is responsible to protect, rehabilitate and sustainably use the environment, natural resources and biodiversity. To improve the livelihoods in rural areas, increase the income of villagers and reduce the differences between the quality of life in urban and rural areas, the Government plans to: promote rural development standards; provide villagers with modern services; support the growth of industrial agriculture; support rural handicrafts and tourism; modify management systems in rural areas; renovate and immunize rural housings; provide villagers with technical education necessary for their empowerment; support entrepreneurship; improve rural roads system; provide financial facilities to improve the employment amongst villagers and nomads; and increase the partnership of governmental and non-governmental sectors for rural development. In order to increase added value in the agriculture sector to achieve the growth in sustainable development by 7% per year, and to increase food security’s infrastructure of the country, the government plans to: maintain the agricultural capacities of the country and to achieve self-sufficiency in the production of basic agricultural and livestock products including wheat, barley, corn, rice, oilseed, sugar beet and sugarcane, white meat, red meat, milk and eggs; modify the consumption pattern based on nutrition standards; expand industrial and knowledge-based agriculture; improve  agricultural irrigation efficiency by at least 40%, through implementation of water and soil infrastructure operations, including modernization, upgrading and growth of the irrigation network; fighting pests and plants diseases, efficient use of pesticides and fertilizers; develop organic cultivations; apply national quality control standards; upgrade agriculture machineries; and expand the coverage of agricultural products. In order to preserve water resources of the country and sustainable development of the water resources the Ministry of Energy shall maintain the balance between the insertion and extraction of ground water.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Forestry, Cultivated plants, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Sustainable development,Agricultural commodities,Biodiversity,Capacity building,Desertification,Environmental standards,Equity,Farming,Fertilizers/nutrients,Financial agricultural measures,Food security,Governance,Land reform,Policy/planning,Poverty,Protection of environment,Public private partnership (PPP),Renewable energy,Rural employment,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Subsidy/incentive,Sustainable use,Tourism,Water shortage/drought,Pastoralism,Cereals/grains/rice,Ecological production/organic production,Education,Oils/oilseeds/fats,Fish products,Food sovereignty,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Meat,Milk/dairy products,Nutrition,Pesticides,Poultry products,Slaughtering,Sugar,Food quality control/food safety,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Crops/grasses,Pests/diseases,Planting material/seeds,Sugar cane/sugar beet,Plant production,Plant protection,Groundwater,Industrial water use,Irrigation,Surface water,Water supply
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Southern Asia

Policy: Law No. 9.616 promoting agroecology and organic production in State family farming.
Policy_Content: This Law aims at promoting and encouraging the development of agroecology and organic production within the State. To achieve the objectives of this Law, small farmers will be stimulated to practices aimed at: encourage the implementation of agroecological systems of production and certification of organic production, for expanding production with regular supply; supporting producer associations in organizing and certifying production, post-harvest processing, and direct marketing to the final consumer; develop research and encourage the production of legume seeds for green manure; stimulate the recovery of soil fertility with the use of green manure, compost and other organic fertilizers; stimulate the production of small animals for diversification, improved management and economic viability, with family farmers; stimulate reforestation, afforestation and forestry as an economic and diversification option in all ecological agricultural production activities, preferably with native products; develop a brand that characterizes the organic/agroecological products of family farmers; promote lectures on agroecology in municipal and state public schools and encourage the development of agroecological projects in schools.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Law No. ZRU-278 amending some legislative acts.
Policy_Content: Article 2 of Law No.754 – XII on nature protection shall be amended to add the following wording: “Protected areas shall include state reserves, landscape reserves, biosphere reserves, national parks, conservation areas and protected areas of international significance.”Article 64 of Law of the Republic of Uzbekistan on Water and Water Use shall be amended to add the following wording: «Sport and artisanal fishing shall be auithorized in waterbodies except for those located on the territory of protected areas, national parks and state biosphere reserves. » Article 11 of Law No. 543-I of 1997 on protection and usage of vegetation shall be amended to add the following wording: «Use of vegetation in protected areas, state biosphere reserves and national parks shall be authorized exclusively for scientific research purposes. Collection and harvesting of endangered and protected plant species shall be prohibited.» Article 15 of Law No. 770-1 on forest shall be amended to add the following wording:«Protection forest shall be classified as follows: (a) forest protecion belts; (b) erosion-protective belts; (c) town parks and recreational forest; (c) sanitary forest; (d) protected areas; (e) national parks; (f) biosphere reserves; (g) protected areas of international significance; and (h) forests of scientific or historical value.»
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Water
Keyword: Protected area,Biosphere reserves,Research,National parks,Protection forest,Recreational forest,Classification/declassification,Forest management/forest conservation,Inland waters,Water conservation zone

Policy: Loi n°1/01 du 04 janvier 2011 portant révision de la loi n°1/17 du 04 septembre 2009 portant missions, composition, organisation et fonctionnement de la commission nationale des terres et autres biens.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte missions, composition, organisation et fonctionnement de la Commission nationale des terres et autres biens. Le mandat de la Commision de réhabiliter les sinistrés se dédouble en deux tâches principales: connaître les litiges relatifs aux terres et aux autres biens des sinistrés et récupérer les terres domaniales irrégulièrement attribuées. Aux termes de l'article 4 de la loi celle-ci « a pour mandat de connaître les litiges relatifs aux terres et autres biens opposant les sinistrés à des tiers ou à des services publics ou privés ». Selon l'article 2 de la meme loi, il faut entendre par sinistré toute personne physique ou morale qui aurait été spoliée de ses biens du fait des événements tragiques qu'a connus le pays depuis l'indépendance. En outre, il en fait une énumération non exhaustive. C'est notamment le rapatrié, le déplacé, le regroupé, le dispersé, la veuve, l'orphelin, etc.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy_Content: These Regulations provide for the constitution of the Department of Physical Planning and provide with respect to the organization of the Department. The Department shall have Policy Planning Division and a Development Review Division. The Policy Planning Division shall be comprised of:  (a) a Land Use Plan Section; and (b) a Zoning Bye-law Section. The Development Review Division shall be comprised of: (a) a Site Plan Control Section; (b) a Subdivision Section; (e) an Architectural Control Section; and (d) an Enforcement Section.

Policy: Estrategia Nacional de Salud.
Policy_Content: La Estrategia Nacional de Salud busca mejorar la salud de la población, disminuir las desigualdades sociales en materia de acceso a la salud, aumentar la satisfacción de las personas y asegurar la calidad de las prestaciones de salud. Se establece que el enfoque de los problemas descritos en la Estrategia debe ser multi-sectorial, y ser capaz de convocar a agentes públicos y privados, organizaciones ciudadanas, universidades e institutos, Ministerios y hasta la propia Presidencia de la República, en una perspectiva de Estado y con un enfoque de doble componente. La estrategia define 9 objetivos estratégicos para el 2020, 50 metas sanitarias y 513 indicadores a través de los cuales se va a monitorear el cumplimiento de estas medidas.

Policy: Order No. 579 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on identification of emission sources to the atmospheric air and establishing the list of pollutants subject to state registration and rate setting.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes rules and proceedings for identification of emission sources to the atmospheric air subject to state registration and rate setting. This Regulation shall be used for: (a) state registration of the emission of pollutants to the atmospheric air; (b) validation of environmental standards for air quality; (c) validation of maximum allowable emissions to the atmospheric air; (d) validation of the proceedings for the issuance of authorization for emissions of pollutants to the atmospheric air; (e) restriction, suspension or stopping of emissions; (f) environmental impact assessment (EIA); and (g) prevention of emergency pollution. Pollutants specified in the list contained in the Annex 2 shall be subject to compulsory registration and rate setting.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

The purpose of the issuance of certificate shall be to register the amount of agricultural commodities produced and traded by households. Annex 1 contains the form of certificate.

Policy: Order No. 579 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on identification of hazardous emissions (pollutants), subject registration and rate setting, to the atmospheric air and validating the list of pollutants.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities and procedure for identification of hazardous emissions (pollutants), subject registration and rate setting, to the atmospheric air and it shall be used for guidance by federal executive bodies, authorized environmental institutions, legal persons, natural persona and individual entrepreneurs concerned. The Regulation shall be used for: (a) registration of the emissions of pollutants to the atmospheric air; (b) elaboration and validation of air quality standards; (c) protection of the atmospheric air; (d) validation n of emission standards and setting maximum allowable emissions; (e) state air monitoring; and (f) information of the population about air pollution levels. Sources of emissions of pollutants shall be identified in accordance with the inventory of emission and sources thereof, and also in accordance with project documentation related to economic activities. Annex 1 contains formulae for calculation of hazardousness indices. Annex 2 contains the list of pollutants.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Decree No. 70/2010 establishing the Touristic Interest Zone of Chiuanga within the Municipality of Metangula.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 4 articles and 1 geographical map, establishes the Touristic Interest Zone of Chiuanga, within the Municipality of Metangula, District of Lago, with an extension of 80 ha. It states that this area has relevant characteristics to attract integrated touristic development projects, natural, important historical and cultural resources able to originate National and international tourist interest, accelerating the economic development of the country, and establishes that the Programme for needed actions for its development, as well as environmental protecting measures, and rational sustainable of its resources are prescribed in the respective Territorial Development Planning of this area. A geographical map of this area is appended to the text.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Decree-Law No. 141/2010 establishing the renewable energy National goals in the framework of the National Energy Strategy 2020.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 4 Chapters and 3 Annexes, establishes the renewable energy National goals in the framework of the National Energy Strategy 2020, and partially transfers the EU Parliament and Council Directive No. 2009/28. It aims at performing the following activities: partially transferring to the National legislation the above mentioned EU Directive related to the promotion and use of energy originated from renewable sources, amending EU Directive No. 2001/77/CE, and No. 2003/30; establishing the renewable energy National goals for renewable energy use, including transports; defining methods of calculation for energy quota originated from renewable energy; and establishing the mechanism for issuing guarantee of origin for electricity originated from renewable energy.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1494 validating the Regulation on state register of mineral deposits.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that keeping state register of minerals shall be integral part of the evaluation of the state of public subsoil fund. State registration of mineral deposits shall be performed by the authorized state institution with a view of conducting geological study and research of subsoil. State registration of minerals and mineral deposits shall represent systematically updated databank with certification of identified mineral deposits. The following shall be subject to compulsory state registration: (a) solid mineral; (b) oil and natural gas; and (c) groundwater, mineral springs and medicinal muds.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Resolution No 428 of 2010 of Georgian Government on Technological Scheme and Sanitary-Quarantine Control in Border Zones and Customs Control Zones of Georgia
Policy_Content: The Resolution regulates sanitary control of Georgian borders. Specifically, it aims to prevent introduction and spread of fatal diseases in Georgia. It adopts the following rules: Technological scheme for sanitary-quarantine control of border and customs zones of Georgia (Annex 1); Rules for sanitary-quarantine measures (Annex 2); List of internationally open border points (sea ports, airports, land border points) (Annex 3); Certificate of waiving sanitary-quarantine measures on ships – Rules for conducting sanitary-quarantine measures on ships (Annex 4); Maritime-medical declaration (Annex 5); Stamp “Sanitary-quarantine measures have been conducted” (Annex 6); General sanitary rules of aircraft declaration (Annex 7); Certificate that vaccination and sanitary measures have been conducted (Annex 8); Inventory card on passengers arriving from diseased regions (Annex 9); and Inventory form of symptoms (Annex 10).
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Resolution No. 429 of 2010 of Georgian Government on Rules for Phyto-sanitary and Veterinary Border-Quarantine Control
Policy_Content: The Resolution provides detailed rules for customs control for plant and animal products. It consists of 3 main chapters: General provisions (Chapter I); Importing, transporting and destroying products subject to phyto-sanitary control (Chapter II); and Transitional and final provisions (Chapter III). Main provisions and annexes of the document provide for phyto-sanitary and veterinary certification, plants and animals import permit, list of plants and animals subject to customs control, taking samples from goods, transiting goods, mailed goods procedures, various forms that need to be filled out when importing plants and animals in Georgia, cooperation between various agencies in customs control measures, storage of goods, safety measures, protocol for destroying goods and liability for violating the customs rules.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy_Content: China’s "No. 1 Central Document" is the first policy document jointly released every year by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council, for the most important policy theme.   This 2011 China’s No. 1 Central Document focuses on water conservancy reform and development. The main goal is: the marked backwardness in water conservancy development will be fundamentally reversed in five to ten years.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 2/2010 regulating the National Metrology.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 28 articles divided into six Chapters and three Annexes, establishes the National Metrology System. It applies to public and private entities that make use of Legal Measuring Units, standards and metrological control activities, as well as to systems, methods and measurement instruments used in commercial transactions, provision of services and those used in the protection of health, safety and the environment. The metrology is regulated by: a) The entity that oversees the metrology area; b) Public and private entities that are qualified and accredited to perform metrology activities. The measuring instruments that satisfy the metrological control established in this Decree-Law are identified by a mark and/or verification certificate whose characteristics are defined in a specific regulation. Annexes specify a Glossary and specific Tables listing related standards.
Subject: Environment gen., General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree-Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Resolution No. 63/2010 approving the National Plan for the Advancement of Women 2010-2014.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the National Plan for the Advancement of Women 2010-2014 (PNAM). PNAM is structured according to the pillars of Economic Development, Human Capital, Governance and Institutional Mechanisms for the Advancement of Women. The Plan prioritizes the objectives of the 2007/2009 PNAM, the creation, revision and reinforcement of policies leading to the reduction of absolute poverty and the improvement of the food and nutritional security situation, especially in rural areas, the improvement of access to financial capital and production technology, the promotion and implementation of non-discriminatory policies and strategies in the labor sector, investment in women through the use of their creativity and entrepreneurial capacity. In addition, it aims to develop education, training and encouragement of employment opportunities, the improvement of human capital, especially with regard to access to health and education services, encourage greater participation of women in the political sphere and in power bodies and decision-making, and raising society's awareness of the elimination of cultural practices that impede the development and political, social and economic participation of women, with a view to placing greater emphasis on women as subjects of rights. The goal is to broaden the scope of activities that play a central role in meeting their practical and strategic needs, such as access to water and sanitation, electricity, roads, information and communication technologies, marketing systems and management of natural resources.
Subject: General
Keyword: Gender,Poverty,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Equity,Water quality standards,Public health,Rural employment
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Land and Conveyancing Law Reform Act 2009 (Section 100) Regulations 2010 (S.I. No. 653 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe the form of notice to be used for the purposes of section 100(1) of the Land and Conveyancing Law Reform Act 2009. Section 100 (1) provides that a mortgagee or any other person for the time being entitled to receive, and give a discharge for, the mortgage debt may sell or concur with any other person in selling the mortgaged property provided that a notice in the prescribed form has been served on the mortgagor warning of the possibility of such sale.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal concernant les aspects techniques du programme directeur de gestion des risques d’inondation.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement grand-ducal met en exécution la directive 2007/60/CE du Parlement Européen et du Conseil relative à l’évaluation et à la gestion des risques d’inondation. Aux fins du présent règlement, on entend par:  «inondation»: submersion temporaire par l’eau de terres qui ne sont pas submergées en temps normal. Cette notion recouvre les inondations dues aux crues de rivières en excluant les inondations dues aux réseaux d’égouts; «risque d’inondation»: la combinaison de la probabilité d’une inondation et des conséquences négatives potentielles pour la santé humaine, l’environnement, le patrimoine culturel et l’activité économique associées à une inondation. Le règlement établit les dispositions relatives aux cartes des zones inondables, cartes des risques d’inondation et cartes des risques d’inondation.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Act on support for the production of electricity from renewable energy (30.12.2010/1396).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to promote the production of electricity from renewable energy, enhance the competitiveness of these energy sources, diversification of electricity production and improve self-sufficiency in electricity. The tariff system applies to an electricity supply through wind turbines, biogas power plants, wood chips power plants or fuelwood power plants. Wind turbines, biogas power plants, wood chips power plants or fuelwood power plants can be approved for the tariff structure, if located in Finland or in Finnish territorial waters and is connected to an electricity grid there.  The electricity supplier shall apply to the Energy Market Authority for approval of supply systems and must be made prior to commercial operation. The target price for electricity from one of the tariff system approved wind turbines, biogas power plants and fuelwood power plants is of EUR 83.50/megawatt hour. Input price may be increased by a heat premium that is EUR 20/megawatt-hour of electricity from fuelwood power plants and EUR 50/megawatt-hour for electricity from biogas plants.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: 1 January 2011.

Policy: Regional Law No. 441-OZ “On some issues of granting of forest land plots to citizens free of charge for the length of service for limited utilization”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that forest land plots granted to citizens free of charge for the length of service for limited utilization shall be allotted to forest officers and staff of state hunting organizations (game managers and gamekeepers) for agro-forestry (haymaking, grazing, apiculture, growing of crops etc.). Land areas shall be established within the following limits: (a) arable land – 3 ha; (b) haymaking – 10 ha; and (c) other agricultural activities – 5 ha.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Land & soil
Keyword: Agro-forestry,Agricultural land,Apiculture/sericulture,Crops/grasses,Pastoralism,Public forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Grazing,Land tenure,Public land
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley de reforma parcial de la Ley de los Consejos Locales de Planificación Pública.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reforma parcialmente la Ley de los Consejos Locales de Planificación Pública, en relación al Consejo Local de Planificación Pública, la elección de consejeros, y a la responsabilidad de los alcaldes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America

Policy: Regional Law No. 533 “On fundamental principles of ecological policy”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law sets forth priorities of the regional ecological policy directed at environmental improvement, conservation and reproduction of natural resources, including natural ecosystems, and ensuring ecological security. Basic principles of the regional ecological policy shall be as follows: (a) sustainable development; (b) priority of ecosystem conservation; (c) prevention of negative environmental impact; (d) openness of ecological information; and (e) public participation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation on the tariff system for storage of natural gas, without the amounts of tariff items.
Policy_Content: This Regulation amends certain provisions of the Regulation on the tariff system for storage of natural gas, without the amounts of tariff items (Official Gazette 151/2008) related to the general definitions and technical terms.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regional Law No. 166-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of use of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that Regional Legislative Assembly shall have the following competence in the sphere of veterinary: (a) legislative regulation in the sphere of land-use planning related to agricultural land; and (b) law enforcement. The Governor shall appoint authorized regional state institution in the sphere of land-use planning related to agricultural land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Décret n°10-682-P-RM du 30 décembre 2010 déterminant les modalités d’expérimentation des Organismes Génétiquement Modifiés.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret détermine les modalités d’expérimentation des Organismes Génétiquement Modifiés (OGM) tant en milieu confiné qu’en milieu réel. L’expérimentation en milieu confiné est menée en station dans un laboratoire, dans une installation, structure physique ou tout autre endroit défini par les textes en la matière, qui limitent effectivement le contact de l’organisme génétiquement modifié avec le milieu extérieur et son impact sur ce milieu.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Décret n°10-683-P-RM du 30 décembre 2010 fixant les attributions, la composition et les modalités de fonctionnement du Comité national de Biosécurité.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les attributions, la composition et les modalités de fonctionnement du Comité National de Biosécurité.  Le Comité National de Biosécurité a pour mission de veiller au respect et aux conditions d’application de la réglementation en matière d’importation, d’exportation, de transit, d’utilisation confinée, de la libération ou de la mise sur le marché de tout Organisme Génétiquement Modifié (OGM) destiné à être libéré dans l’environnement ou utilisé comme denrée alimentaire, aliment pour bétail ou produit de transformation, ou de produit dérivé d’Organisme Génétiquement Modifié et les OGM à double fonction pharmaceutique et alimentaire d’intérêt agricole.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Environmental Management and Conservation (Amendment) Act (No. 28 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act amends various provisions of the Environmental Management and Conservation and changes its name to Environmental Protection and Conservation Act. The Act, among other things: inserts in the principal Act definitions of "biodiversity significance", “climate change”, “conservation area”, “EIA review committee”, “preliminary environmental assessment” and “significant environmental impact"; inserts a new section (5A) on the application of the precautionary principle, a section (12A) on foreshore development consents, a subsection on information gathered by bioprospecting 33(2)(fa), a section (34A) on bioprospecting information bonds and sections (42A to 42D) on measures of enforcement; substitutes section 14 on preliminary environmental assessment of applications and section 22 on review of EIA Report and decision on application; provides anew with respect to community management of conservation areas and consent of (customary) landowners; provides with respect to (international obligations in respect of) climate change; provides with respect to offences and penalties; and establishes the Environmental Trust Fund.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: EIA,Institution,Data collection/reporting,Climate change,Coastal zone management,Special fund,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties,Traditional rights/customary rights,Management/conservation,Protected area,Ecosystem preservation
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Ozone Layer Protection Act 2010 (No. 27 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act gives effect to the Vanuatu’s obligations under the Convention for the Protection of the Ozone Layer and the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer. It aims at phasing out ozone depleting substances as soon as possible except for essential uses and protecting human health and the environment from adverse effects resulting or likely to result from human activities which modify or are likely to modify the ozone layer. In order to achieve these objectives, the Act, among other things: places restrictions on the importation, exportation, manufacture and sale of substances that are declared controlled substances for purposes of this Act; and provides for the licensing and registration of Approved Importers and Approved Facilities (required in relation to purchase, sale, storage, processing, recovery, recycling or refilling of a controlled substance). The Act establishes the National Ozone Advisory Committee.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Ozone layer,Institution,International agreement-implementation,Pollution control,Hazardous substances,Transport/storage,International trade,Authorization/permit,Registration,Offences/penalties
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Utilities Regulatory Authority (Amendment) Act (No. 18 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Utilities Regulatory Authority Act 2007 by: repealing and substituting section 3 which now reads: "This Act applies to a regulated service to the extent that is not inconsistent with a provision in any concession agreement under the Electricity Supply Act [CAP 65] existing on or before the commencement of this Act or a provision of any other Act."; inserting subsection 13(1) concerning powers of the Authority; inserting a section 29A on the Investment Support Fund. It also makes some minor and consequential amendments.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Vanuatu Chamber of Agriculture Act 2010 (No. 19 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Vanuatu Chamber of Agriculture as a body corporate, provides for its management ad administration and defines its functions and powers. The Chamber of Agriculture shall, among other things: (a) represent farmers in dealings with persons or organizations in the public or private sector; (b) provide services, including delivery of goods to farmers and Producers Organizations; (c) promote agricultural activity and agro-industry in each Local Government Region; and (d) assist potential investors in agricultural activity and agro-industry. The Act also establishes the sectors of agricultural activities listed in the Schedule, including a Fisheries Sector. The function of a sector of agricultural activity is to group the farmers within the sector and develop the agricultural activity of the sector.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Native Land Trust (Leases and Licences)(Amendment) Regulations 2010 (L.N. No. 130 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Native Land Trust (Leases and Licences) Regulations in regulation 11 by repealing paragraph (1) and substituting that paragraph of these Regulations. They also repeal paragraph 3 of regulation 11. Paragraph (1) concerns the distribution of moneys received by the Native Lands Board by way of rents and premiums in respect of native land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Law No. 13.594 creating the State Policy on Climate Change (PGMC) and establishing its objectives, principles, guidelines and instruments.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the State Policy on Climate Change (PGMC), sets its objectives, principles, guidelines and instruments. The general objective of the PGMC is to establish the necessary conditions for adaptation to the impacts of climate change, as well as contributing to reduce greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. PGMC's specific objectives are: ensure the compatibility of economic and social development with the protection of the climate system; promote projects to reduce greenhouse gases emissions, including those of the CDM; protect the most vulnerable population; promote environmental education and social awareness on global climate change to build a sustainable development model; stimulate the research related to the protection of the climatic system, such as impacts, mitigation, vulnerability, new technologies, practices that reduce the emission of greenhouse gases; effectively apply indicators and targets for greenhouse gas emissions reduction in economy; preserve and expand existing carbon stocks in the State; promote a sustainable urban planning system of low environmental and energy impact; actions to increase the share of renewable energy sources in the state energy.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Climate change,Framework law,Environmental planning,Monitoring,Emissions,Renewable energy,Energy conservation/energy production,Poverty,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1772-N validating the Regulation on the procedure of issuance of certificate of the country of origin and performance of expertise.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree regulates the procedure of issuance of certificate of the country of origin (local and foreign). The issuance of certificate shall be accompanied by the procedure of performance of expertise. Certificate for commodities subject to export to CIS member-states shall be issued in the Russian language, while export certificates to other state shall be issued in the English language. The period of validity certificate of origin of commodities shall be 12 months from the date of issuance. Expertise to determine the origin of commodities in the Republic of Armenia shall not be applicable in the following cases: (a) for commodities fully produced in the Republic of Armenia; and (b) for the manufacturing of commodities destined for export that have received a certificate once, if used raw materials and (or) production processes remain unchanged. The aforesaid procedure shall be applicable to agricultural commodities produced in the Republic of Armenia, including fruits, citrus fruit crops, edible nuts and melons. Annexes contain the forms of applications and declarations of the country of origin of commodities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Certification,International trade,Fruits/edible nuts,Traceability/product tracing,Food quality control/food safety
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force the day after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Loi no 10-061 du 30 décembre 2010 portant modification de la loi no 85-40/AN-RM du 26 juillet 1985 relative à la protection et à la promotion du patrimoine culturel national
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte modification de la loi no 85-40/AN-RM du 26 juillet 1985 relative à la protection et à la promotion du patrimoine culturel national. Les articles 1er et 2 sont modifiés ainsi qu’il suit : Article 1er : La protection et la sauvegarde du patrimoine culturel sont assurées par l’Etat, les collectivités territoriales et les communautés. L’article 3 est complété par un troisième alinéa ainsi libellé : « Par biens immatériels, on entend l’ensemble des pratiques, traditions et expressions orales, représentations, connaissances, savoir-faire et espaces culturels que l’Etat, les collectivités territoriales, les communautés, groupes et individus reconnaissent comme faisant partie de leur patrimoine culturel ». Après l’article 3. Il est inséré un article un article 3-1 ainsi rédigé : Article 3-1 : Entrent notamment dans les catégories de biens meubles, immeubles et immatériels, entre autres : Biens immeubles : les sites ; les monuments ; les ensembles architecturaux ou éléments d’habitats traditionnels groupés ou isolés ; les routes et itinéraires culturels illustrant du mouvement, des échanges et du dialogue entre plusieurs régions du pays dans l’espace et le temps ; les monuments naturels, évidences, formations ou groupes de formations physiques et biologiques ayant une valeur esthétique ou scientifique ; les formations géologiques, les aires ou zones constituant l’habitat d’espèces animales et végétales d’importance nationale ; les villes mortes d’intérêt archéologique, historique et scientifique ; les cités historiques vivantes évoluant avec des médinas ou des tissus anciens d’intérêt historique, scientifique et culturel ; Biens immatériels : les biens concernant l’histoire, y compris l’histoire des sciences, des techniques et des technologies, l’histoire militaire et sociale ainsi que la vie des dirigeants, penseurs, sportifs, savants et artistes nationaux et les événements d’importance nationale ; et les traditions et expressions orales, les techniques et savoirs endogènes, les chants et danses, les rituels, les us et coutumes et les artefacts y afférents, les connaissances et pratiques concernant la nature et l’univers ».
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems, General
Keyword: Cultural heritage,Protection of species,Registration,Traditional knowledge/indigenous knowledge,Indigenous peoples,Fishery management and conservation,Urban land,Agricultural land
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Aerial forest protection and conservation shall include: (a) aerial forest fire patrol; (b) forest fire extinguishing; and (c) aerial forest pathology monitoring”. Policy: Federal Law No. 435-FZ amending Federal Law No. 101-FZ on turnover of agricultural land.

Article 6 shall be amended to acquire a new wording: “Plot of agricultural land can be expropriated if it is used with violation of rational land use requirements entailing agricultural land fertility reduction of deterioration of ecological situation”.

Policy: Décret exécutif nº 10-333 du 23 Moharram 1432 correspondant au 29 décembre 2010 portant création du bureau national d’études pour le développement rural.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte création du bureau national d’études pour le développement rural, quia pour mission, de réaliser toutes études, enquêtes et expertises, devant permettre la connaissance du milieu agricole et rural et la préparation des actions et des décisions dans le secteur de l’agriculture et du développement rural.

Policy: Décret n° 0919/PR/MRPICIRNDH du 29 décembre 2010 portant création, attributions et organisation de la Direction Générale de la Météorologie.
Policy_Content: Il est créé au sein du Ministère des Transports, un service central dénommé Direction Générale de la Météorologie en abrégé DGM. La Direction Générale de la Météorologie a pour mission d'élaborer, de proposer et de mettre en œuvre la politique du Gouvernement en matière de météorologie. A ce titre, elle est notamment chargée: - d'étudier les phénomènes atmosphériques et utiliser les connaissances acquises pour la protection des personnes et des biens, le développement économique et social, la protection et la préservation de l'environnement; - de maintenir un système de collecte et de traitement de données météorologiques, climatologiques et géophysiques; - d'assurer le contrôle, le respect des normes d'exploitation météorologiques sur les aérodromes et le bon fonctionnement des structures d'aérodromes qui concourent au renforcement de ses activités nationales; - d'assurer le contrôle, la certification des organes et du personnel d'assistance à la météorologie; - d'enquêter et formuler des propositions ou des recommandations, de prononcer des injonctions, de censurer et de sanctionner les organes d'assistance et de gestion de la météorologie; - de participer à la mise en œuvre de projets notamment dans les domaines de l'agriculture, de l'élevage, des travaux publics, de la santé, du tourisme, des transports et des loisirs; - de renforcer la coopération internationale dans les domaines de la météorologie et des sciences connexes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Policy: Décret n° 0920/PR/MERH du 29 décembre 2010 réglementant la suspension des fournitures d'eau et d'électricité en République Gabonaise..
Policy_Content: Le présent décret, pris en application des dispositions de l'article 51 de la Constitution, règlemente la suspension des fournitures d'eau et d'électricité en République Gabonaise. Pour des raisons d'ordre public, toute suspension des fournitures d'eau et d'électricité, pour cause de non paiement, est interdite les vendredi, samedi et dimanche, ainsi que les jours fériés.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Policy: Décret n° 2-10-54 pris pour l'application de la loi n° 06-10 portant création de l'Agence nationale pour le développement de zones oasiennes et de l'arganier.

L'Agence a pour mission de participer à la mise en oeuvre de la stratégie adoptée par le gouvernement en matière de développement des zones oasiennes. Policy: Décret n° 2010-1683 fixant les conditions de participation des chambres départementales d'agriculture à la politique d'installation en agriculture.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les conditions de participation des chambres départementales d'agriculture à la politique d'installation en agriculture. La mission d'information sur les questions d'installation en agriculture assurée par les chambres départementales d'agriculture comprend: dans le cadre de l'information collective, la participation à la politique de communication sur l'ensemble des dispositifs d'aides publiques à l'installation; dans le cadre de l'information individuelle, la participation à l'accueil et à l'orientation des candidats à l'installation. Les chambres exercent cette mission en liaison avec les autres personnes assurant une information sur les questions d'installation.

Policy: Enforcement Decree of the Cultural Heritage Protection Act (Presidential Decree No. 22560 of 2010).

Policy: Décret n° 2010-1664 du 29 décembre 2010 relatif aux certificats d'économies d'énergie.
Policy_Content: Le dispositif des certificats d'économies d'énergie repose sur une obligation de réalisation d'économies d'énergie imposée aux fournisseurs d'énergie dont les ventes annuelles sont supérieures à un seuil. Ces obligations sont assorties d'une pénalité financière pour les fournisseurs d'énergie ne les remplissant pas dans le délai imparti. Les fournisseurs d'énergie peuvent s'acquitter de leurs obligations par la détention de certificats d'économies d'énergie, obtenus sous certaines conditions à la suite d'actions d'économies d'énergie ou par l'achat à d'autres acteurs ayant mené ces actions. Le décret précise les modalités d'instruction et de délivrance des certificats d'économies d'énergie pour la seconde période triennale d'obligations d'économies d'énergie (1er janvier 2011 - 31 décembre 2013).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2010-1663 du 29 décembre 2010 relatif aux obligations d'économies d'énergie dans le cadre du dispositif des certificats d'économies d'énergie.
Policy_Content: Le dispositif des certificats d'économies d'énergie repose sur une obligation de réalisation d'économies d'énergie imposée aux fournisseurs d'énergie dont les ventes annuelles sont supérieures à un seuil. Le décret définit ce seuil pour chaque type d'énergie et organise les modalités de répartition entre ces fournisseurs d'énergie de l'objectif national d'économies d'énergie pour la seconde période triennale d'obligations d'économies d'énergie (1er janvier 2011 - 31 décembre 2013). Le décret fixe ainsi pour chaque type d'énergie un coefficient de proportionnalité qui permettra à chaque fournisseur d'énergie de déterminer son obligation annuelle à partir de ses ventes. Le décret fixe enfin le niveau de la pénalité financière pour les fournisseurs d'énergie ne remplissant pas leurs obligations dans le délai imparti.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regional Law No. 113-Z “On ensuring fertility of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of soil conservation, improvement and rational management of agricultural land in the process of economic activities. The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure soil improvement of agricultural land. Each plot of agricultural land shall be issued soil fertility certificate in accordance with soil, agrochemical, phytosanitary, ecological and toxicological analysis and it shall be transferred to owners, tenants and laeseholders of agricultural land. Ensuring soil fertility of agricultural land shall be carried out in strict observance of ecological requirements set forth by the legislation of the Russian Federation. The powers of regional government in the field of state regulation of ensuring the fertility of agricultural land include: (a) adoption of regulatory and legal acts in the field of ensuring conservation, reproduction and rational use of agricultural land, including approval of regional long-term specific programs on ensuring fertility of agricultural land; (b) state regulation of the fertility of agricultural land; (c) approval of rules for rational use of agricultural land; (d) application of the provisions for restoration and reproduction of the fertility of agricultural land; (e)  organization of monitoring of the fertility of agricultural land and accounting for the indicators of fertility of agricultural lands based on the results of their soil, agrochemical, phytosanitary and ecological toxicological inspections; (f) formation of the database on soil fertility status of agricultural land in the Bryansk region; (g)  development and approval of the standard form of the Fertility Certificate of a land plot and the procedure for its keeping; (h)  assistance in creation of reference sections of agricultural land; and (i) assistance in organizing research and design activities in the field of ensuring the fertility of agricultural land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decreto Nº 4819 - Crea el Fondo Adaptación.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea el Fondo Adaptación, cuyo objeto será la recuperación, construcción y reconstrucción de las zonas afectadas por el fenómeno de “La Niña”, con personería jurídica, autonomía presupuestal y financiera, adscrita al Ministerio de Hacienda y Crédito Público. El Fondo tendrá como finalidad la identificación, estructuración y gestión de proyectos, ejecución de procesos contractuales, disposición y transferencia de recursos para la recuperación, construcción y reconstrucción de la infraestructura de transporte, de telecomunicaciones, de ambiente, de agricultura, de servicios públicos, de vivienda, de educación, de salud, de acueductos y alcantarillados, humedales, zonas inundables estratégicas, rehabilitación económica de sectores agrícolas, ganaderos y pecuarios afectados por la ola invernal y demás acciones que se requieran con ocasión del fenómeno de “La Niña”, así como para impedir definitivamente la prolongación de sus efectos, tendientes a la mitigación y prevención de riesgos y a la protección en lo sucesivo, de la población de las amenazas económicas, sociales y ambientales.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Sustainable development,Disasters,Climate change,Flood,Risk assessment/management,Special fund,Environmental security
