Policy: Spatial Information and Land Survey Law.
Policy_Content: Article 1 establishes that the official survey and spatial information system is part of the national infrastructure for spatial development of the state Mecklenburg-Vorpommern safeguarding ownership of land. The spatial data are the basis for all local and site-specific measures in the country. The text consists of 40 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: Basis of the official spatial information and land survey system (1); Geo-data infrastructure (2); Official land survey (3); Transitional and final provisions (4);
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regulation on substances that deplete the ozone layer and alternative substances.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the necessary gradual reduction of the effective consumption of substances that deplete the ozone layer; the treatment of substances that deplete the ozone layer and alternative substances; treatment with products containing those substances; manufacture, import, export and marketing rules; treatment of these substances after cessation of use of products containing them; collection rules; use and permanent disposal, marking of products containing alternative substances; and conditions to be met by legal entities and entrepreneurs who are engaged in maintenance, repairs, as well as the phasing out of products containing substances that deplete the ozone layer, or alternative substances on the territory of Montenegro.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Ozone layer,Hazardous substances,Pollution control,Internal trade,International trade
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regulation on the list of types of hazardous substances, allowed quantities and criteria for categorization of hazardous substances.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes all necessary standards and requirements aimed to correctly define the list (classification included) of (environmentally) hazardous substances on the territory of Montenegro, also defining the allowed quantities and criteria for categorization of hazardous substances that are/or arising from the activities in plants, or that may arise during a large accident (disaster).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decree which provides details on the production and marketing of forest reproductive material.
Policy_Content: This Government Ordinance, which is composed of 23 articles and 25 Annexes, concerns production and marketing of forest reproductive material and lays down details on: (a) phenotypic classification of forests and phenotypic classification of seed sources; (b) recognition of sources of forest reproductive material; (c) recognized forests, tree selection, seed orchards, clones and clonal mixtures of varieties and their management; (d) protection of forest genetic resources; (e) genetic bases; (f) seed crops; (g) bank of forest seed; (h) labeling of recognized sources, genetic base and seed crops; (i) management of the National register of resources and issuing a list of resources of the National forest reproductive material; (j) testing resources; (k) collection and labeling of forest reproductive material; (l) seed areas and the transfer of forest reproductive material; (m) requirements for quality and classification of forest reproductive material; (n) growing of planting material; (o) records on the production and marketing of forest reproductive material; (p) registration of nurseries and operating equipment; (q) registration of forest reproductive material used in artificial forest regeneration and afforestation; (r) verification of professional competence in the work of forest reproductive material; (s) issuing a certificate of proficiency in the activities of forest reproductive material.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Law No. 3.992 amending Law No. 2.257 on Environmental Licence and Authorization.
Policy_Content: This Law amends Law No. 2.257 on Environmental Licence and Authorization within the State of Mato Grosso do Sul. Amendments deal with licence requirements, such as duration and conditions to be satisfied in order to perform any activity related to environmetal sector.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Ley de derechos de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas de Sonora.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto garantizar el reconocimiento, preservación, fortalecimiento y defensa de los derechos, cultura y organización de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas con enfoque de género, asentadas en el Estado de Sonora, así como el establecimiento de las obligaciones de los Poderes del Estado y las autoridades municipales, en lo relativo a sus relaciones con los pueblos y comunidades indígenas, para elevar el bienestar social de sus integrantes. El Título Segundo reconoce y define los derechos de los que son titulares las comunidades indígenas. Cabe mencionar el Capítulo VII, relativo al derecho de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas para acceder, de manera autónoma, al uso y disfrute preferente de los recursos naturales ubicados en las tierras que integran su territorio.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Loi 2010-1563 du 16 décembre 2010 de réforme des collectivités territoriales.
Policy_Content: La présente loi favorise la rénovation des dispositifs de fusion existant et propose la création de nouvelles structures territoriales : métropoles et pôles métropolitains. Par ailleurs, la loi « RCT » a instauré un nouveau dispositif de fusion de communes remplaçant celui introduit par la loi dite Marcellin du 16 juillet 1971. L’objectif de la réforme de 2010 était d’aboutir à un maillage intercommunal du territoire au 1er juin 2013, donc à une systématisation de l’intercommunalité en achevant la couverture intercommunale du territoire et en créant de nouvelles structures destinées à offrir aux grandes agglomérations un cadre institutionnel plus adapté. Par ailleurs, le législateur a souhaité réduire le nombre des groupements de communes et rationaliser le périmètre des EPCI à fiscalité propre. Une préférence est donc donné par le législateur à des regroupements intégrés fiscalement, plutôt qu’à des établissements à fiscalité additionnelle.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Regional Law No. 72 “On mountain areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the legal basis for the development of mountainous areas of the Republic of Dagestan, the preservation and rational use of their natural resources and cultural heritage. Mountain territory shall be considered terrain with rugged relief and relative elevations of 500 m or more within a radius of 25 km, as well as terrain with an absolute height of relief of 1,000 m and more. The basic principles of the state mountain policy shall be as follows: (a) gradual implementation of state mountain policy measures; (b) participation of unions (associations) of commodity producers and entrepreneurs in the formation and implementation of the state mountain policy; and (c) availability of information on the socio-economic status of the mountainous territories of the Republic of Dagestan, the activities of state bodies carried out in respect of the mountainous territories of Dagestan. The objectives of mountain policy shall be as follows: (a) sustainable development of mountain territories; (b) social support and ensuring employment of the population of mountain areas; (c) ensuring conditions for improving the level and quality of life of residents of mountainous settlements, increasing their incomes, as well as reducing differences in the level of socio-economic development of mountainous, lowland and foothill territories; (d) creation of conditions for reducing the outflow and stabilization of young people in mountainous settlements; (e) preservation and reproduction of natural resources of mountain territories; (f) creating a favorable investment climate and attracting investments for the development of mountain areas; (f) promotion of small and medium enterprises in mountain areas; (g) provision of conditions for the implementation of the activities of cultural, healthcare, educational, social protection, physical culture and sports institutions in mountainous settlements; (h) an increase in the volume of production in mountain areas; (i) prevention and liquidation of the consequences of hazardous natural processes and phenomena - landslides, avalanches, mudflows, landslides, flooding of territories, soil erosion, and other processes and phenomena that have a negative or destructive effect on mountain territories; and (j) conservation and restoration of cultural heritage sites.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Smart Meters and Smart Grid Regulation (B.C. Reg. 368/2010).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enacts the Clean Energy Act. The present Regulation lays down provisions relating to prescribed requirements for smart meters. The text consists of 4 sections as follows: Definitions (1); Prescribed requirements for smart meters (2); Installation of smart meters and related equipment (3); Smart grid (4).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Règlement sur le crédit agricole (RCAgr).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement définit les principes, l'organisation, la surveillance et la procédure en matière de financement des besoins d'investissements et de trésorerie de l'agriculture vaudoise. Il s'applique aux établissements de droit public institués par la loi sur l'agriculture vaudoise que sont le "Fonds d'investissements agricoles" et le "Fonds d'investissement rural". Le texte comprend 51 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Fonds d'investissements agricoles – FIA (II); Fonds d'investissement rural – FIR (III); Dispositions transitoires et finales (IV).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decreto por el que reforman los artículos 3o., fracción III; 10; 11, fracción III; 14 y 26 de la Ley para el Aprovechamiento de Energías Renovables y el Financiamiento de la Transición Energética; y 36 Bis de la Ley del Servicio Público de Energía Eléctrica.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica los artículos 3º., fracción III; 10; 11, fracción III; 14 y 26 todos de la Ley para el Aprovechamiento de Energías Renovables y el Financiamiento de la Transición Energética. Las enmiendas tienen por objeto la definición y metodología para valorar las externalidades, es decir los impactos positivos o negativos que genera la provisión de un bien o servicio y que afectan o que pudieran afectar a una tercera persona, en el ámbito de la provisión de energía eléctrica.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Règlement sur la promotion de l'économie agricole (RPEAgr).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution la loi du 7 septembre 2010 sur l’agriculture vaudoise. Notamment, l’article 1er établit que le présent règlement régit les modalités d’exécution des dispositions relatives à la promotion de l'économie agricole de la loi sur l’agriculture vaudoise. Le texte comprend 57 articles répartis en 8 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Promotion de l'image (II); Promotion des produits agricoles vaudois (III); Projets de développement (IV); Marchés agricoles (V); Promotion de l'agriculture de montagne (VI); Contributions professionnelles à caractère obligatoire (VII); Dispositions finales (VIII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent règlement entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 2011.

Policy: Règlement d'application de la loi sur l'agriculture vaudoise (RLVLAgr).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution la loi du 7 septembre 2010 sur l'agriculture vaudoise. Notamment, l’article 1er établit que le présent règlement régit les modalités d'exécution de la loi sur l'agriculture vaudoise. Les dispositions relatives à la promotion de l'économie agricole, au crédit agricole, à la protection des végétaux et à l'agroécologie relèvent de règlements spécifiques. Le texte comprend 54 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Formation, recherche et vulgarisation (II); Exploitation des terres en friche (art. 73 LVLAgr) (IIII); Mesures sociales (IV); Dispositions de procédure et de contrôle (V); Système d'information agricole (art. 100 LVLAgr) (VI); Dispositions finales (VII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Farming,Family farming,Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Research,Inspection,Disasters,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties

Policy: Règlement sur l'agroécologie (RAgrEco).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution la loi du 7 septembre 2010 sur l’agriculture vaudoise. Notamment, l’article 1er établit que le présent règlement régit les modalités d'exécution des dispositions relatives à l'agroécologie de la loi sur l'agriculture vaudoise. Les dispositions relatives à l'autonomie et au potentiel énergétique agricole relèvent du règlement sur le crédit agricole. Le texte comprend 50 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Promotion des mesures environnementales (II); Projets collectifs agro-environnementaux (III); Maintien de la fertilité des sols (IV); Agriculture biologique (V); Biodiversité et diversité des paysages (VI); Dispositions transitoires et finales (VII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 393 validating the Regulation on supply and use of electric energy.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates legal relations in the sphere of supply and use of electric energy between electric distribution network operator, electric energy supplier and the final consumer related to conclusion of electric energy supply contracts. Electric energy supply shall be carried out exclusively in accordance with electric energy supply contract concluded by the supplier and final consumer. Consumer of electric energy shall have the right to conclusion, prolongation, modification, suspension or termination of a contract. Electric energy supplier shall have the right to switch off electric energy supply by order of the State Energetic Inspection. This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of dispute settlement between supplier and consumer of electric energy. Annex 1 contains the form of model electric energy supply contract. Annex 2 contains the form of electric energy supply to industrial consumers. Annex 3 contains the form of authorization for electric power supply connection.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Regulation of the Minister of Finance No. 220/PMK.05/2010 concerning procedure for provision, disbursement, management and accountability of land acquisition revolving fund for highway.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, in order to smoothen the process of land acquisition to build highways, sets out procedures for the provision, disbursement, management and accountability of land acquisition revolving fund for highways.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 1587 amending the Order on waste water permits, Chapters 3-4 of the Environmental Protection Act.

Policy: Spatial Information Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to transpose into national legislation the Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 March 2007 establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE). Article 1 of the above-mentioned Act establishes that the present Act regulates the creation, maintenance and organization of a national spatial data infrastructure. In particular the Act aims to provide authorities, economy, science and the public with spatial information in a sustainable, up to date, quick and simple way. Furthermore, this data shall be of good quality and at reasonable costs. The text consists of 26 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Principles (II); Organization and implementation (III); Legal remedies (IV); Final provisions (V).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy: Order No. 1511 on subsidy for mapping and protection of forest reserves in internationally protected areas.
Policy_Content: Subsidy may be granted to the Danish Forest Association in order to provide advice to private forest owners on mapping and agreements for the protection of forest habitats and species in internationally protected areas. Grants are given to private owners in the community of forest and apply to the mapping of location and conservation status of habitat (1) and to agreements for the realization of Natura-2000 forest planning to ensure species found in Natura-2000 areas comply with targets. Framework of these subsidies is annually set by fiscal year beginning 2011-2013. The Danish Forest Association administers counseling activities in cooperation with the Danish Nature Agency.

Policy: Order No. 1-1/1980 of 2010 of Minister of Economy and Sustainable Development of Georgia on Privatization of Forests Located within Populated Areas
Policy_Content: The Order regulates privatization of forest located on the territory of former collective farming and Soviet farms through a public auction. It consists of six articles: General provisions (1); Organization a public auction (2); Terms for participating in the public auction (3); Commission organizing the public auction (4); Rules for conducting the public auction (5); and Rules for entering into transactions (6). According to the document, the terms of the privatization include using the forest land for its purpose; protection of species included in the Red List of Georgia; and not restricting other persons from using the forest for plant produce, non-timber resources and public water located on the forest area.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Private forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest species,Procedural matters,Public forest,Protection of species,Right of use,Access right,Collecting/harvesting,Non-timber products

Policy: Acte uniforme OHADA portant sur le droit commercial général (AUDCG)
Policy_Content: Le présent Acte uniforme portant sur le droit commercial général (AUDCG) définit et réglemente : 1) le statut du commerçant, personne accomplissant les actes de commerce par nature comme profession ; 2) le statut de l’entreprenant, entrepreneur individuel, qui, sur simple déclaration, exerce une activité civile professionnelle, artisanale ou agricole. Ce dernier est soumis à un régime juridique simplifié et adapté, pour favoriser le passage des acteurs de l’économie informelle vers l’économie formelle ; 3) le registre du commerce et du crédit mobilier (RCCM) qui reçoit notamment les immatriculations des personnes physiques et morales commerçantes, les déclarations d’activité des entreprenants et l’inscription des sûretés. Le RCCM est tenu par le greffe de la juridiction compétente en matière commerciale ou l’organe compétent désigné par l’Etat Partie ; il est intégré, au niveau de chaque Etat membre, dans un fichier national, qui lui-même alimente un fichier régional tenu par la Cour Commune de Justice et d’arbitrage de l’Organisation pour l’Harmonisation en Afrique du Droit des Affaires (CCJA). L’informatisation du RCCM vise à favoriser l’accès, en temps réel, à une information fiable et actualisée sur l’ensemble des acteurs économiques de l’espace l'Organisation pour l'Harmonisation en Afrique du Droit des Affaires (OHADA) et l’état des sûretés consenties ; 4) le bail à usage professionnel, statut qui étend à tous les professionnels exerçant leur activité dans un local pris à bail, la protection autrefois réservée aux commerçants locataires ; 5) le fonds de commerce, constitué de l’ensemble de moyens qui permettent au commerçant d’attirer et de conserver une clientèle ; 6) l’intermédiaire de commerce (commissionnaire, courtier ou agent de commerce), personne physique  ou morale  agissant professionnellement  pour le compte d’une autre personne afin de conclure avec un tiers un acte juridique à caractère commercial ; et 6) la vente commerciale, contrat de vente de marchandises entre commerçants, y compris les contrats de fournitures de marchandises destinées à des activités de fabrication ou de production. Tout commerçant, personne physique ou morale y compris toutes sociétés commerciales dans lesquelles un État ou toute autre personne de droit public est associé, ainsi que tout groupement d’intérêt économique, dont l’établissement ou le siège social est situé sur le territoire de l’un des Etats Parties au Traité relatif à l’harmonisation du Droit des Affaires en Afrique est soumis aux dispositions du présent Acte uniforme.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, General
Entry into force notes: Date d’entrée en vigueur : 15 mai 2011

Policy: Order No. 485 of the Federal Forest Agency validating the Regulation on management, protection, conservation and reproduction of protection forests, precious forests and forests of protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the particulars of management, protection, conservation and reproduction of forests located in water conservation zones, protection forests, precious forests and forests located in protected areas. The protection shall be intended against forest fires, pollution (including radioactive pollution) and other negative impact, but also against pests and diseases. Protection and conservation of forests located in water conservation zones shall be subject to sanitary and epidemiological protective arrangements. Forest reproduction shall be carried out through reforestation and care of forests. Agrotechnical care of forests shall exclude application of toxic chemicals. Reforestation of coastal areas of water conservation zones shall be carried out without compact ploughing up.
Subject: Forestry, Water
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Protection forest,Protected area,Forest fires,Afforestation/reforestation,Water conservation zone

Policy: Norm No. 005 on procedures for proving the regularity of transport, handling, use, consumption, stockpiling or storage of forestry exotic species products and by-products.
Policy_Content: This Norm establishes the procedures for proving the regularity of transport, handling, use, consumption, stockpiling or storage of forestry exotic species products and by-products. The registration of wood products in the Forestry Document (DOF) System will be done after being converted into Metres of Coal (MDC) by the holder after the IMA has released the environmental licence for this activity in the Forestry Document DOF System. Where there is no production of charcoal, they are exempt from the obligation to use the DOF for: Eradication of crops, orchards or pruning on urban public roads; Finished by-products, packaged and manufactured for final use, including charcoal packaged in the retail trade; Pulp, gum, resins and other wood pulp; Any residues processing and industrialization of wood and coconuts; Charcoal briquettes; Wood used and reused; Bamboo (Bambusa vulgaris) and related species; Shrubby vegetation of planted origin for any purpose; and Ornamental, medicinal and aromatic plants, palmácea fibers, essential oils, seedlings, roots, bulbs, vines, bark and leaves of native origin of species not listed in official lists of endangered species.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 166-UG validating the Regulation on zoological reserve “Zavolzhsky”.
Policy_Content: This Governor’s Decree establishes that specific zoological reserve “Zavolzhsky” shall be considered biological reserve destined for conservation and reproduction of valuable rare and endangered wild fauna species that are precious from economic, scientific and cultural points of view. The reserve is constituted for unlimited period of time. The reserve shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation, restoration and reproduction of wild fauna species and the maintenance of ecological balance; (b) conservation of habitat and migration routes of wild fauna species; (c) scientific research; (d) performance of environmental monitoring; and (e) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of zoological reserve: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting (except for cases envisaged by this Regulation); (b) collection of medicinal plants (except for collection by citizens for individual personal needs); (c) performance of hydro amelioration and irrigation works; (d) recreational activities outside specially assigned areas; (e) stay with firearms and airguns, traps and other hunting gear, including firearms ready for use on public roads, and also with wildlife products; (f) destruction or damage of posts, noticeboards, information signs and indicators, and also of equipped ecological paths and leisure area; and (g) keeping unleashed dogs.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Protection of habitats,Monitoring,Research,Education,Wild fauna,Endangered species,Management/conservation,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Governor’s Decree enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Stratégie Nationale pour le Développement de la Riziculture au Bénin.
Policy_Content: La Stratégie Nationale pour le Développement de la Riziculture au Bénin (SNDR) est un document d'une portée nationale dont l'objectif est qu’à partir de 2015, le Bénin produise en moyenne 385.000 tonnes de riz blanc par an au moins pour satisfaire les besoins de la population et dégager des surplus pour les échanges commerciaux. La Stratégie est inscrite dans le cadre de la vision du Plan Stratégique de Relance du Secteur Agricole, qui a pour but de faire du Bénin une puissance agricole dynamique, compétitive, attractive, respectueuse de l’environnement, créatrice de richesse répondant aux besoins de développement économique et social de la population. De façon spécifique, il s’agira de: (i) adopter des variétés de riz mieux adaptées aux conditions locales, (ii) faciliter l’accès aux intrants de bonne qualité, (iii) appuyer les producteurs pour l'aménagement des sites rizicoles, (iv) créer en aval de la production les conditions post-récoltes requises pour assurer une plus grande présence sur nos marchés du riz local de meilleure qualité marchande.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants, Water

Policy: National Water Quality Management and Pollution Control Strategy.
Policy_Content: This Strategy document complements and expands directives of the National Water Sector Development Strategy, 2008 through various plans and recommendations. It commences with an analysis of specific hazards to water quality in Tanzania and in particular to water intended for human consumption. Analysis is made of sources of pollution. The policy framework is based on integrated catchment management. Decisions must be made after careful consideration of community views and wider community interests. This Strategy is largely divide into two parts: Principles of a water quality management strategy (Part A) and a process for water quality management (Part B). Part A mainly concerns a system approach to water quality whereas part B actually sets out procedures and methods for water quality management including issues such as integration of basin, national and transboundary planning, water quality objectives and water quality criteria, pollution control on a basin level, and other matters regarding basin management.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: National 3R Strategy for Waste Management.
Policy_Content: This National 3R Strategy for Waste Management is a multi-sectoral policy document.  The goal for waste management is to achieve complete elimination of waste disposal on open dumps, rivers, flood plains by 2015 and promote recycling of waste through mandatory segregation of waste at source as well as create a market for recycled products and provide incentives for recycling of waste. The main objective of this 3R strategy is to delineate ways and means of achieving national 3R goals through providing a uniform guideline for all stakeholders. Specific objectives of this strategy are to: • address the key issues and challenges of waste management acting as a barrier for promotion of 3R in the country ; • define the roles of various actors to promote 3R in the country; and • guide the creation of enabling conditions for success regarding implementation of 3R in the country.  Priority sectors are identified by the government: municipal solid waste, industrial waste, biomedical waste, institutional and commercial waste and agricultural waste.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.

Policy: Timor-Leste National Adaptation Programme of Action to Climate Change.
Policy_Content: The Timor-Leste National Adaptation Programme of Action to Climate Change is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The objectives of this policy are: (I) the development and implementation of immediate and urgent project-based activities to adapt to climate change and climate variability, (II) awareness raising of communities, civil society and the government on climate change adaptation activities, and (III) institutional capacity building of the State Secretariat for Environment to assist the integration of adaptation concerns of all climate change vulnerable sectors into policies, strategies, programmes and activities.

Policy: Pesticide Management Policy for South Africa.
Policy_Content: Pesticide management policy for South Africa is a national policy with a multi-sector approach. The basic premise of this Policy is that sustainable development, built on a balanced economic growth, equitable access and long-term environmental sustainability, is fundamental to global competitiveness. This Policy provides guidelines to support the legislation and regulations on the use of pesticides. Its specific objectives are:	To improve legislative framework to ensure that South Africans are better protected from health and environmental risks posed by pesticides; To encourage the development and use of alternative products and techniques and reduce dependence on chemical plant protection products; To integrate relevant international agreements and initiatives from other government departments; Increased transparency, access to information and improve public participation in the registration of pesticides.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Irrigation Strategy.
Policy_Content: This Irrigation Strategy (EI) was approved by the Council of Ministers at its Session on 21 December 2010. EI Strategy comprises six Chapters. Chapter 1 presents the relevance of the existence of EI for agricultural production. It also deals with the foundations on which it is based, highlighting its importance in stabilizing and increasing agricultural production and productivity. The assumptions emphasize that irrigation infrastructure offers a good starting condition, and an adequate functioning of public services such as: research, extension and management of land and water, guaranteeing the achievement of IE's enshrined objectives, production growth and agrarian productivity. Chapter 2 describes the history of the irrigation sub-sector, from national independence to the present, showing the evolution of activities carried out in recent years in terms of physical intervention as indicated in the enclosed table. Chapter 3 addresses its scope of implementation in the context of the national development agenda, and considers water as a key input that must be combined with other factors such as improved seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and good agricultural practices. Chapter four deals with EI Implementation; Chapter five with Financing and Chapter six with Monitoring and Evaluation. Short (2012), medium (2015) and long (2020) term goals were defined.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy: Resolution No. 57 of the Chief Directorate of Protected Areas under the Ministry of Environmental Protection validating the Instruction on elaboration of the national protected areas management plan.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Instruction is to assist in the implementation of management plans in the protected areas system of Tajikistan. The Instruction is of advisory nature and is intended for use in the development of protected areas management plans. It is addressed to: (a) protected areas staff; (b) employees of the organization providing financial support to protected areas; and (c) staff of scientific research institutions. The protected area management plan is an official document that defines the management strategy, sets the management goals and objectives of a given protected area, and presents an action plan for their implementation for a specific period. The document substantiates the material costs of the necessary work, identifies the expected results of the activities and establishes a monitoring program to assess the effectiveness of protected area management. Management plan is developed in accordance with the following documents and materials: (a) legislative requirements for the category of a given protected area related to the regime of protection and use of natural resources; (b) individual provision on a protected natural area, approved in accordance with the established procedure; (c) forest inventory materials; (d) development schemes and other long-term planning project documents approved in accordance with the established procedure; and (e) program and instructional documents.

Policy: Order No.163 of 9 December 2010 of Chief State Sanitary Doctor validating SanPiN 2.1.7.2790-10 "Sanitary-epidemiological medical waste management requirements.
Policy_Content: These "Sanitary-epidemiological medical waste management requirements” establish mandatory sanitary-epidemiological requirements for handling (collection, temporary storage, disinfection, neutralization, transportation) of wastes generated in organizations during the performance of medical and/or pharmaceutical activities, performance of therapeutic, diagnostic and recovery procedures, as well as to the location, equipment and operation of the site for the management of medical wastes, sanitary and antiepidemic mode of operation when handling medical wastes. Depending on the degree of their epidemiological, toxicological and radiation hazard, as well as the negative impact on the environment, medical waste is classified into five hazard classes: Class A - epidemiologically safe waste, which is similar in composition to solid domestic waste; Class B - epidemiologically hazardous waste; Class C - extremely hazardous waste; Class G - toxicologically hazardous

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 311 validating the Regulation on drawing up and issuance of land certificates.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of drawing up and issuance of certificate attesting rights to the plots of land for natural and legal persons. In case of concession of a plot of land in ownership or use entitling documents shall be: (a) official act on the right of ownership of a plot of land; (b) official act on open-ended land tenure of a plot of land; (c) provisional land tenure certificate or lease contract; and (d) land ownership certificate. Land ownership certificate shall be issued to natural persons in the following cases: (a) to citizens who obtained land shares after enactment of Land Code; (b) to owners of land shares who of their own free will want to substitute previously issued land tenure certificate with land ownership certificate by their written application; (c) duplicates; (d) in case of land transactions to a new landowner; (d) transfer of rights as legal succession; (e) transfer of rights as inheritance.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Energy and Climate Change Fund Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act establishes as of 1 January 2011 a special fund called «Energy and Climate Change Fund». Article 1 establishes that the Fund promotes an environmentally sustainable, reliable and payable energy production. Following sectors shall be financed, inter alia: renewable energy, national climate protection, international climate and environment protection. The text consists of 10 articles and 1 Annex.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Special fund,Climate change,Energy conservation/energy production
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Nitrates Action Programme Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010 (S.R. No. 411 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations establish and introduce an action programme for the protection of waters against pollution caused by nitrates from agricultural sources that is applicable to all farmers across Northern Ireland. The Regulations, among other things: impose certain obligations on controllers or owners of an agricultural area in respect of prevention of pollution and good agricultural practice; establish closed periods for the land application of chemical fertilizer and organic manure; establish the manner of application and spreading of nitrogen fertilizer; place limits on the land application of nitrogen fertilizer; set out requirements for the storage of manure; and provide for the keeping of records and enforcement.
Subject: Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Water
Keyword: Farming,Soil pollution/quality,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Fertilizers/nutrients,Transport/storage,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Order No. 1411 on Danish Nature Agency delegation of tasks and powers.
Policy_Content: The Danish Nature Agency administers Acts related to the Environmental protection by determining, preparing and planning guidelines for individual cases and by identifying the appropriate institution to which it delegates management power.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Institution,Environmental audit,Protected area,Protection of habitats,Enforcement/compliance,Environmental planning
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Order enters into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Regional Law No. 106-KZ “On some issues of protection of the atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of protection of the atmospheric air establishing plenary powers of the Regional Government and the authorized regional executive body in the aforesaid sphere. Regional Government shall have the following competence: (a) lawmaking; (b) participation in the implementation of state policy; (c) adoption of state programs; (d) organization and performance of state monitoring of the atmospheric air; (e) introduction of restrictions on the movement of motor vehicles in protected areas with a view of reduction of emissions from mobile sources; and (f) application of additional air quality standards. Authorized regional executive body shall have the following competence: (a) dissemination of the information related to air quality and air pollution; (b) supervision and control of air quality; and (c) establishment of air quality standards.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Institution,Jurisdictional competence,Monitoring,Access-to-information,Environmental standards,Basic legislation,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret 2010-728/PRES/PM/MAHRIVMEF du 08 décembre 2010 portant approbation des statuts du Fonds de l’eau et de l'équipement rural (FEER).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret approuve les statuts du Fonds de l’Eau et de l’Equipement Rural (FEER) dont l’objet principal est de réaliser des projets ou programmes de développement, des études, des travaux, des actions ou des opérations dans le domaine de l’hydraulique, de l’équipement rural et de la mécanisation agricole.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Regional Law No. 109-ZO “On energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency. Regional executive bodies shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) implementation of state policy in the sphere of energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency; (b) law-making in energy sector; (c) validation of mandatory arrangements for energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency; and (d) law enforcement in energy sector.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: National Disaster Management Act, 2010 (Act No. XXIV of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 48 sections divided into eleven Chapters, provides for the establishment of a National Disaster Management System. After the commencement of this Act the Federal Government may establish the National Disaster Management Commission and the National Disaster Management Authority, entitled to perform the following activities: lay down policies on disaster management; approve the National Plan and plans prepared by the Ministries or Divisions of the federal Government; lay down guidelines to be followed by Federal Government and Provincial Authorities; arrange for, and oversee the provision of fund for the purpose of mitigation measures, preparedness and response; provide such support to other countries affected by major disasters; and take other measures for the prevention of disaster or the mitigation or for preparedness and capacity building for dealing with disaster situation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Basic legislation,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Institution,Protection of habitats,Research,Risk assessment/management,Public health
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 17 August 2007.

Policy: Crofting Reform (Scotland) Act 2010 (Commencement, Saving and Transitory Provisions) Order 2010 (S.S.I. No. 437 (C. 31)).
Policy_Content: This Order, among other things, makes a transitory provision so that any references to “the Commission” or “the Crofting Commission” in the provisions of the Act are to be read as references to the Crofters Commission until the Crofters Commission is renamed the Crofting Commission.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 1.855 - Procedimiento para la calificación del carácter de los proyectos como de investigación científica, tecnológica o de innovación.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece el procedimiento para la calificación del carácter científico y tecnológico, y/o proyectos de innovación, para aquellos proyectos que correspondan y cumplan los parámetros y requisitos definidos previamente por el Consejo Nacional de Beneficios Tributarios.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1781 validating the Regulation on expertise of the documentation substantiating nuclear and radiation safety in the process of activity involving the use of nuclear energy and sources of ionizing radiation.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the purpose of expertise shall be determination of the level of nuclear and radiation safety of the projected or functioning nuclear plants or nuclear sites emanating radiation by comparison of adopted project decisions and the results of their realization with the requirements of normative technical and legislative documentation in the sphere of ensuring nuclear and radiation safety. The main tasks of the expertise shall be: (a) assessment of the adopted decisions in relation to projecting, construction and technical organization; (b) assessment of completeness, sufficiency and substantiation of the aforesaid decisions; and (c) objective conclusions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decree enters into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Loi n°43/2010 du 07/12/2010 portant création de l’office rwandais pour le développement de l’énergie, de l’eau et de l’assainissement (EWSA) et déterminant ses attributions, son organisation et son fonctionnement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte création de l’Office Rwandais pour le Développement de l’Energie, de l’Eau et de l’Assainissement, « EWSA » en sigle anglais. La présente loi détermine également ses attributions, son organisation et son fonctionnement. La mission principale de EWSA est celle de mettre en œuvre la politique du pays en matière de développement de l’énergie, de l’eau et de l’assainissement à travers la coordination, la conception, le développement, le suivi et l’évaluation des actions et programmes prévus dans le cadre de sa mission.
Subject: Energy, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Regulation conferring a statute to  the National Fund for Environmental Protection and Water Management.
Policy_Content: This Act confers a statute to the National Fund for Environmental Protection and Water Management. The mission of the National Fund is to financially support undertakings intended for environmental protection and respecting its value, on the basis of the principle of sustainable development included in the constitution. The National Fund participates in implementation of the environmental policy of Poland as a source of financing and cooperate, along with the Ministry of the Environment, with commissions of environmental protection at the parliament. The National Fund and voivodeship funds provide financial support for projects which contribute to enforcement of Polish obligations resulting from EU directives. The National Fund also supports activities undertaken by the Minister of the Environment in the scope of meeting Polish obligations resulting from the Climate Convention and Biodiversity Convention.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Ozone Depleting Substances and Other Halocarbons (O. Reg. 463/10).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enforces the Environmental Protection Act (R.S.O. 1990, c. E.19). In particular, the Regulation governs the discharge, making, use, sale, transfer, display, transport, store and disposal of ozone-depleting substances and other halocarbons in Ontario. The Regulation consists of 43 sections divided into 7 Parts as follows: Interpretation (II); Class 1 ozone depleting substances (II); Solvents and sterilants (III); Fire extinguishing equipment and halons (IV); Refrigerants (V); Disposal, transport and transfer of ozone depleting substances or halocarbons (VI); Revocations and commencement (VII).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Climate change,Hazardous substances,Transport/storage,Enforcement/compliance,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic
Entry into force notes: The present Regulation enters into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 1614/2010 - Regulan aspectos relativos a la actividad de producción de energía eléctrica a partir de tecnologías solar termoeléctrica y eólica.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto la regulación de determinados aspectos de carácter económico para las instalaciones de tecnologías eólica y solar termoeléctrica.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 313/10/EM/DGH - Modifica el Reglamento operativo del Fondo para la Estabilización de Precios de los Combustibles Derivados del Petróleo.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica el Reglamento operativo del Fondo para la Estabilización de Precios de los Combustibles Derivados del Petróleo, en relación a los factores de compensación para la exportación.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Institution,Energy conservation/energy production,Oil,Special fund,Internal trade,International trade,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 236 - Instructivo especial para el paso a la fase de explotación minera.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo aprueba el Instructivo transitorio especial para el paso a la fase de explotación minera, que se aplicará a las concesiones mineras que soliciten el paso a la fase de explotación minera.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific
Entry into force notes: El presente Acuerdo tendrá un plazo de vigencia de ciento ochenta días contados a partir de su expedición.

Policy: Règlement ministériel fixant les facteurs d’économie moyens et les facteurs climatiques prévus à l’annexe du règlement grand-ducal du 31 août 2010 concernant la performance énergétique des bâtiments fonctionnels.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution la loi modifiée du 5 août 1993 concernant l’utilisation rationnelle de l’énergie et le règlement grand-ducal du 31 août 2010 concernant la performance énergétique des bâtiments fonctionnels. Notamment, l’article 1er fixe les facteurs d’économie moyens prévus au point 3.2 de l’annexe du règlement grand-ducal du 31 août 2010 concernant la performance énergétique des bâtiments fonctionnels. Le texte comprend 4 articles.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent règlement ministériel entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 2011.

Policy: Règlement sur la protection de l'environnement des entreprises (RPEE).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution la loi fédérale sur la protection de l'environnement, du 7 octobre 1983 et l'ordonnance fédérale sur l'utilisation des organismes en milieu confiné, du 25 août 1999. Notamment, le présent règlement a pour buts: a) de désigner l'autorité d'exécution en matière de protection de l'environnement des entreprises, en particulier pour les aménagements, le contrôle et le suivi des installations nouvelles et existantes; b) de définir les prestations fournies par le canton sur la base des législations fédérale et cantonale en la matière. Le texte comprend 17 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Prestations (II); Emoluments (III); Dispositions finales et transitoires (IV). Une annexe est jointe.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent règlement entre en vigueur le 16 décembre 2010.

Policy: Regulation on good agriculture practices.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth the rules and procedures of good agriculture practices. It covers provisions on control and certification, and authorities and responsibilities of producers, producer organizations, entrepreneurs, controllers and  issuers of certifications. The Regulation aims at ensuring safe agricultural product supply, traceability and sustainable agriculture.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Ley Nº 7658 – Crea el Programa de Regularización Dominial y Asistencia para Pequeños Productores Agropecuarios y Familias Rurales.
Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Ley se aprueba en la Provincia de Salta el Programa de Regularización Dominial y Asistencia para Pequeños Productores Agropecuarios y Familias Rurales. El programa persigue los siguientes objetivos: a) reconocer y proteger la identidad cultural de los pequeños productores agropecuarios y familias que habitan en zonas rurales de la provincia de Salta; b) insertar mecanismos para promover una igualdad real de oportunidades; c) reconocer el vínculo que las personas mencionadas tienen con la tierra y regular las consecuencias jurídicas que de él derivan; d) proteger y garantizar el respeto de sus derechos humanos conforme al medio en el que viven los pequeños productores agropecuarios y las familias rurales; e) brindar seguridad jurídica sobre los derechos de posesión y, en su caso, propiedad que tuvieren sobre las tierras en las que habitan; f) evitar desalojos de pequeños productores y familias rurales de las tierras en las que habitan a base de documentos firmados con ardid o engaño.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Smallholders/peasants,Family farming,Agricultural land,Land reform,Land tenure,Human rights
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Law No. 254 creating the Municipal Policy for Combating Global Warming and Climate Change in the Municipality of Manaus.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 15 articles divided into seven Chapters, creates Municipal Policy for Fighting Global Warming and Climate Change to be carried out in the Municipality of Manaus. This Municipal Policy aims to contribute to the restoration of the climate balance and the healthy quality of life of present and future generations of citizens of Manaus. The Municipal Policy will be implemented through incentives to sustainable practices, as well as through the compulsory use of equipment aimed at the rational use of energy and water in buildings in the municipality of Manaus. The Municipal Policy establishes that single-family residential building projects with a built area of ​​200 m² or more, that are elaborated after the entry into force of this Law must adopt architectural techniques that reduce the need for artificial lighting and artificial air cooling. Projects of residential buildings or multi-family housing units with a built area of ​​more than 500 m², that are elaborated after the entry into force of this Law should adopt architectural techniques that reduce the need for artificial lighting and artificial air cooling. All buildings where commercial or industrial activities are carried out and that use air cooling for internal air conditioning are subject to the obligation to adopt efficient energy equipment.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Climate change,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Emissions,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Zoning,Polluter pays principle,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Resolution No. 56 of 2010 of Government of Adjara on Management of Forestry Industry
Policy_Content: This Resolution regulates the management of forestry in Adjara. It consists of five chapters: General provisions (I); Rules for issuance of tickets for timber production (II); Rules for issuance of a document for extracting an object of wildlife (except for migratory birds) (III); Rules for issuance of tickets for forest use (IV); and Granting ownership of timber and right to use of forest through electronic auction (V). The Resolution also adopts the fees for the services provided by the Forestry Agency of Adjara (Annex No. 1); and the initial bidding price for timber (Annex No. 2). Among others, the Resolution provides for social cutting for the production of fuelwood.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Forest species,Forestry protection measures,Timber extraction/logging,Authorization/permit,Procedural matters,Royalties/fees,Institution,Fuelwood,Hunting authorization/permit,Hunting/capture,Hunting rights,Wild fauna
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Resolution No. 55 of 2010 of Government of Adjara on Creation of Forestry Agency of Adjara
Policy_Content: This Resolution creates the Forestry Agency of Adjara and adopts its charter. The charter consists of six articles: General provisions (1); Goals and objectives of the Agency (2); Authority of the Agency (3); Property of the Agency (4); Financing of the Agency (5); Activities of the Agency that require authorization (6); State control (7); Accounting (8); Organization of the management of the Agency, and the rights and duties of the management (9); Structure of the Agency staff (10); Competences and management of the structural units of the Agency (11); Territorial administrations of the Agency (12); Amendments and additions to the charter (13); and Reorganization and liquidation of the Agency (14). The Resolution also adopts a typical charter for territorial administrations of the Agency. The objectives of the Agency include defining-specifying the boundaries of the forest fund, forest management, regulation of forest use, undertaking forest protection and restoration measures, and controlling the territory of forest fund.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Institution,Governance,Procedural matters,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Forestry protection measures,Survey/mapping
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Resolution No. 56 of 2010 of Adjara Government on Forest Management
Policy_Content: This Resolution regulates forest management in Adjara. It consists of five chapters: General provisions (I); Rules for issuing ticket for timber production (II); Issuing permit for capture of wildlife (except for migrating birds) subject to hunting (III); Rules for issuing ticket for forest products (IV); and Granting ownership of timber resources and right to use of forest fund through auction (V). The Resolution also adopts Annex 1 Fees established for the services associated with forest management in Adjara; and Annex 2 Initial bidding price at auction granting ownership of timber resources.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Timber,Authorization/permit,Procedural matters,Business/industry/corporations,Hunting authorization/permit,Hunting/capture,Wild fauna,Wild flora

Policy: Resolution No. 53 of 2010 of Government of Adjara on Charter of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources Division
Policy_Content: This Resolution adopts the charter of the Environmental Protection and Natural Resources Division of Adjara. It consists of eight articles: General provisions (1); Scope of work and objectives of the Division (2); Authority of the Division (3); Organization of the management of the Division, and the rights and duties of the management (4); System within the Division (5); Competences of structural units of the Division (6); Amendments to the charter (7); and Reorganization and liquidation of the Division (8). The objectives of the Division include maintaining a safe environment for public health, and protection of environment from harmful impact; protection of ambient air; prevention of pollution of water, protection of water, and rational use of water resources based on sustainable development principles; participation in assessing hazardous substances and informing the public about the danger of hazardous substances; and protection of authentic natural and cultural environment and its specific components, including plant life, wildlife, biodiversity, landscape, cultural and natural monuments in the forest, and endangered plant species; and studying and assessing dangerous geological processes (disasters), and developing the system of forecast and informational database.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Institution,Governance,Procedural matters,Public health,Environmental planning,Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Water quality standards,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Hazardous substances,Tourism,Cultural heritage,Protection of habitats,Biodiversity,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest species,Forestry protection measures,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Water abstraction,Freshwater resources management,Endangered species,Protection of environment,Protection of species,Wild fauna,Wild flora

Policy: Decree-Law No. 56/2010 regulating the National Oil System (SPN).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 7 Chapters, establishes the functioning and organization of the National Oil System (SPN). It specifies authorized activities and requirements to be fulfilled in order to perform the below mentioned activities related to crude oil and its byproducts, such as: import & export, storage, processing, transport, distribution, refining and trade. The Decree-Law defines licensing procedures, oil infrastructure and logistics, oil products. Particular attention is devoted to the prevention from perturbations in oil supply. Moreover, the Decree-law provides sanctions for non-compliance and defines control procedures.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Decree-Law enters into force 30 days after its publication.

Policy: Decree No. 14/2010 regulating standards for the National Cartography Plan.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 7 articles, regulates the standards to be used for mapping by the National Cartography Plan. It specifies scale, purpose and other matters related to map production of the islands belonging to the archipelago of Cape Verde.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: Decree-Law No. 55/2010 regulating National Cartography Production.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 4 Chapters, regulates National Cartography Production (except for military and hydrographic purposes). Control on this activity will be performed by competent authorities.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Decree-Law enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Dangerous Goods (Road and Rail Transport) Regulations 2010.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of 259 sections divided into 23 Parts and consolidated by two Schedules, regulates by nationally consistent legislation the transport of dangerous goods by road and rail in order to promote public safety and protect property and the environment. These Regulations are divided into the following parts: General, Interpretation, Training and Offence Provisions (1); Key Concepts (2); Transport of Dangerous Goods to Which Special Provisions (3); Packaging Division 1 - General (4); Consignment Procedures Division 1 - Reserved (5); Safety Standards – Vehicles and Equipment (6); Transport Operations Relating to Certain Dangerous Goods (7); Stowage and Restraint (8); Segregation (9); Bulk Transfer of Dangerous Goods Division 1 - General (10); Documentation Division 1 - Transport documentation (11); Safety Equipment (12); Procedures During Transport Division 1 - Immobilised and stopped vehicles (13); Emergencies Division 1 - Emergencies generally (14); Mutual Recognition Division 1 - Registers of determinations, exemptions, approvals and licences (15); Exemptions Division 1 - General (16); Administrative Determinations and Approvals Division 1 - General (17); Licences Division 1 - Preliminary (18); Reconsideration and Review of Decisions (19); Insurance (20); Local Regulations (21); Miscellaneous (22); Transitional (23).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These regulations enter into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 0727 – Territorios Indígenas Originario Campesinos – TIOC’s.
Policy_Content: A partir de la publicación del presente Decreto Supremo, en cumplimiento a la Disposición Transitoria Séptima de la Constitución Política del Estado, las Tierras Comunitarias de Origen (TCO’s) pasan a denominarse Territorios Indígenas Originario Campesinos (TIOC’s). Se establece que los TIOC’s tienen como únicos titulares del derecho propietario colectivo a los pueblos que los demandaron.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Décret n°100-62 du 6 décembre 2010 portant création, composition, missions, organisation et fonctionnement de la commission nationale chargée de la démarcation et de la matérialisation des frontières communes avec la République du Rwanda, la république démocratique du Congo et la République unie de Tanzanie.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les règles de création, composition, missions, organisation et fonctionnement de la commission nationale chargée de la démarcation et de la matérialisation des frontières communes avec la République du Rwanda, la république démocratique du Congo et la République unie de Tanzanie.

Policy: Land Tax Regulations 2010.
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision in respect of amendments of assessments under the Land and Income Taxation Act 1910; and prescribe certain fees for matters under the Land Tax Act 2000.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Regulations enter into force on 27 December 2010.

Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation on the implementation of support measures for preservation of animal breeds.
Policy_Content: This Regulation cancels the provisions prescribed by the paragraph 4 of the article 3 of the Regulation on the implementation of support measures for preservation of animal breeds (Official Gazette 34/2010 and 84/2010).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1443-ZRK “On forest management for hunting”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law envisages timber extraction on forest parcels allotted for hunting management for the purpose of construction of hunting lodges. Legal persons and individual entrepreneurs that were allotted forest parcels for hunting management shall have the right to: (a) access to information related to allotted forest parcel; (b) sow forage and protection plants; and (c) harvest forage vegetation. Legal persons and individual entrepreneurs that were allotted forest parcels for hunting management must: (a) install information boards warning of the purposeful use of forest parcels along their boundaries; (b) observe forest fire rules and regulations; (c) upon expiry of lease contracts restore the required state of forest parcels; and (d) compensate damages caused to the forests.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Promotion of Energy from Renewable Sources Regulations (L.N. 538 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations set out the regulatory framework for the promotion of energy from renewable sources, which include wind, solar, aerothermal, geothermal, hydrothermal and ocean energy, hydropower, biomass, landfill gas, sewage treatment plant gas and biogases. They stipulate that the share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy in 2020 shall be at least the national overall target for the share of energy from renewable sources of 10 percent. To this end further the Regulations establish the method for calculating the share of energy from renewable sources. Further provisions concern the adoption of the National Renewable Energy Action Plan.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Regulation on licensed olive oil warehouses.
Policy_Content: The Regulation sets forth the principles and procedures of the establishment, operation and supervision of a licensed cotton warehouses, aiming at: facilitating trade of olive oil and ensuring safety and maintaining the quality of  this agricultural product. The Regulation also covers procedural provisions on the licences and on insurances. The Regulation is consisted of ten chapters: Purpose, Scope, Basis and Definitions (I); Required Minimum Qualifications for Licensed Warehouses, Storage System Numbers, Data Processing Equipment (II); Terms of Establishment of a Licensed Warehouse (III); Application for Licenses, Terms of License, Guarantee and insurance (IV); Issuing, Rejection, Extension and Cost of Warehousing License (V); Analysis and Classification Certificate and Product Certificate (VI); Rights and Obligations of the Licensed Warehouse Operator, Olive Oil Storage and Delivery, Prohibited Activities and Licensed Warehouse Fee Schedule (VII); Licensed Warehouse Enterprise Records, Financial Statements and Reports (VIII); Duties and Powers of the Ministry, Control, Suspension and cancellation of License (IX); Final Provisions (X).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on the day it is published in the Official Journal.

Policy: Regulation on licensed olive warehouses.

Policy: National Integrated Coastal Management Framework and Implementation Strategy for Vanuatu.
Policy_Content: The National Integrated Coastal Management Framework (NICMF) and Implementation Strategy for Vanuatu is a cross-sectoral strategy enacted in 2010 that seeks to give substance to the national vision for sustainable coastal environmental management by prescribing institutional arrangements needed for management of the coastal ecosystem, and identifies relevant stakeholders to support the process for implementing management and development activities. The NICMF provides a situational analysis of the coastal zones as well as a consolidated overview of roles and responsibilities, issues and the range of tools (strategies, plans, legislation, etc) available to address. It is designed to allow for stakeholders, managers, and those involved in management of Vanuatu’s coastal resources, to identify the most appropriate response to best manage coastal resources for long term sustainable use.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Sustainable development,Tourism,Ecosystem preservation,Risk assessment/management,Disasters,Climate change,Coastal zone management,Fishery management and conservation,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Decree No. 113/2010/ND-CP providing for the determination of environmental damage.

This Decree does not apply to environmental damage caused by natural disasters or emergency circumstances.

Policy: Ley de Mitigación y Adaptación al Cambio Climático y Desarrollo Sustentable para el Distrito Federal.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco normativo para el Distrito Federal en materia de mitigación de gases de efecto invernadero, adaptación al cambio climático y desarrollo sustentable. En pirmer lugar la Ley introduce normas para la coordinación en esta materia de la Secretaría del Medio Ambiente del Distrito Federal, la Procuraduría Ambiental y del Ordenamiento Territorial del Distrito Federal y la Comisión Interinstitucional de Cambio Climático del Distrito Federal. En segundo lugar se fijan los principios que deben respetarse para la adopción de las políticas públicas para enfrentar el cambio climático (arts. 19-24). Asimismo la Ley estipula que el Jefe de Gobierno podrá establecer un sistema local de bonos de emisiones de carbono (arts. 25-27). Se indica la información que debe contener el Registro de Emisiones de la Ciudad de México, que constituye el instrumento de inscripción de los reportes de emisiones (arts. 28-34).  Las restantes disposiciones tienen por objeto el funcionamiento del Fondo Ambiental para el Cambio Climático (arts. 40-42), las medidas de control y sanciones (arts. 47-52).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Climate change,Ozone layer,Clean development mechanism,Special fund,Offences/penalties,Basic legislation

Policy: Decision establishing the Budget fund for emergency situations.
Policy_Content: This Decision, as is accordance with the provisions of the Serbian Law on emergency situations, establishes the national Budget fund for emergency situations. This Fund is established to provide additional funds aimed for financing the preparation, implementation and development of programmes, projects and other activities in the field of risk reduction, management and response to emergencies. The Fund is established for an indefinite period of time, and it shall be managed by the Minister of the Interior. Beneficiaries of the Fund are: 1) state bodies and organizations, bodies of autonomous province and bodies of local self-government units; 2) companies, other legal entities and entrepreneurs; 3) citizens, groups of citizens, associations, professional and other organizations.
Subject: General
