Policy: Law No. 2755-VI Tax Code of Ukraine.
Policy_Content: Tax Code of Ukraine regulates relations arising in the field collection of taxes and fees, in particular determines an exhaustive list of taxes and fees held in Ukraine, and the procedure for their administration, payers of taxes and levies, their rights and responsibilities, the competence of regulatory authorities, powers and responsibilities of their officials during the administration of taxes and levies, as well as liability for violations of tax legislation. Tax (levy, fee) is a mandatory payment to the appropriate budget, which copes with the payers of taxes, subject to receipt by them of special benefits, including as a result of committing in favor of such persons of state bodies, local government, other authorized bodies and persons of legally significant actions. The set of national and local taxes and levies that are applicable in the manner prescribed by this Code, is tax system of Ukraine. In Ukraine, national and local taxes and fees are set. National taxes include environmental tax and environmental fees (charges). Local taxes include property tax. For taxation purposes, land owners shall be considered legal entities and individuals (residents and non-residents) who have acquired land ownership in accordance with the law of Ukraine, as well as territorial communities and the state in relation to municipal land and state property, respectively. Data of the state land cadastre - a set of information and documents on the location and legal status of land plots, their assessment, classification of land, quantitative and qualitative characteristics, distribution among landowners and land users. prepared in accordance with the law. Land tax - a mandatory payment applicable to owners of land plots and land shares (units), as well as to permanent land users. Environmental tax - a national mandatory payment that copes with the actual volumes of emissions into the atmosphere, discharges into waterbodies of pollutants, waste disposal, actual volume of radioactive waste temporarily stored by their producers, the actual volume of generated radioactive waste and the actual volume of radioactive waste accumulated by April 1, 2009. Taxpayers of ecological tax are business entities, legal entities that do not conduct economic (business) activities, budgetary institutions, public and other enterprises, institutions and organizations, permanent representations of non-residents, including those performing agency (representative) functions in relation to such non-residents or their founders, in the process of conducting activities on the territory of Ukraine and within its continental shelf and Exclusive (marine) Economic Zone listed as follows: (a) emissions of pollutants into the atmosphere by stationary air pollution sources; (b) discharges of pollutants directly into waterbodies; (c) waste disposal (except for disposal of certain types (classes) of waste as a secondary raw material placed on their own territories (objects) of business entities; (d) generation of radioactive waste (including already accumulated); and (e) temporary storage of radioactive waste by their producers over the term established by special conditions of the license. Entities are not taxpayers for carbon dioxide emissions if such emissions in the amount not more than 500 tons per year. If the annual amount of carbon dioxide emissions exceeds 500 tons per year, entities are required to register as taxpayers in the tax (reporting) period in which such excess occurred. Such payers are obliged to prepare and submit tax reports, accrue and pay tax for the tax (reporting) period in which such excess occurred,  in the manner prescribed by this Code. Payers of water charges for special water use are: (a) primary water users - business entities, regardless of form of property: legal entities, their branches, offices, representative offices, other separate subdivisions without formation of a legal entity, permanent representations of non-residents, as well as individual entrepreneurs who use and/or transfer to secondary water users the water obtained from waterbodies; and (b) business entities regardless of the form of ownership: legal entities, their branches, offices, representative offices, other separate subdivisions without constitution of legal entity, permanent establishments of non-residents, as well as individual entrepreneurs who use water for the needs of hydropower, water transport and fish farming. Taxation of special forest management shall be applicable to: (a) main use felling; (b) sanitary felling; (c) collecting and harvesting on non-timber forest products; (d) agro-forestry; and (e) recreational use of forests. Property tax includes land tax. Objects of taxation are: (a) land plots that are owned or used; and (b) land shares that are owned.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Sea, Water, General

Policy: Waste Information (Scotland) Regulations 2010 (S.S.I. No. 435 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations concern a request as made by the Scottish Environment Protection Agency to any person having control or management of an undertaking for information on, among other things, the nature of any activities of the undertaking in relation to which the request is made, which involve the production or management of waste descriptions of the types of waste produced by or managed in the course of such an activity. Reference may be made to the European Waste Catalogue code. Failure to comply with a waste information request is an offence. The information obtained through the making of waste information requests will assist in compliance with Regulation (EC) No. 2150/2002 of the European Parliament and of the Council on waste statistics.

Policy: Regional Law No. 864-OZ “On fundamentals of state support of agricultural development”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law lays down fundamental principles of state support of agricultural development financed by the regional budget with a view of improvement efficiency of agricultural sector, formation of sustainable agrofood market and meeting the demand of the population for foodstuffs. State support can be granted to the following categories: (a) producers of agricultural commodities; and (b) agricultural servicing organizations operating in the field of artificial insemination of livestock and procurement of pedigree livestock; acceptance, storage and processing of agricultural commodities and raw materials; and equipment and material procurement, assistance and servicing of agricultural producers. State support shall be granted in the following forms: (a) access to credits; (b) insurance of agricultural risks; (c) extension; (d) transfer of public finances; and (e) preferential terms for taxation.

Policy: National Climate Change Response Strategy.
Policy_Content: The National Climate Change Response Strategy is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the Strategy is 20 years between 2010 and 2030. Policy: Ley Nº 8904 - Ley para declarar a Costa Rica país libre de Minería Metálica a Cielo Abierto.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley para declarar a Costa Rica país libre de Minería Metálica a Cielo Abierto, reforma adiciona el Código de Minería. A tal fin se modifica el Código de Minería: 1) Se prohíbe la explotación minera en áreas declaradas parques nacionales, reservas biológicas, reservas forestales y refugios estatales de vida silvestre. 2) Se declaran zonas de reserva minera y se congelan a favor del Estado diversas áreas con potencial para la explotación de minería metálica, en las cuales únicamente podrán otorgarse permisos de exploración, concesiones de explotación minera y beneficio de materiales a trabajadores debidamente organizados en cooperativas dedicadas a la minería en pequeña escala para subsistencia familiar y artesanal. 3) Se autoriza a la Dirección de Geología y Minas para que otorgue permisos de exploración y concesiones mineras para la minería en pequeña escala para subsistencia familiar, artesanal y coligallero.

Policy: Order No. 1322 on declaration of electricity for consumers.
Policy_Content: Electricity trading companies must comply with this Order by notifying declarations of fuel mix and environmental impact when supplying electricity to consumers. Energinet.dk shall establish values and criteria for these environmental impacts originating from different energy sources. The Order applies to declarations for electricity supply starting in year 2010.

Policy: European Communities (Vessel Traffic Monitoring and Information System) Regulations 2010 (S.I. No. 573 of 2010).

The Regulations also apply to fishing vessels with an overall length of more than 24 metres but less than 45 metres.

Policy: Land Tenants (Security of Tenure) (Amendment) Act, 2010 (Act No. 10 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Land Tenants (Security of Tenure) Act in section 4(3) by deleting the words “at least six months” and substituting the words “on or”. Section 4(2) provides that a statutory lease shall be a lease for thirty years commencing from the appointed day and, subject to subsection (3), renewable by the tenant for a further period of thirty years. Subsection 3 provided, with respect to the exercise such right of renewal, that the tenant shall serve on the landlord a written notice of renewal at least six months before the expiration of the original term of the statutory lease.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Environment and Development Planning Act (Act No. X of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act sets out the legislative framework for the planning and management of development while ensuring at the same time the protection of the environment. It stipulates that it is the duty of every person together with the Government to protect the environment and to assist in the taking of preventive and remedial measures to protect the environment and manage natural resources in a sustainable manner. The Act sets up the Malta Environment and Planning Authority and the Environment and Planning Commission. Further provisions concern the procedures for adopting plans and policies and the Strategic Plan for the Environment and Development; the issue of licences and permissions for carrying out certain activities (such as trade in wild fauna and flora, introduction of alien species, in relation to waste management and to genetically modified organisms); offences and related penalties.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 1082 of 2010 on Procedure by Which Polluting Activities of Category A, B and C Shall Be Declared and Permits for the Performance of Category A and B Polluting Activities Shall Be Issued
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the conditions for the declaration of a Category A polluting activity, as well as the conditions on the basis of which a permit is issued for the performance of a Category A polluting activity, and the conditions for the use of the best available techniques. Further, the Regulation lays down the conditions for the declaration of a Category B polluting activity, as well as the conditions on the basis of which a permit is issued for the performance of a Category B polluting activity. Moreover, the Regulation provides rules for (1) Category C polluting activities, as well as the content and the procedure for filing a submission of a Category C polluting activity; (2) the time period after which a Category A or Category B polluting activity may not be commenced without a Category A or Category B permit; (3) the deadline by which an operator must file a submission for the receipt of a permit for an existing Category A or Category B polluting activity; (4) the time period after which an existing Category A or Category B polluting activity may not be continued, if a Category A or Category B permit has not been received; (5) the time period within which an operator must announce a change of activity; and (6) the procedure by which a Regional Environmental Board of the State Environmental Service reconsiders the conditions that are specified in a Category A or Category B permit and, if necessary, updates or supplements such conditions. Finally, Category B polluting activities are specified in Annex 1 to the Regulation, and Category C polluting activities are specified in Annex 2 to the Regulation.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: The Concept of sustainable development of rural areas of the Russian Federation for the period up to 2020, approved by Resolution No. 2136-r of the Government of the Russian Federation of 30 November 2010.
Policy_Content: Concept of sustainable development of rural areas of the Russian Federation for the period up to 2020, approved by Resolution No. 2136-r of the Government of the Russian Federation of 30 November 2010 determines the main goals of the state agrarian policy and the development of the fisheries complex in the long term are identified, in particular the sustainable development of rural territories and improving the living standards of the rural population, including residents of settlements with fisheries specialization. It elaborates measures of socio-economic, legal and administrative character. These measures allow to bring rural areas to a qualitatively new level of development, ensuring comprehensive balanced solution of economic, social and environmental problems while maintaining the natural resource, and historical and cultural potential of the rural areas. Creating conditions for the sustainable development of rural areas is one of the most important strategic goals of state policy, the achievement of which will ensure food security, increase the competitiveness of the Russian economy and the welfare of citizens.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Policy/planning,Agricultural development,Food security,Sustainable development,Rural employment,Poverty,Financial agricultural measures,Local government,Fish products

Policy: Agreement between the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany and the Macedonian Government on financial cooperation 2009.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Federal Republic of Germany enables the Macedonian Government or other by both Parties selected beneficiaries to receive a financial contribution from the German Development Bank for the project “Programme on energy efficiency and renewable energy, Phase II”. The text consists of 5 articles.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 46/10 - Estrategia Nacional de Cambio Climático.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo aprueba la Estrategia Nacional de Cambio Climático (ENCC), cuyo desarrollo responde a los esfuerzos encaminados al cumplimiento de los compromisos internacionales adquiridos al firmar y ratificar la Convención Marco de las Naciones Unidas sobre Cambio Climático (CMNUCC), ya que constituye el marco de referencia fundamental para el establecimiento de un marco de política nacional ante el cambio climático, así como para la definición y ejecución de los instrumentos más apropiados para su implementación efectiva, tanto en materia de adaptación como de mitigación. La ENCC y el marco de políticas asociado para su implementación, constituyen un componente intersectorial de carácter estratégico de la agenda nacional e incorpora el tema del cambio climático en las diferentes políticas públicas, tanto en lo social, como en lo económico y ambiental, y en el ámbito nacional, sectorial y municipal. El enfoque de la ENCC se articula con el abordaje del proceso multilateral de la CMNUCC, en el cual los instrumentos de política en proceso de negociación, serían objeto de apoyo técnico y financiero para las acciones nacionales de adaptación y las acciones adecuadas nacionales de mitigación (NAMAs) de los países en desarrollo.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Climate change,Institution,Pollution control,Clean development mechanism,Emissions,Emissions trading,Environmental standards,Basic legislation,Environmental planning,Indigenous peoples,Sustainable use
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Consumer Protection Act (Cap. 83).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the protection of customers against unfair or illegal practices and appoints the Fair Trading Commission as the authority responsible for the administration of this Act  with the objective of promoting and advancing the welfare of consumers. “Goods” means any goods, including animals or agricultural produce reared or grown for supply. “Agricultural produce” means any produce, whether of the soil or otherwise, of stock-farming or of fisheries. The Act requires goods to be of fair value, good quality and safety. A party dissatisfied with an order or direction of the Commission may appeal to the Tribunal  established under the Fair Trading Commission Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Rules of the Ministry of Agriculture for agricultural product cost survey.
Policy_Content: These Rules are enacted in accordance with the Statistical Law of the People's Republic of China and related regulations, aiming to  better organize and carry out the agricultural product cost survey work of the Ministry of Agriculture and improve the authenticity, accuracy and timeliness of the survey data. The Rules consist of 29 Articles divided into 7 Chapters: General provisions;  Survey content and methods; Data collection and review; Data summary and reporting; Data management and use; Working system and safeguards; Supplementary provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Act amending the Act on the Inspection for Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: This Act, which is composed of eight articles, defines tasks of the Inspection for Environmental Protection. The major tasks of the Inspection include: controlling compliance with environmental protection regulations, examining the state of the environment under the programme of the National Environmental Monitoring and preventing major accidents. These tasks are performed by, among others: (1) controlling compliance with environmental protection regulations and sensible use of natural resources; (2) controlling compliance with the decisions specifying the conditions of using the environment; participating in the proceedings related to the location of investments; (3) participating in the commissioning of the structures or installations that may have a significant impact on the environment; (4) controlling the use of installations and facilities protecting the environment against pollution; (5) taking decisions suspending the activity violating environmental protection requirements or the principles specifying the use of the environment; (6) cooperating with other inspecting authorities, prosecution authorities, justice and government administration, the organs of local government and civil first response administration as well as social organizations in the area of environmental protection; (7) organizing and coordinating National Environmental Monitoring, conducting environmental quality tests, observing and assessing the state of the environment and the changes taking place in the environment; (8) preparing and implementing analytical and examining methods as well as controlling and measuring methods; (9) initiating activities with the purpose to establish the conditions preventing major accidents, helping to eliminate their consequences and restoring the environment to its proper condition.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Burgenland Geo-Data Infrastructure Law.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Law is to lay down rules aimed at the establishment of the infrastructure for spatial information in Burgenland with a view to environmental policies and activities which may have an impact on the environment. For the purpose of the present Law “Iinfrastructure for spatial information” means metadata, spatial data sets and spatial data services; network services and technologies; agreements on sharing, access and use. The text consists of 18 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Metadata, spatial data sets and spatial data services (2); Network services (3); Use of spatial data and spatial data services by competent authorities (4); Legal protection (5); Final provisions (6). Three Annexes are enclosed.

It sets forth the principles and procedures of the establishment duties, powers and responsibilities of the General Directorate. The Law also covers provisions regarding the renewal and update of cadastral work of the immovable property, the creation of land registry and further sets forth principles and procedures for archiving, protection and mapping.

Policy: Regional Law No. 10-5-ZKO “On management of public land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of ownership, tenancy and management of public land. The aforesaid operations shall be performed by the authorized regional state body. The following categories of land plots shall be considered pertaining to regional public ownership: (a) recognized as such by the federal laws; (b) land right originating from delimitation of public property to land; (c) land transferred to the regional property by the Russian Federation; and (d) land purchased by the regional administration. Land owned by the regional administration shall pertain to the regional Treasury. Land owned by the regional administration shall be transferred to individual entrepreneurs and commercial organizations for fiduciary management.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Directive 2010/75/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on industrial emissions (integrated pollution prevention and control).
Policy_Content: This Directive lays down rules on integrated prevention and control of pollution arising from industrial activities, particularly those referred to in Chapters II to VI (which include combustion plants, waste incineration plants and installations and activities using organic solvents as well as installations producing titanium dioxide). It sets out provisions to prevent or reduce emissions into air, water and land and to prevent the generation of waste, in order to achieve a high level of protection of the environment.

Policy: Decree No. 117/2010/ND-CP on the organization and management of the special-use forest system.
Policy_Content: This Decree provides for the organization and management of the special-use forest system in Viet Nam in order to conserve the forests’ ecosystems and biodiversity, as well as their natural landscape, cultural and historical values. It sets out procedures and requirements for the establishment of a special-use forest and it classifies special-use forests into national parks, nature conservation zones, landscape protection zones and scientific and experimentation forest zones.

Policy: Ley Nº 749-2010 : Plan Maestro Ambiental. Tratado de paz entre progreso y medio ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley aprueba el Tratado de Paz entre Progreso y Medio Ambiente (Estrategia 2010-2020) y establece los principios que rigen su interpretación e implementación. En particular la Ley declara que el progreso será propiamente humano en armonía con un ambiente equilibrado, y al mismo tiempo, la protección y la restauración del ambiente serán factores de progreso. La Ley establece que la protección del medio ambiente constituye una Política de Estado prioritaria y estratégica para el progreso e inclusión económico-social, en armonía con el desarrollo.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Loi N°2010-44 du 24 novembre 2010 portant gestion de l’eau en République du Benin.
Policy_Content: La présente loi détermine les conditions d'une gestion intégrée des ressources en eau visant à assurer une utilisation équilibrée, une répartition équitable et une exploitation durable de la ressource disponible.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Right to clean/healthy environment,Human rights,Framework law,Basic legislation,Water rights,Concession,Water abstraction,Freshwater resources management,Authorization/permit,Priorities,Irrigation,Surface water,Groundwater,Well sinking/boreholes,Servitude,Water shortage/drought,Flood,Pollution control,Inland waters,Water supply,Waterworks,Wetlands

Policy: Regional Law No. 432-ZZK “On socially oriented non-commercial organizations”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to render support and assistance to socially oriented non-commercial organizations. In particular state support shall be granted to non-commercial socially oriented organizations operating in socio-economic, ecological and cultural spheres, including prevention of natural and ecological disasters, environmental protection and cultural heritage. State support shall include subsidies and incentives out of regional budget, transfer of public property to socially oriented non-commercial organizations, and reduction of lease payments thereto.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Rural energy regulations of Sichuan province.
Policy_Content: The Regulations, consisting of 33 Articles, are formulated in accordance with the Energy Conservation Law and the Renewable Energy Law, aiming to promote the conservation, development and utilization of rural energy, protect and improve the ecological environment, strengthen the rural energy management. The Text are divided into 5 Chapters: General principles; Supporting services and development and utilization; Supervision and administration; Legal liabilities; and Supplementary provisions.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Regulations enter into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Joint Order of 24 November 2010 on pollution control and prevention of oil exploitations.
Policy_Content: This Joint Order establishes that the integrated control of oil pollution in any activity related to petroleum sector, will be temporarily under the competence of the National Authority for Petroleum and by the National Direction of Environment.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources

Policy: Government (Amendment) Act 2010 (No. 22 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Government Act (Cap. 3) by repealing sections 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 11, 19, 21. It also concerns the appointment of the Prime Minister and the Deputy Prime Minister.

Policy: Act of Constitution of Tonga (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 2010.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down some amendments to the Constitution of Tonga. The amendments concern, among other aspects, the impartiality of Government, Attorney general, Constitutions and powers of Cabinet, appointment of Governors, composition of legislative assembly, impeachment, general elections, Court of Appeal and the Supreme Court.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regulation on the update of information on the environment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of six paragraphs and two Annexes, concerns publishing information on the environment and environmental protection, participation of the public in the environmental protection and environmental impact assessment (EIA). This Regulation establishes: (1) the way of publishing information; (2) minimal scope of available information (specified in Annex 1); (3) the form of presented information; (4) frequency of the update of information (specified in Annex 2).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 1 December 2010.

Policy: Act on Organic Production and Labelling of Organic Products.
Policy_Content: This Act regulates: the objectives and principles for organic production; production rules; labelling of organic products; control of organic production; conditions that must comply with the controlling bodies; administrative, inspection and the foundation for sustainable development of organic production while ensuring the effective functioning of markets; competition; ensuring consumer confidence and protecting consumer interests.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette, except for the provisions of article 13 paragraph 1 point i), article 17 paragraph 3 and 4, article 22, article 23, article 28, article 38, article 39, article 40, article 41 and article 42 of this Act which shall come into force on Croatian accession to the European Union.

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 10-326 du 17 Moharram 1432 correspondant au 23 décembre 2010 fixant les modalités de mise en oeuvre du droit de concession pour l’exploitation des terres agricoles du domaine privé de l’Etat.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet de fixer les modalités de mise en oeuvre du droit de concession pour l’exploitation des terres agricoles du domaine privé de l’Etat prévu par les dispositions de la loi n° 10-03. Sans préjudice des autres contrôles exercés dans le cadre de la législation et de la réglementation en vigueur, l’office national des terres agricoles peut exercer, à tout moment, le contrôle sur l’exploitation agricole pour s’assurer que les activités qui y sont menées sont conformes aux dispositions de la loi n°10-03 et des textes pris pour son application et aux clauses du cahier des charges. Les exploitants concessionnaires peuvent se regrouper en coopérative agricole conformément à la législation et à la réglementation en vigueur.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Decree No. 273 of 23.11.2010 on the adoption of the Regulation on the protection of the environment in the seas and for the establishment of consultative and coordination council for the protection of the environment in the black sea and for the management of implementation of the marine strategy and programme.
Policy_Content: This Decree adopts the rules and measures contained in the Regulation on the protection of the environment in the seas and for the establishment of consultative and coordination council for the protection of the environment in the black sea and for the management of implementation of the marine strategy and programme, and officially establishes the Consultative and Coordination Council for the Protection of the Marine Environment of Black Sea waters (also sets various relations between related state institutions and Ministers, legal and private entities; determines several procedural and administrative issues).

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 1071 of 2010 on Requirements for the Assessment of the Marine Environmental Status, Determination of a Good Marine Environmental Status and the Development of the Marine Environment Targets
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the content and type of the information to be included in the assessment of the environmental status; qualitative descriptors for determination of a good environmental status; lists of features, pressures and impacts characterising environmental status; and requirements for the development of marine environment targets and the indicators related thereto. Upon the request of the Latvian Institute of Aquatic Ecology State authorities, local governments, State and local government capital companies, as well as other State authorities, without a payment or in accordance with the price list of paid services, shall submit thereto the available information, which is necessary for the development of a marine assessment and for the determination of marine environment targets, including geospatial information and digital maps; monitoring of surface water, air and biological diversity, as well as other types of environmental monitoring data; information which has been acquired in fulfilling the requirements prescribed in the regulatory enactments referred to in Section 13, Paragraph one of the Marine Environment Protection and Management Law; and nature protection plans for specially protected nature territories.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,Marine area,Protection of environment,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Risk assessment/management,Policy/planning,Survey/mapping,Procedural matters,Access-to-information,Monitoring,Marine protected areas,Surface water,Coastal zone management,Biodiversity,Protected area

Policy: Commission Decision 2010/709/EU establishing the European Union Ecolabelling Board.
Policy_Content: This Decision sets up the European Union Ecolabelling Board, which shall provide assistance in the adoption of European Union Ecolabel criteria.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Arrêté n° 9190 du 22 novembre 2010 portant création, attributions et organisation du centre national d’études des sols.
Policy_Content: II est créé auprès du ministère de l’agriculture et de l’élevage un centre national d’études des sols, organe de recherche appliquée et d’appui technique dans les études des sols à vocation agropastorale. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment, de:  réaliser toute étude d’inventaire, de cartographie et d’évaluation des ressources en sols; apporter aux exploitations agropastorales une assistance scientifique et technique; veiller à une utilisation rationnelle des terres en vue de leur conservation; évaluer la sévérité de la dégradation des sols et contribuer à la formulation des politiques et des programmes de conservation des sols; constituer une documentation scientifique et technique en recherche développement dans le domaine des études des sols; contribuer à la formation des cadres nationaux aux techniques d’évaluation et de gestion des ressources en sols; veiller à la réalisation d’une activité quelconque sur des sols agricoles préalablement prospectés.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Environmental Regulation for Oil Operations. This Regulation, consisting of 4 Chapters, establishes the requirements to be satisfied in order to perform oil operation. The Regulation in particular specifies Environment Impact Assessment procedures, protection and control measures in order to prevent environmental disasters. It is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Procedures for EIA (Chap. II); Taxes and sanctions (Chap. III); Final provisions (Chap. V).

Policy: Decree No. 55/2010 approving the Regulation on the prohibition of asbestos and its derivatives.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation on the prohibition of production, use, import, export commercialization or transport of asbestos and its derivatives. This Regulation, composed of 7 articles, establishes in details the aforementioned prohibition in order to protect the habitat and the human health. Exceptions are mentioned for research or scientific purposes. Sanctions for illegal activities are prescribed in the text.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 53/2010 approving the legal regime for the exploitation of two National solar photovoltaic Centres.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 9 Chapters, approves the legal regime for the exploitation of two National solar photovoltaic Centres in Cape Verde. It specifies the requirements to be satisfied by these two National Centres, in order to produce solar electric renewable energy.  These State Centres are located in the Palmarejo area, Island of Santiago, and in Murdeira area, Island of Sal, and their concession for Energy exploitation is given to: Electricity and Water Company, S.A.R.L. (Electra), establishing that the concessionary will be responsible for the exploitation of the two centres, transportation and distribution of electric energy and treated residual water for its re-utilization and renewable energy production.

Policy: Arrêté n° 9189 du 22 novembre 2010 portant création, attributions et organisation du centre national d’appui aux cultures pérennes.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée auprès du ministère de l’agriculture et de l’élevage, un centre national d’appui aux cultures pérennes et fixe ses attributions et son organisation. Le centre national d’appui aux cultures pérennes est un organe de promotion des cultures pérennes sur toute l’étendue du territoire national. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment, de: renforcer les capacités des producteurs des cultures pérennes; assister les producteurs dans leur production; mettre en place les antennes de proximité pour la production des plants; vulgariser les nouvelles technologies de production; assurer la multiplication des plants à haut rendement et la distribution des intrants. Les organes de gestion du centre national d’appui aux cultures pérennes sont: le comité de pilotage; la direction du centre.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Law No.22 of 2010 concerning Mines and Quarries.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 144 articles divided in VIII Parts aims at (i) regulating the operations of reconnaissance, exploration, mining, extraction of quarry raw materials, and artisanal mining; (ii) regulating the related rights and obligations; (iii) encouraging national and foreign capital in the field to satisfy the requirements of social and economic development of the State; and (iv) insuring ideal exploitation for mineral resources and quarry raw materials in compatibility with sound environmental management. According to the Law, the Government offers five types of licenses - issued by the Geological Survey and Minerals Resources Board - and the amount of prescribed fee of the applications of the license, extension, transfer and enlargement shall be determined  by the Regulation. The licenses are as follows (1) reconnaissance; (2) exploration; (3) mining; (4) quarrying; and (5) artisanal. The law, for each type of license, specifies (i) how to obtain it; (ii) the cases for which it cannot be granted; and (iii) the rights it guarantees. The Law establishes that all mineral resources until it is extracted from its place of natural occurrence shall remain the property of the State.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Mining,Public health,Protection of environment,Pollution control,Zoning,Basic legislation,Exploration,Authorization/permit,Minerals,Waste disposal,Waste non-domestic sources,Waste management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 1.565/2010 - Regula y modifica determinados aspectos relativos a la actividad de producción de energía eléctrica en régimen especial.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto regular y modificar determinados aspectos relativos a la actividad de producción de energía eléctrica en régimen especial, así como mejorar la simplificación administrativa en esta materia.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 017-2010-MTC ─ Modifica el Decreto Supremo Nº 047-2001-MTC, Límites Máximos Permisibles de emisiones contaminantes para vehículos automotores que circulen en la red vial.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo prorroga la suspensión hasta el 31 de diciembre de 2011 la aplicación del acápite II del anexo 1 que establece en el ámbito nacional los valores de los Límites Máximos Permisibles (LMPs) de emisiones contaminantes para los vehículos automotores nuevos importados que funcionan con motor diesel.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand portant des dispositions générales en matière de la politique de l’énergie.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement flamand porte des dispositions générales en matière de la politique de l’énergie. Le titre 2 établit que l’Agence flamande de l’Energie est créée en vue de l’exécution d’une politique de l’énergie durable faisant partie du domaine politique de l’Environnement, de la Nature et de l’Energie. L’Agence flamande de l’Energie accomplit, entre autres, les missions suivantes: 1) la promotion d’une production d’énergie respectueuse de l’environnement et la gestion des moyens et fonds affectés à cette fin; 2) la promotion d’une utilisation d’énergie rationnelle et la gestion des moyens et fonds affectés à cette fin; 3) l’application de la réglementation relative à la gestion et au développement des réseaux de distribution de l’électricité, du gaz et de la chaleur et du réseau local d’acheminement d’électricité. Le texte  est répartis en 12 Titres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); L’Agence flamande de l’Energie (II); Organisation du marché de l’électricité et du gaz (III); L’attribution annuelle d’une quantité d’électricité gratuite (IV); Mesures sociales en matière de l’énergie (V); Production d’énergie écologique et consommation énergétique rationnelle consommation énergétique (VI); Production d’énergie écologique et consommation énergétique rationnelle consommation énergétique (VI); Interventions favorisant l’utilisation rationnelle de l’énergie, l’utilisation de sources d’énergie renouvelables et l’application de mécanismes de flexibilité (VII); Agrément d’experts en matière d’énergie (VIII); Performance énergétique de bâtiments (IX); Rapportage de la politique de l’énergie (X) ; Contrôle et sanctions (XI); Dispositions modificatives, abrogatoires, transitoires et finales (XII).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présente arrêté entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 2011.

Policy: Ley Nº 7/2010 - Ley de protección contra la contaminación acústica de Aragón.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de protección contra la contaminación acústica de Aragón, tiene por objeto prevenir, vigilar y reducir la contaminación acústica para evitar y reducir los daños que de esta puedan derivarse para la salud humana, los bienes o el medio ambiente en la Comunidad Autónoma de Aragón, mediante el establecimiento de niveles, objetivos e índices de calidad acústica.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Loi sur la protection de l'environnement (LcPE).
Policy_Content: La présente loi met en exécution la loi fédérales sur la protection de l’environnement du 7 octobre 1983. La loi a pour but de protéger la population et l'environnement contre les atteintes nuisibles ou incommodantes et de conserver durablement les ressources naturelles. En outre, la loi régit et complète l'application de la loi fédérale sur la protection de l'environnement et de ses ordonnances. Le chapitre 2 traite, entre autres, les aspects suivants: étude de l'impact sur l'environnement, protection contre les accidents majeurs et autres catastrophes, protection de l'air, protection contre le bruit, protection contre le rayonnement non ionisant, déchets, sites pollués et les atteintes portées au sol. Le texte comprend 58 articles répartis en 3 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Dispositions spéciales (2); Dispositions d’exécution, dispositions transitoires et finales (3).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Basic legislation,EIA,Air quality/air pollution,Noise pollution,Radiation,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Subsidy/incentive,Special fund,Enforcement/compliance,Offences/penalties,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente loi entre en vigueur le 26 avril 2011.

Policy: Decree (2010:1341) relative to protection of the marine environment.
Policy_Content: This Decree, based principally on Chapter 5 of the Environmental Code, concerns the quality of Swedish marine waters. It provides rules relative to an ecosystem-responsible administration and sustainable use of the marine environment as in accordance with Directive 2008/56/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a framework for community action in the field of marine environmental policy (Marine Strategy Framework Directive).The Swedish marine waters (as defined by this Decree), shall be divided into two administrative areas: the North Sea and the Baltic Sea. The Nature Protection Agency shall be the principal authority for purposes of management and conservation of the marine environment.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 14/11 - Guía Metodológica para la elaboración de los Planes de Manejo en Áreas Protegidas.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto aprobar la Guía Metodológica para la elaboración de los Planes de protección y gestión ambiental en Áreas Protegida, que proporciona una guía para la información básica acerca del área protegida, sus valores y recursos, ilustración de problemas existentes para exponer las vocaciones óptimas de uso, así como determinar los impactos y riesgos lo que permite determinar las pautas de aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos en el área.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Act No. CXVII of 2010 concerning the promotion of the use of renewable energy for transport and the greenhouse effect reduction of energy used for transport purposes.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to reduce the impact on climate change of energy consumption of transportation activities and respect the principles of sustainability during biofuel production. In the territory of the Republic of Hungary at least 10% of energy used for all type of transport must be produced from renewable sources by 2020.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: 15 April 2011.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon introduisant certaines dérogations pour l'admission des variétés de légumes traditionnellement cultivées dans des régions spécifiques ou sans valeur commerciale, ainsi que pour la commercialisation des semences de ces varieties.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté transpose la Directive 2009/145/CE de la Commission du 26 novembre 2009 introduisant certaines dérogations pour l'admission des races primitives et variétés de légumes traditionnellement cultivées dans des localités et régions spécifiques et menacées d'érosion génétique, et des variétés de légumes sans valeur intrinsèque pour la production commerciale mais créées en vue de répondre à des conditions de culture particulières, ainsi que pour la commercialisation de semences de ces races primitives et variétés. L’article 2 établit que le présent arrêté concerne les espèces agricoles relevant de l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 9 février 2006 relatif à la production et à la commercialisation des semences de légumes et des semences de chicorée industrielle. Le texte comprend 40 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Objet et définitions (Ier); Variétés de conservation (II); Variétés créées pour répondre à des conditions du culture particulières (III); Dispositions générales et finales (IV). Deux annexes sont jointes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Act on environmental tax on energy producing products (No. 21 of 2010).
Policy_Content: The Act sets regulations on environmental taxes to be paid for petroleum, coal and gas products used to produce  energy, such as heat, electricity and motor fuel. Businesses that as part of their business extract, manufacture or import taxable goods must register an administrative tax. This Act shall come into force on 1 January 2011 and applies to goods whereby service tax requirement in adherence to article 2 enters into force on 1 January 2011 or later.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Keyword: Environmental fees/charges,Energy conservation/energy production,Oil,Coal,Natural gas,Internal trade,Basic legislation
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, European Union Countries, North America, North Atlantic
Entry into force notes: The Act enters into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Saarland Land Use Planning Law.
Policy_Content: Within the framework of the Federal Land Use Planning Act of 22 December 2008 (BGBl. I p. 2986), the present Law regulates land use planning in the Saarland. The whole Saarland shall be subject to a sustainable planning policy. The text, consisting of 14 articles, deals with the following aspects: tasks of land use planning, land use planning authorities, land development plan, drawing up of the land development plan; environmental assessment, conservation of plan; special proceedings ; safeguard and implementation of land use plan, compensation and transitional and final provisions.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Second Regional Councils Amendment Act, 2010  (No. 16 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Regional Councils Act, 1992, in sections 1, 11, 18, 18A and 21 with respect to the office of governor of the region and rights of the governor in respect of meetings of the regional council and the management committee of the region.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Regulation on the content and appearance of the unique Register of accredited regional development agencies.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets the rules aimed to determine the management requirements and terms of use of the unique Serbian Register of accredited regional development agencies (containing all necessary data regarding their work and operations performed).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decision No.942 dated 17.11.2010 approving the procedures and the documentation required for mineral permits in open areas.
Policy_Content: The application and the supporting documents for mineral permits are submitted to the National Center of Licensing which submits everything electronically for further examinations to the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Energetics, National Agency of Natural Resources (NANR) and Albanian Geological Service (AGS).  The assessment of permits for digging is done by the AGS while the exploitation permits are assessed by the NANR. The decision lays out the list of documents required to be submitted and several annexes for the permits’ forms and the respective assessment acts.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decision enters into force 15 days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Arrêté n° 9104 du 17 novembre 2010 portant création, attributions et organisation du centre de vulgarisation des techniques agricoles.
Policy_Content: Il est créé auprès du ministère de l’agriculture et de l’élevage, un centre de vulgarisation des techniques agricoles. Le centre est un organe de recherche appliquée et de vulgarisation des techniques agricoles auprès des exploitants agricoles. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment, de:  expérimenter les meilleures variétés locales et étrangères des cultures vivrières et maraîchères; revaloriser les déchets des cultures par l’introduction de la myciculture; diffuser les semences de choix et mettre en œuvre les techniques de production adéquates;  assurer l’encadrement technique des paysans;  assurer la transformation de la production paysanne: décorticage du paddy et broyage du maïs et du soja; - suivre l’impact technique et technologique de la mécanisation agricole dans les zones d’intervention.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté n° 9105 du 17 novembre 2010 portant création, attributions et organisation du centre d’appui à la filière bovine.
Policy_Content: II est créé auprès du ministère de l’agriculture et de l’élevage, un centre d’appui à la filière bovine. Le centre d’appui à la filière bovine est un organe d’appui aux éleveurs du secteur paysan. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment, de: assurer l’encadrement des éleveurs et exploitations pastorales;  mettre en place un système de formation de base des éleveurs et bouviers dans les centres d’appui technique;  recenser les parcs, les animaux et les éleveurs;  mettre en place un système d’approvisionnement en intrants à des prix suffisamment bas et un réseau de distribution assez fiable pour qu’il y ait un impact réel sur l’élevage, apporter un appui et des conseils techniques aux éleveurs en vue de l’amélioration de leur bilan technico-économique;  appuyer les éleveurs dans l’acquisition des géniteurs performants des centres d’appui techniques;  vulgariser les technologies en matière d’élevage bovin ; renforcer les capacités en matière de dissémination des connaissances et des technologies générées par la recherche.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté n° 9103 du 17 novembre 2010 portant création, attributions et organisation du centre de démonstration des techniques agricoles.
Policy_Content: Il est créé auprès du ministère de l’agriculture et de l’élevage, un centre de démonstration des techniques agricoles. Le centre est un organe d’appui à la production par la recherche, la formation et la vulgarisation des itinéraires techniques agricoles afin d’améliorer la production agricole. A ce titre, il est chargé, notamment, de: définir et exécuter les activités de recherche développement, de l’encadrement et de la vulgarisation,  assurer la formation des acteurs impliqués dans la production agricole;  vulgariser et diffuser les résultats de la recherche; accroître et diversifier la production agricole; assurer le suivi et l’évaluation des activités du centre.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Arrêté n° 9106 du 17 novembre 2010 portant création, attributions et organisation du centre de vulgarisation des techniques d’élevage.
Policy_Content: II est créé auprès du ministère de l’agriculture et de l’élevage un centre de vulgarisation des techniques d’élevage, organe de formation, recherche et d’encadrement technique des éleveurs avicoles et porcins. A ce titre, le centre est chargé, notamment, de:  former et recycler les cadres et techniciens du ministère aux nouvelles techniques d’élevage avicole et porcin;  vulgariser les nouvelles techniques d’élevage avicole et porcin en milieu périurbain et rural; former et recycler les acteurs de terrain et les propriétaires des exploitations;  importer, multiplier, sélectionner et diffuser les géniteurs porcins de race pure et des coqs améliorés pour les éleveurs formés;  inventorier et valoriser les matières premières locales disponibles dans la fabrication d’aliment de bétail; élaborer, expérimenter et vulgariser les formules alimentaires à base des matières premières locales; évaluer l’impact technique et économique des innovations auprès des éleveurs; faire de la recherche-développement.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, South Atlantic

Policy: Land (Duties and Taxes) (Amendment of Schedule) Regulations 2010 (GN No. 219 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Land (Duties and Taxes) Act in the Eight Schedule made under section 45A (3). This provision prescribes that a deed of transfer referred to in the Eighth Schedule shall be exempt from duty or taxes leviable under the appropriate Part or Parts specified in that Schedule.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Acuerdo por el que se establecen la organización y funciones de las direcciones generales de la Comisión Reguladora de Energía.
Policy_Content: Las presentes disposiciones regulan la organización y las funciones que ejercen las Direcciones Generales que colaborarán con la Comisión Reguladora de Energía, entre ellas la Dirección General de Hidrocarburos y Bioenergéticos y la Dirección General de Electricidad y Energías Renovables.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Ley Nº 6.682 - Crea el Sistema de Información para el Fortalecimiento del Abastecimiento y Comercialización de Hidrocarburos de la Provincia del Chaco (SIFACHACO).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Sistema de Información para el Fortalecimiento del Abastecimiento y Comercialización de Hidrocarburos de la Provincia del Chaco (SIFACHACO), cuyos objetivos son los siguientes: transparentar las condiciones de abastecimiento de hidrocarburos y de su comercialización entre todos los agentes intervinientes ; formular políticas activas orientadas al desarrollo del mercado provincial de hidrocarburos ; establecer una base de datos a nivel provincial de la oferta, demanda, abastecimiento y suministro de hidrocarburos en todas las etapas de comercialización. En este marco se establece el el Registro Público Provincial de Operadores de Hidrocarburos de la Provincia del Chaco.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Condominium Property Act of 2010 (RPPL No. 8-19).
Policy_Content: This Act  provides for the recognition of the condominium form of ownership of real property and establishes rules for the creation, sale, and operation of condominiums, and for related purposes. It seeks to protect condominium ownership rights and define the legal relationship among the various parties involved in condominium development and  ownership. The Act also establishes a set of guidelines by which owners make collective decisions and resolve conflicts.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Government Decree No. 263 of 2010 (XI. 17.) on the rules for the free ownership or management of municipal land plots for the realization of a social land program for local governments.
Policy_Content: This Government Decree establishes the rules for the free ownership or management of municipal land plots for the realization of social land programs for local governments. The municipality (in the capital city of the district, the capital directly administered by the Metropolitan Municipality in the capital) may only receive land lots located in its own settlement for the purpose of the program. The local government may submit its written request to land for the management of the property within 30 days from the date of publication of the notice. Failure to comply with the deadline shall not affect the right of the municipality to re-submit the application on the basis of a subsequent publication.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The latest consolidated version of the Decree entered into force on 5 September 2014.

Policy: Decision No. 942 dated 17.11.2010 approving procedures and documentation for the mineral permits in the open zones.
Policy_Content: The Regulation lays down procedures and documentation required for the mineral permits in the open zones. These zones should be located within the areas published as opened in the annual minerar plan. The full documentation of such request should be submitted to the National Licensing Center which publishes the application dates.  The application materials are electronically sent to the Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Energetics which is the central implementing authority. A model application is attached to the Regulation.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 262 of 2010 (XI. 17.) Korm. of the Government laying down detailed rules of utilization of land parcels forming part of the National Land Fund.
Policy_Content: This Decree shall be applied to procedures, legal transactions, legal relations in connection with the utilization of land parcels of the National Land Fund, and to natural persons, legal entities and entities without legal personality taking part in such affairs. This Decree consists of nine chapters: General provisions (I); Common rules of utilization by public tendering (II); Special rules of tendering with the objective of sale or leasing out of agricultural lands (III); Sale by public auction (IV); Rules regarding sale and lease (V); Rules of asset management (VI); Give for use of areas managed by the Natural Park Directorate (VI/A); Utilization of plots of land by exchange (VII); Control by the proprietor of land and reporting obligation of the land user (VIII); and Final provisions (IX).
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Land tenure,Lease,Agricultural land,Data collection/reporting,Protected area,National parks
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated version of the Decree entered into force on 29 August 2013.

Policy: Decree on the manner of construction of public shelters and maintenance and use of already constructed shelters and other protection facilities and determination of required number of shelters.
Policy_Content: This Decree, as in accordance with the provisions of the Macedonian Law on protection and rescue operations, regulates the manner of construction and maintenance of public shelters and the use of prefabricated shelters and other shelters; and determines the required number of shelters. Shelter and protection of the population, material and cultural goods heritage in the Republic of Macedonia is done by building public shelters and other protection facilities. Main issues are regulated in Chapter II. Manner of construction of public shelters and other protective facilities; Chapter III. Maintenance of already built shelters and other protective facilities; Chapter IV. Use of shelters and other protection facilities; V. Determination of the necessary number of shelters.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force on the day after its publication the Official Gazette (published on 26 November 2010).

Policy: Introductory Law relating to the federal power supply legislation.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Federal Power Supply Act of 23 March 2007. Article 1 establishes that the municipality shall provide for the supply of electricity if not adequately met by third parties. The text consists of 12 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: Obligation to supply (I); Network areas and network operations (II); Contracts (III); Final provisions (IV).
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regional Law No. 129-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of environmental protection, management and protection of waterbodies”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that Regional Legislative Assembly shall have the following competence in the sphere of environmental protection, management and protection of waterbodies: (a) legislative regulation, including adoption of decrees and legislative acts; (b) law enforcement; and (c) validation of the water charges for the use of waterbodies, the modalities of calculation and collection of the aforesaid water charges. The Government shall have the following competence: (a) validation of long-term purposeful specific programs; (b) promotion of ecological education; (c) prevention of emergencies and natural and technological disasters resulting from waste management and atmospheric air pollution, and mitigation of the consequences thereof; and (d) reservation of potable water supply sources.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Disasters,Education,Water charges,Enforcement/compliance,Pollution control,Waste management,Potable water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 12.465 approving the Regulation of the Secretariat of the Environment (SEMA).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation of the Secretariat of the Environment (SEMA). This Regulation, consisting of 24 articles divided into six Chapters and two Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of SEMA, created by Law No. 8.538 of 20 December 2002. This Secretariat aims to ensure the promotion of the sustainable development of the State of Bahia, formulating and implementing public policies aimed at harmonizing the preservation, conservation and sustainable use of the environment, with respect to ethnic-racial-cultural diversity and social and environmental justice in the State of Bahia. SEMA is also responsible to: plan, coordinate, guide and integrate actions related to the State System of the Environment SISEMA and to the State System of Management of Water Resources SEGREH; formulate, coordinate, monitor and evaluate the State Policy on the Environment and Protection of Biodiversity and the State Policy on Water Resources; chair the State Environmental Council CEPRAM and chair the State Council of Water Resources CONERH; promote the integration of sectoral policies with the environmental and water resources policy, establishing mechanisms of compatibility with plans, programmes and projects;  support the strengthening of municipal environmental management; coordinate and promote research aimed at designing and execution of integrated programmes, projects and actions for the preservation and conservation of the environment, biodiversity, forests, water resources and climate change; establish standards and procedures for the integration of actions related to the environment; manage the State Environmental Funds, etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Institution,Environmental planning,Community management,Cultural heritage,Traditional rights/customary rights,Indigenous peoples,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Biodiversity,Freshwater resources management,Ecosystem preservation,Management/conservation

Policy: Resolution No. 46 of 2010 of Government of Adjara on Creation and Charter of Legal Entity under Public Law – the Cultural Heritage Protection Agency of Adjara
Policy_Content: This Resolution provides for the creation and the charter of the legal entity under public law – the Cultural Heritage Protection Agency of Adjara. It consists of 13 articles: General provisions (1); Purpose and objectives of the Agency (2); Authority and activities of the Agency (3); Management of the Agency (4); Authority of director (5); Structure and authority of structural units of the Agency (6); Control of Agency activities (7); Activities of the Agency that require authorization (8); Property of the Agency (9); Finances of the Agency (10); Accounting at the Agency (11); Liquidation of the Agency (12); and Amendment and additions to this charter.
Subject: Environment gen., General

Policy: European Communities (Ship-Source Pollution) Regulations 2010 (No. 542 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations give effect to Directive 2005/35/EC, as amended by Directive 2009/123/EC, on ship-source pollution and on the introduction of penalties, including criminal penalties, for illegal discharges of polluting substances into the marine environment. The polluting substances are those covered by MARPOL 73/78 Annex I (oil) and Annex II (noxious liquid substances carried in bulk). They apply to Irish ships everywhere and to other ships when they are in the inland waters, territorial seas, or exclusive economic zone of the State.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Décret n° 2010-2974 du 15 novembre 2010, portant création du pôle technologique pour la valorisation des richesses sahariennes et pour le perfectionnement de l'exploitation des capacités qui s’y trouvent fixant son organisation administrative et financière et les modalités de son fonctionnement.
Policy_Content: Est créée l'entreprise du pôle technologique pour la valorisation des richesses sahariennes et pour le perfectionnement de l'exploitation des capacités qui s'y trouvent. Le pôle technologique est placé sous la tutelle du ministre de l'agriculture, des ressources hydrauliques et de la pêche, son siège est fixé à Médenine. Il est chargé des missions suivantes: - valoriser le produit agricole saharien dans le cadre d'une vision prospective en se basant sur la complémentarité entre le système de la recherche scientifique et du développement de la technologie, le système de l'enseignement supérieur et le système de production, - mettre les espaces à la disposition des entrepreneurs dans le domaine de la valorisation du produit agricole du sahara en vue d'instaurer des projets innovants s'appuyant sur la nouvelle technologie, - le soutien de la coopération et la complémentarité entre les unités de recherche, de formation, de production et de développement dans le domaine de la valorisation du produit agricole du sahara, - l'incubation et l'encadrement des titulaires de projets technologiques ou de services dans le domaine de la valorisation du produit agricole du sahara ainsi que leur assistance dans l'exercice de leurs activités, - le drainage de l'investissement national et étranger et le soutien du partenariat dans le domaine des spécialités du pôle et l'encouragement des entreprises habilités à s'y installer, - le renforcement de la veille technologique dans les domaines afférents aux spécialités du pôle, - le soutien de la coopération et de l'échange avec les pôles similaires, les établissements universitaires et les centres de recherche et d'innovation technologique à l'échelle nationale et internationale en instaurant une politique ouverte à l'environnement en vue de garantir la complémentarité entre les compétences scientifiques et les initiatives agro-économiques, - le soutien du dynamisme économique et du développement régional au sud tunisien.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento de aplicación de la Ley reformatoria de la Ley de Hidrocarburos que establece los procedimientos que permiten aplicar las disposiciones constantes en la Ley Reformatoria a la Ley de Hidrocarburos, que dispone que el Estado explorará y explotará los yacimientos hidrocarburíferos, en forma directa y prioritaria a través de las empresas públicas de hidrocarburos y establecerá las políticas de asignación directa de áreas de exploración y explotación de hidrocarburos y sustancias asociadas a las empresas públicas.

Policy: Law No. 351-IV ZRK “On state regulation of manufacturing and trade of biofuel”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates social relations originating in the sphere of manufacturing and trade of biofuel. This Law consists of 5 Sections divided into 24 Articles: (1) general provisions; (2) state regulation and support of manufacturing and trade of biofuel; (3) safety requirements for biofuel and life cycle processes thereof; (4) state supervision in the sphere of manufacturing and trade of biofuel; and (5) conclusive provisions. Main tasks of state regulation of manufacturing and trade of biofuel shall be: (a) reduction of emissions to the atmospheric air; (b) promotion of manufacturing and use of biofuel; and (c) ensuring enforcement of the national legislation on manufacturing and trade of biofuel. The following shall be prohibited: (a) excess of quota of alimentary raw materials for manufacturing of biofuel; (b) to use high quality grains and cereals for manufacturing of biofuel; and (c) to manufacture and trade liquors by the producers of biofuel.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 83 sections divided by eleven Parts and completed by 12 Schedules, enables the Minister to exempt a person or class of persons from the operation of section 6 of the Mining Act 1992, which makes it an offence to carry out a mining purpose without a relevant authorization, and to declare that a specified activity or class of activity is not prospecting or mining for the purposes of section 11A of the Act.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 14/2010 establishing the Maritime Code of Cape Verde.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree approves the Cape Verde Maritime Code, which regulates national maritime zones, ships, vessels and related equipment, including prevention of marine pollution. In addition, it specifies the legal situations and relationships created during sea navigation and maritime transport, applicable to all ships navigating within the territorial waters of Cape Verde, whatever the nationality of the ship or the nationality and residence of its owners or shipowners and definition of the limits of the territorial sea of ​​Cape Verde. The Code is divided into the following twelve Books: General provision (I); Maritime Zones and Navigation Regime (II); Ports (III); Ships, Vessels and related Equipment IV); Vessel Owners (V); Economic Order of Maritime Transport (VI); Ship Contracts and Auxiliary Contracts (VII); Risks at Sea and Navigation Accidents (VIII); Global Limitation of Liability (IX); Maritime Insurance (X); Maritime Procedures XI); Administrative Offences and Sanctions (XII). In addition, it amends Book III of the Commercial Code, relating to Maritime Law, approved by the Letter of Law of 28 June 1888, and repeals several legislation related to Maritime Law.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: Maritime zone,Marine pollution,Marine fisheries,Fishery management and conservation,Continental shelf,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone,Navigation,Harbour,Inspection,Territorial sea,Basic legislation,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Code enters into force on 1 January 2011.

Policy: Lands Tribunal Act, 2010 (No. 39 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act continues into existence the Lands Tribunal established under the Lands Act. It defines the jurisdiction of the Tribunal and provides for the composition of the Tribunal and its procedures. There shall be a Registrar of the Tribunal who shall be responsible for defined matters of administration and procedure. The Act also grants to the Chief Justice power to make Rules and to the Minister to make Regulations.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Court/tribunal,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Traditional rights/customary rights,Enforcement/compliance,Land tenure,Liability/compensation,Ownership,Property rights

Policy: Agricultural Credits Act, 2010 (No. 35 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to a system of charge, lien or assignments on agricultural goods and warehouse receipts for credit, and for supervision and the registration and certification of warehouses and for these and other purposes establishes the Warehouse Licensing Authority. The Authority shall be a body corporate and shall: (a) certify warehouses; (b) approve negotiable warehouse receipt books; and (c) perform any other function incidental or conducive to the carrying out of its functions under this Act or any other law. A farmer may, individually or in association, create in favour of any person a charge on any farming stock, additional asset or other agricultural asset, security for- (a) inputs or other items required for cultivation; (b) sums advanced or to be advanced to the farmer; or (c) sums paid or to be paid on the farmer's behalf under any guarantee; and such security may cover any interest, commission or charge thereon. An agricultural charge may be fixed or floating and may be in any form and made upon such conditions as the parties to the charge may agree, and any surety may be made a party to the charge. A contract for the advancement to a farmer of inputs or other items required for cultivation shall be in accordance with this Act. The Act also provides for negotiation and transfer of warehouse receipts and the disposal of (perishable) goods from warehouses, and stipulates rights and obligations of warehouse operators. The Arbitration Act, 2000, shall apply to the settlement of any dispute arising as a result of the interpretation or application of the provisions of this Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries
