Policy: Revised Amhara National Regional State Zonal Administrative Reestablishment and Determination of Powers and Duties, Council of the Regional Government Regulation No. 78/2010.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Council of the Amhara Regional Government establishes zonal administrations in the Regional State of Amhara, which shall carry out their functions on behalf of the regional government. The Regulation sets out duties and powers of these zonal administrations and provides with respect to their organization and administration. The administration shall consist of a) the Council of zonal administration; b) the Chief administrator; and, c) the Office of the administration. The zonal Chief Administrator shall be selected and appointed by the head of the regional government. The Chief Administrator is the main executive body and the chairperson of the council of administration and shall administer the zone on behalf of the regional government. The Council shall consist of heads of the zonal executive bodies, including amongst others, the Head of the Agricultural Department, the Head of the Water Resource Development Department, and the Head of the Environmental Protection, Rural Land Administration & Use Department.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water

Policy: Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules, 2010.
Policy_Content: The Wetland Conservation and Management Rules ensure better management, conservation and prevention of degradation of existing wetlands in India. These Rules have been drafted by the Ministry of Environment and Forests and a Central Wetland Regulatory Authority has been set up to ensure proper implementation of the Rules and perform all its functions. The Authority shall have a number of expert members to ensure that wetland conservation is carried out in the best possible manner. In order to ensure there is no further degradation of wetlands, the Rules specify activities which are prohibited as harmful to wetlands such as industrialization, construction, dumping of untreated waste, reclamation etc. Other activities such as harvesting and dredging may be carried out in the wetlands provided prior permission from the concerned authorities. Any action which may damage the habitat of these areas shall not be permitted unless authorized. Appeals shall apply in accordance to the National Green Tribunal Act, 2010 (19 of 2010).
Subject: Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Wetlands,Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Wildlife products,National parks,Protection of habitats,Cultural heritage,Management/conservation,Classification/declassification,Protected area

Entry into force notes: The Rules will enter into force on the date of their publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: National Food Security Strategy
Policy_Content: National Food Security Strategy is a national Strategy with a cross-sectoral approach. The main objectives of the Strategy are stated as to cut food insecurity by one-third by 2015, to make 90 percent of the population food secure by 2020 and to reduce child malnutrition by at least one percentage point per annum.

Policy: National Social Development Policy 2010.
Policy_Content: This National Social Development Policy is a sectoral policy document at national level. The Policy aims to provide policy guidelines for the Department of Social Development and other stakeholders in social service delivery. The overall policy goal of the National Social Development Policy is to improve the quality of life and human well-being of all Swazis through the provision of appropriate and sustainable social services that are developmental in orientation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition

Policy: Environment Protection Agency (Environmental Impact Assessment Licence) Regulations, 2010 (S.I. No. 14 of 2010).
Policy_Content: These Regulations require persons who wish to undertake or cause to be undertaken any of the projects set out in the First Schedule to the Environment Protection Agency Act, 2008 to apply to the Environment Protection Agency for a licence. On the approval of the environment impact assessment submitted under section 26 of the Act, the Agency shall issue a licence. The application shall be in the form set out in the First Schedule and a licence in the form as set out in Schedule 2. The Agency shall monitor the activities of a licence holder for the purpose of ensuring that the terms and conditions of the licence and other requirements of the Act are complied with. The monitoring of the activities of a licence holder shall relate to– (a) the area and complexity of the project and the project site; (b) the potential area of impact of the project; (c) the intensity of the impact; (d) whether there is a substantial change or modification in the project or in the manner in which the project is being undertaken; (e) whether the project poses a threat to the environment which could not have been reasonably foreseen at the time of the submission of the environmental impact assessment; (f) the implementation of mitigation  measures provided for in the environmental impact assessment. The fees charged for the issuance of a licence shall be on a weighted points system.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Monitoring,EIA,Authorization/permit,Environmental fees/charges,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control,Effluent waste water/discharge
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Health Sector Development Program IV (2010/11 – 2014/15).
Policy_Content: This Health Sector Development Program (HSDP) IV is a five-year nationwide sectoral document - situated within the government’s overall national vision to become a middle-income country - aiming at guiding the development of sub-national plans and setting the rules of engagement in the health sector in order to achieve the Vision of "seeing healthy, productive, and prosperous Ethiopians". The consequent Mission for the sector will be to reduce morbidity, mortality and disability and improve the health status of the Ethiopian people through providing and regulating a comprehensive package of promotive, preventive, curative and rehabilitative health services via a decentralized and democratized health system. To do so, the health sector of Ethiopia will have to stretch to attain its objectives of reaching every section of the population with effective health interventions. The document focuses on the following three key areas of intervention in the health sector (1) Excellence in health service delivery; (2) Excellence in leadership and governance; and (3) Excellence in health infrastructure and resources. To achieve the overall goal of the Strategy, ten strategic objectives are identified, as follows (i) improve access to health services; (ii) improve community ownership; (iii) maximize resource mobilization and utilization; (iv) improve quality of health services; (v) improve public health emergency preparedness and response; (vi) improve pharmaceutical supply and services; (vii) improve regulatory system; (viii) improve evidence-based decision making by harmonization and alignment; (ix) improve health infrastructure; and (x) improve human capital and leadership.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, General
Keyword: Public health,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Climate change,Poverty,Disasters,Food security,Nutrition,Breastfeeding/infant food
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Regulation establishing formula for calculating value of noise index.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of four paragraph, lays down the formula for calculating value of noise index. Protection from noise consists in assuring as good as possible acoustic state of the environment, in particular by keeping the level of noise below acceptable or at least on this level. When calculating the value of noise index one should take into consideration changeability of noise sources over a year and changeability of atmospheric conditions and factors affecting spreading of noise in the environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 16 November 2010.

Policy: Protection of the Sea Legislation Amendment Act 2010 (No. 116 of 2010).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Protection of the Sea (Prevention of Pollution from Ships) Act 1983 so as to give effect to a revision of Annex VI (Air Pollution) of MARPOL as adopted by the Marine Environment Protection Committee of the International Maritime Organization (IMO). The main effect of the revised Annex VI is to provide for a stepped reduction in the sulphur level in fuel oil used in ships to reduce the emission of sulphur oxides.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1174 validating the Regulation on the issuance of authorization for flaring of associated oilwell gas.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities for the issuance or refusal of the issuance by the authorized environmental bodies of authorization for for flaring of associated oilwell gas entailing emissions to the atmospheric air. The decision for the issuance of the aforesaid authorization shall be made by the authorized environmental institution within thirty days upon presentation by nature manager of the following documentation: (a) application (Annex 1); (b) copy of state registration of subsoil manager; and (c) plan of flaring test of oilwell approved by the authorized local body of state environmental institution.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1172 validating the Regulation on determining and mapping coastlines.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree sets forth the modalities for the accurate determination and mapping of the effective position of coastlines. The crossline between the surface of surface waterbodies (seas, lakes, rivers, ponds and water reservoirs) and the surface of dry land shall be established depending upon the determined water edge. Effective position of sea coastline shall be established at the maximum level of high tide and in the absence of such phenomenon in accordance with the surf line.

Policy: Regional Law No. 94-Z “On municipal land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of municipal land control and regulates the issues of protection of the rights of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs in the process of carrying out municipal land control. Municipal land control shall carry out the following tasks: (a) land law enforcement; (b) protection of municipal and public interests in the sphere of land tenure; (c) prevention of land offences; and (d) public participation in supervision over compliance with land requirements. Municipal land inspectors must ensure compliance by legal persons, individual entrepreneurs and natural persons of land legislation requirements.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Décret n°10-590/PM-RM du 5 novembre 2010 portant création de la Cellule d'Appui à la Décentralisation/Déconcentration de l'Energie et de l'Eau.
Policy_Content: Il est créé auprès du Ministre chargé de l’Énergie et de l’Eau, une Cellule dénommée Cellule d’Appui à la Décentralisation/Déconcentration de l’Énergie et de l’Eau (CADDEE). La Cellule d’Appui à la Décentralisation/ Déconcentration de l’Energie et de l’Eau a pour mission de promouvoir la politique de décentralisation et de déconcentration dans la domaine de l’énergie et de l’eau. A cet effet, elle est chargée de: suivre le processus de transfert des compétences et des ressources de l’eau aux Collectivités Territoriales; proposer au Ministre en charge de l’énergie et de l’eau toutes mesures tendant à assurer le transfert des ressources liées à l’exercice des compétences transférées; concevoir et diffuser les outils d’accompagnement des Collectivités; participer à la préparation et au suivi des accords de coopération avec les Partenaires Techniques et Financiers; promouvoir la décentralisation par des activités d’information et de communication; appuyer les Directions Nationales de l’Energie et de l’Hydraulique dans leur activités de décentralisation et de déconcentration; produire un rapport périodique sur l’état d’avancement du transfert des compétences et des ressources de l’Etat aux Collectivités Territoriales.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Environment Court Act, 2010.
Policy_Content: The Act, consisting of 24 sections, amends and consolidates the existing law in establishing courts and related matters to expedite the trial of environmental crimes. It establishes administrative and legal proceedings of the above mentioned Environment Court, as well requirements to be met by said court, which may direct the investigating officer or person for further investigation into a criminal case related to a case pending against him and may determine the deadline for reporting the report. The court may impose any power environment passed by this Act or the Environment Law. A lawyer appointed by the Director General shall conduct all the cases related to the trial in the Environment Court and the prosecuted lawyer shall be deemed to be a special public prosecutor in the case of a special public prosecutor and civil nature case, in case of prosecution:  Provided that empowered by the Inspector or the Director General Any officer to assist the lawyer in managing the case. Subject to the provisions of this Act, in relation to the trial and settlement of compensation cases, the provisions of the Code of Civil Procedure shall apply and in that case, the Court of the Environment shall be deemed to be a civil court and enforce all the powers of the Civil Court in the trial of any compensation suit under this Act.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force immediately.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 268 validating the Regulation on Chief State Technical Inspection subordinated to the Ministry of Agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that Chief State Technical Inspection subordinated to the Ministry of Agriculture shall be state body performing state regulation, control and supervisory functions related to inspection of tractors, field engines, self-propelled vehicles, combined harvesters and other special agricultural technical equipment with a view of compliance with technical requirements related to operation of the aforesaid equipment, observance of transportation rules and regulations and observance of safety and technological requirements in the process of execution of mechanized work.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Authorization for Burrard Thermal Electricity Regulation (B.C. Reg. 319/2010).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is made under the Clean Energy Act. Section 2 establishes that the Authority shall operate Burrard Thermal only when the authority is reasonably satisfied that all of its other sources of electricity in British Columbia, including electricity provided to the authority from a third party by agreement, are or will be, in aggregate, unable to provide the authority with sufficient megawatts of capacity to meet the electricity needs of the authority's customers. The text consists of 2 sections.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Electricity Self-Sufficiency Regulation (B.C. Reg. 315/2010).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation enacts the Clean Energy Act. For the purpose of the present Regulation “critical water conditions” means the most adverse sequence of stream flows occurring within the historical record. Section 3 establishes that the water conditions prescribed for the purposes of the definition of "heritage energy capability" in section 6 (1) of the Act are critical water conditions as defined in this Regulation. The text consists of 3 sections.
Subject: Energy

El objetivo es promover la construcción de valores, conocimientos y actitudes que conduzcan hacia la formación de una conciencia ambiental y el desarrollo sostenible, basado en la equidad y el respeto por la diversidad blol6gica.

Policy_Content: This Act aims to set targets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and increase renewable energy use and generation in the Australian Capital Territory (ACT); provide for monitoring of and reporting on progress made in the ACT to meet targets; facilitate the government’s development of policies and programmes to meet the targets and to address and adapt to climate change; and to encourage private entities to take action to address climate change and recognize the entities that take action.

Policy: New Zealand Coastal Policy Statement 2010.
Policy_Content: The New Zealand Coastal Policy Statement (NZCPS) is a national policy statement under the Resource Management Act 1991. The purpose of the NZCPS is to state policies in order to achieve the purpose of the Act in relation to the coastal environment of New Zealand. The coastal environment has characteristics, qualities and uses that mean there are particular challenges in promoting sustainable management: the coastal environment varies in nature and extent around the country; coastal environment contains established infrastructure, such as ports, airports, railways, roads and submarine cables; natural and physical resources important to the economic and social wellbeing of the nation and communities; the natural and recreational attributes of the coast and its attraction as a place to live and visit combine with a growing pressure on coastal space and other resources; activities inland can have a major impact on coastal water quality; activities in the coastal environment are susceptible to the effects of natural hazards and those associated with climate change; there is continuing and growing demand for coastal space and resources for commercial activities as diverse as aquaculture and sand mining; and the coast has particular importance to tangata whenua, including as kaitiaki.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Marine pollution,Environmental planning,Effluent waste water/discharge,Authorization/permit,Sustainable use,Water conservation zone,Inland waters,Traditional rights/customary rights,Marine area,Protection of environment,Protection of habitats,Protection of species,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Cultural heritage,Ecosystem preservation

Policy: Commission Decision 2010/670/EU laying down criteria and measures for the financing of commercial demonstration projects that aim at the environmentally safe capture and geological storage of CO 2 as well as demonstration projects of innovative renewable energy technologies under the scheme for greenhouse gas emission allowance trading within the Community established by Directive 2003/87/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council.
Policy_Content: This Decision lays down rules and criteria for the following: (1) the selection of commercial demonstration projects that aim at the environmentally safe capture and geological storage of CO 2 and demonstration projects of innovative renewable energy technologies; (2) the monetization of the allowances for the support of CCS and RES demonstration projects; (3) the disbursement of revenues and the implementation of CCS and RES demonstration projects.

Policy_Content: This Decree amends certain parts of Decree No. 437/2005 so as to implement the provisions set forth by Directive 2008/112/EC on the classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures. More specifically, article 2 (paragraphs 2 and 7) are hereby amended.

Policy: Regional Law No. 73 “On tourism”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations dealing with organization and state support of tourism and, in particular, healthcare and recreational tourism in the natural areas, including objects of historical and cultural heritage. Regional Government shall validate the list of tourist resources and register objects of tourism. State support of tourism includes subsidies from regional budget for promotion of tourism.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 169-Z “On subsoil management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of concession of subsoil, prospecting, exploration, mining of common widespread minerals. Subsoil can be concede either for carrying one or a combination of more than one of the aforesaid activities. Subsoil shall be conceded by decisions of the authorized state regional institution in the sphere of subsoil management. Subsoil management shall be performed in accordance with licence requiring payment of licence fees. Concession of subsoil for management shall be allowed exclusively after state assessment of the stock of minerals in mineral deposits.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 879 - Ley de derechos y culturas indígenas para el Estado de Veracruz-Llave.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce y protege los derechos de los pueblos y comunidades de indígenas en el Estado de Veracruz, a fin de garantizar su desarrollo económico y humano. Se reconoce el derecho de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas a preservar la integridad de sus territorios, a conservar y mejorar el hábitat, al uso y disfrute colectivo de los recursos naturales, quedando prohibidos los reacomodos y desplazamientos de comunidades de indígenas, a excepción de aquellos casos que provengan de las necesidades de dichas comunidades o se motiven por cuestiones de salud, riesgo de desastres naturales, por mandato judicial o cuando el interés público lo requiera. Además las Ley reconoce expresamente los derechos sociales de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas (y en especial de las mujeres indígenas), que contemplan el derecho a la alimentación. También se establecen disposiciones relativas a los sistemas de justicia de las comunidades indígenas.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Indigenous peoples,Right to food,Human rights,Common property,Dispute settlement,Sustainable development,Community management,Gender
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 10/2010 approving the Harbours' Law of Cape Verde.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree approves the Harbours' Law of Cape Verde. The Harbours' Law, consisting of 13 Titles, divided into 96 articles, establishes the legal regime of ports, harbour and terminals areas, regulates the access and the performing of any activity and operations related to harbour sector, specifying the institutional framework of the public and individual interventions for any port under Cape Verdean jurisdiction. It also establishes port classification, definition of legal regime of harbour operation and administrative authorities entitled to regulate the economic sector of ports, determining tariffs and prices, norms related to environmental protection and discharge, treatment and waste disposal. Offences for illegal activities are appended to the text.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 870 validating Technical regulation on safety requirements for gas distribution and consumption network.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Ministerial Decree shall be to ensure protection of environment, human life and health, animals and plants, and also energy efficiency. It shall be applicable to projecting, construction, re-construction, conservation and liquidation of gas distribution and consumption network. Gas distribution and consumption network shall guarantee safety and energy efficiency applicable to transportation of natural gas in accordance with the requirements set by project documentation and operating conditions. Dump gas pipelines and blow off gas pipelines shall be located in the areas so as to ensure maximum dispersion of hazardous substances concentration of which in the atmospheric air must not exceed the established limits.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Executive Decree No. 161/10 approving the Regulation of the National Direction for Renewable Energies (DNER).
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the National Direction for Renewable Energies (DNER). This Regulation, consisting of 5 Chapters and 2 Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, which is an executive service of the Ministry of Energy and Waters. It is entitled to: design, promote, assess, implement and carry out follow-up on policies related to renewable energy sector. DNER is responsible to: design, propose and implement the policy on the development and exploitation of renewable energies, implementing its execution; to promote the diversification of the National energy, in particular through the efficient use of renewable energies; to participate in scientific research and technological actions related to renewable energies; assess, certify and monitor renewable energy technologies in order to preserve and protect environmental, quality and security patterns; licensing renewable energy infrastructures and maintain respective cadastre; etc.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Executive Decree enters into force on the day after its publication.

This Regulation, consisting of 6 Chapters and 2 Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, entitled: to give technical support to the Ministry, to guarantee support and carry out inspections on the implementation of ministerial objectives, as well as for the organization and functioning of different related services or organs.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 160/10 approving the Regulation of the National Direction for Water Resources (DNRH).
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the National Direction for Water Resources (DNRH). This Regulation, consisting of 5 Chapters and 2 Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, which is an executive service of the Ministry of Energy and Waters. It is entitled to: promote and coordinate the general classification of water resources in a permanent way in quality and quantity, guaranteeing the integrated planning and management of water resources and the construction of water works; to promote and coordinate the designing of the National Plan of water resources; to promote and coordinate the designing of general plans for water resources exploitation, including superficial and underground waters; to license, according to enforced legislation, and to establish the baselines for designing integrated water resources use plans and hydrographical basin; etc.
Subject: Energy, Water
Keyword: Institution,Research,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Certification,Hydropower generation,Water quality standards,Waterworks,Policy/planning

Policy: Ley Nº 26.639 - Régimen de Presupuestos Mínimos para la Preservación de los Glaciares y del Ambiente Periglacial.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece los presupuestos mínimos para la protección de los glaciares y del ambiente periglacial con el fin de preservarlos como reservas estratégicas de recursos hídricos para el consumo humano; para la agricultura y como proveedores de agua para la recarga de cuencas hidrográficas; para la protección de la biodiversidad; como fuente de información científica y como atractivo turístico. Según lo dispuesto por el artículo 1º, los glaciares constituyen bienes de carácter público. En virtud del artículo 3º se crea el Inventario Nacional de Glaciares, donde se individualizarán todos los glaciares y geoformas periglaciares que actúan como reservas hídricas existentes en el territorio nacional con toda la información necesaria para su adecuada protección, control y monitoreo. Las restantes disposiciones se refieren a las actividades que quedan prohibidas en los glaciares y a la Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental requerida para determinados proyectos y actividades que puedan afectar a los mismos.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regulation on the organization of the natural gas market.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides all measures and standards for the correct performance of the natural gas market and related activities on the Croatian territory, determines the procedure for the reservation and allocation of gas system capacities, defines all necessary rules for the trade of capacities and the balancing of the gas system, rules for use of operational stocks, the procedure for the change of gas supplier and other rules for the implementation of all important principles aimed to grant a correct, sustainable and safe gas market management.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Marine Environment Protection and Management Law (2010)
Policy_Content: The Law determines principles for the protection and management of the marine environment of Latvia in order to achieve and preserve good marine environmental status; facilitate sustainable use of the sea and marine ecosystem; promote integration of the environmental protection requirements and measures necessary for achievement of good marine environmental status in the policy planning documents and laws and regulations of those fields which affect marine environment; and facilitate achievement of the objectives of marine environment protection and preservation and sustainable use of marine resources laid down in the international agreements binding on Latvia. The Law determines the continental shelf and exclusive economic zone of Latvia, as well as sovereign rights and jurisdiction in the continental shelf and exclusive economic zone thereof, taking into account the provisions of the international agreements; procedures by which Latvia must co-operate with other countries in the Baltic Sea region, i.e., in the region the boundaries of which are determined in Article 1 of the Convention on the Protection of the Marine Environment of the Baltic Sea Area (Helsinki Convention), in the drawing up and implementation of the marine strategy; procedures by which the marine strategy must be drawn up and implemented, taking into account ecosystem approach and general environmental protection principles, as well as possible transboundary impact on the marine environmental status in the Baltic Sea region; and the rights and obligations of the sea users. The Law does not however apply for the activities which are performed in the sea within the framework of the state defence or state security safeguarding. Such activities must be performed in the sea taking into account the purpose of this Law as possible.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Keyword: Marine pollution,Marine area,Marine protected areas,Maritime zone,Sustainable development,Ecosystem preservation,Policy/planning,International agreement-implementation,Continental shelf,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone,International relations/cooperation,Procedural matters,Survey/mapping,Protected area
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Ordonnance sur la recherche agronomique (ORAgr).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance concerne la recherche agronomique. L’article 1er établit que la Confédération mène une recherche agronomique élaborant les connaissances scientifiques et les bases techniques en vue d’une agriculture et d’une filière alimentaire durables, de la prise de décisions en matière de politique agricole et de l’exécution de tâches légales. Le texte comprend 18 articles divisés en 5 sections comme suit: But et orientation (1er); Organisation (2); Tâches et compétences d’Agroscope (3); Mandats et contributions en matière de recherche (4); Dispositions finales (5).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er janvier 2011.
